folder.name: Top Level
folder.tiptext: The top level contains the core ActionScript classes and global functions.

folder.name: ArgumentError
folder.tiptext: The ArgumentError class represents an error that occurs when the arguments supplied in a function do not match the arguments defined for that function.

string.name: ArgumentError
string.tiptext: Creates an ArgumentError object.

folder.name: arguments
folder.tiptext: An arguments object is used to store and access a function's arguments.

string.name: callee
string.tiptext: A reference to the currently executing function.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: The number of arguments passed to the function.

folder.name: Array
folder.tiptext: The Array class lets you access and manipulate arrays.

string.name: Array
string.tiptext: Lets you create an array of the specified number of elements.

string.name: Array
string.tiptext: Lets you create an array that contains the specified elements.

string.name: concat
string.tiptext: Concatenates the elements specified in the parameters.

string.name: every
string.tiptext: Executes a test function on each item in the array until an item is reached that returns false for the specified function.

string.name: filter
string.tiptext: Executes a test function on each item in the array and constructs a new array for all items that return true for the specified function.

string.name: forEach
string.tiptext: Executes a function on each item in the array.

string.name: indexOf
string.tiptext: Searches for an item in an array by using strict equality (===) and returns the index position of the item.

string.name: join
string.tiptext: Converts the elements in an array to strings.

string.name: lastIndexOf
string.tiptext: Searches for an item in an array, working backward from the last item, and returns the index position of the matching item using strict equality (===).

string.name: map
string.tiptext: Executes a function on each item in an array, and constructs a new array of items corresponding to the results of the function on each item in the original array.

string.name: pop
string.tiptext: Removes the last element from an array and returns the value of that element.

string.name: push
string.tiptext: Adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new length of the array.

string.name: reverse
string.tiptext: Reverses the array in place.

string.name: shift
string.tiptext: Removes the first element from an array and returns that element.

string.name: slice
string.tiptext: Returns a new array that consists of a range of elements from the original array.

string.name: some
string.tiptext: Executes a test function on each item in the array until an item is reached that returns true.

string.name: sort
string.tiptext: Sorts the elements in an array.

string.name: sortOn
string.tiptext: Sorts the elements in an array according to one or more fields in the array.

string.name: splice
string.tiptext: Adds elements to and removes elements from an array.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that represents the elements in the specified array.

string.name: toLocaleString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that represents the elements in the specified array.

string.name: unshift
string.tiptext: Adds one or more elements to the beginning of an array and returns the new length of the array.

string.name: CASEINSENSITIVE
string.tiptext: Specifies case-insensitive sorting for the Array class sorting methods.

string.name: DESCENDING
string.tiptext: Specifies descending sorting for the Array class sorting methods.

string.name: NUMERIC
string.tiptext: Specifies numeric (instead of character-string) sorting for the Array class sorting methods.

string.name: RETURNINDEXEDARRAY
string.tiptext: Specifies that a sort returns an array that consists of array indices.

string.name: UNIQUESORT
string.tiptext: Specifies the unique sorting requirement for the Array class sorting methods.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: A non-negative integer specifying the number of elements in the array.

folder.name: Boolean
folder.tiptext: A Boolean object is a data type that can have one of two values, either true or false, used for logical operations.

string.name: Boolean
string.tiptext: Creates a Boolean object with the specified value.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns the string representation ("true" or "false") of the Boolean object.

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Returns true if the value of the specified Boolean object is true; false otherwise.

folder.name: Date
folder.tiptext: The Date class represents date and time information.

string.name: Date
string.tiptext: Constructs a new Date object that holds the specified date and time.

string.name: UTC
string.tiptext: Returns the number of milliseconds between midnight on January 1, 1970, universal time, and the time specified in the parameters.

string.name: getDate
string.tiptext: Returns the day of the month (an integer from 1 to 31) specified by a Date object according to local time.

string.name: getDay
string.tiptext: Returns the day of the week (0 for Sunday, 1 for Monday, and so on) specified by this Date according to local time.

string.name: getFullYear
string.tiptext: Returns the full year (a four-digit number, such as 2000) of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: getHours
string.tiptext: Returns the hour (an integer from 0 to 23) of the day portion of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: getMilliseconds
string.tiptext: Returns the milliseconds (an integer from 0 to 999) portion of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: getMinutes
string.tiptext: Returns the minutes (an integer from 0 to 59) portion of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: getMonth
string.tiptext: Returns the month (0 for January, 1 for February, and so on) portion of this Date according to local time.

string.name: getSeconds
string.tiptext: Returns the seconds (an integer from 0 to 59) portion of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: getTime
string.tiptext: Returns the number of milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970, universal time, for a Date object.

string.name: getTimezoneOffset
string.tiptext: Returns the difference, in minutes, between universal time (UTC) and the computer's local time.

string.name: getUTCDate
string.tiptext: Returns the day of the month (an integer from 1 to 31) of a Date object, according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: getUTCDay
string.tiptext: Returns the day of the week (0 for Sunday, 1 for Monday, and so on) of this Date according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: getUTCFullYear
string.tiptext: Returns the four-digit year of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: getUTCHours
string.tiptext: Returns the hour (an integer from 0 to 23) of the day of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: getUTCMilliseconds
string.tiptext: Returns the milliseconds (an integer from 0 to 999) portion of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: getUTCMinutes
string.tiptext: Returns the minutes (an integer from 0 to 59) portion of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: getUTCMonth
string.tiptext: Returns the month (0 [January] to 11 [December]) portion of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: getUTCSeconds
string.tiptext: Returns the seconds (an integer from 0 to 59) portion of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: parse
string.tiptext: Converts a string representing a date into a number equaling the number of milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970, UTC.

string.name: setDate
string.tiptext: Sets the day of the month, according to local time, and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setFullYear
string.tiptext: Sets the year, according to local time, and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setHours
string.tiptext: Sets the hour, according to local time, and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setMilliseconds
string.tiptext: Sets the milliseconds, according to local time, and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setMinutes
string.tiptext: Sets the minutes, according to local time, and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setMonth
string.tiptext: Sets the month and optionally the day of the month, according to local time, and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setSeconds
string.tiptext: Sets the seconds, according to local time, and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setTime
string.tiptext: Sets the date in milliseconds since midnight on January 1, 1970, and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setUTCDate
string.tiptext: Sets the day of the month, in universal time (UTC), and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setUTCFullYear
string.tiptext: Sets the year, in universal time (UTC), and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setUTCHours
string.tiptext: Sets the hour, in universal time (UTC), and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setUTCMilliseconds
string.tiptext: Sets the milliseconds, in universal time (UTC), and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setUTCMinutes
string.tiptext: Sets the minutes, in universal time (UTC), and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setUTCMonth
string.tiptext: Sets the month, and optionally the day, in universal time(UTC) and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: setUTCSeconds
string.tiptext: Sets the seconds, and optionally the milliseconds, in universal time (UTC) and returns the new time in milliseconds.

string.name: toDateString
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the day and date only, and does not include the time or timezone.

string.name: toTimeString
string.tiptext: Returns a String representation of the time and timezone only, and does not include the day and date.

string.name: toLocaleString
string.tiptext: Returns a String representation of the day, date, time, given in local time.

string.name: toLocaleDateString
string.tiptext: Returns a String representation of the day and date only, and does not include the time or timezone.

string.name: toLocaleTimeString
string.tiptext: Returns a String representation of the time only, and does not include the day, date, year, or timezone.

string.name: toUTCString
string.tiptext: Returns a String representation of the day, date, and time in universal time (UTC).

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a String representation of the day, date, time, and timezone.

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Returns the number of milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970, universal time, for a Date object.

string.name: fullYear
string.tiptext: The full year (a four-digit number, such as 2000) of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: month
string.tiptext: The month (0 for January, 1 for February, and so on) portion of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: date
string.tiptext: The day of the month (an integer from 1 to 31) specified by a Date object according to local time.

string.name: hours
string.tiptext: The hour (an integer from 0 to 23) of the day portion of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: minutes
string.tiptext: The minutes (an integer from 0 to 59) portion of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: seconds
string.tiptext: The seconds (an integer from 0 to 59) portion of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: milliseconds
string.tiptext: The milliseconds (an integer from 0 to 999) portion of a Date object according to local time.

string.name: fullYearUTC
string.tiptext: The four-digit year of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: monthUTC
string.tiptext: The month (0 [January] to 11 [December]) portion of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: dateUTC
string.tiptext: The day of the month (an integer from 1 to 31) of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: hoursUTC
string.tiptext: The hour (an integer from 0 to 23) of the day of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: minutesUTC
string.tiptext: The minutes (an integer from 0 to 59) portion of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: secondsUTC
string.tiptext: The seconds (an integer from 0 to 59) portion of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: millisecondsUTC
string.tiptext: The milliseconds (an integer from 0 to 999) portion of a Date object according to universal time (UTC).

string.name: time
string.tiptext: The number of milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970, universal time, for a Date object.

string.name: timezoneOffset
string.tiptext: The difference, in minutes, between universal time (UTC) and the computer's local time.

string.name: day
string.tiptext: The day of the week (0 for Sunday, 1 for Monday, and so on) specified by this Date according to local time.

string.name: dayUTC
string.tiptext: The day of the week (0 for Sunday, 1 for Monday, and so on) of this Date according to universal time (UTC).

folder.name: DefinitionError
folder.tiptext: The DefinitionError class represents an error that occurs when user code attempts to define an identifier that is already defined.

string.name: DefinitionError
string.tiptext: Creates a new DefinitionError object.

folder.name: Error
folder.tiptext: The Error class contains information about an error that occurred in a script.

string.name: Error
string.tiptext: Creates a new Error instance with the specified error message.

string.name: getStackTrace
string.tiptext: Returns the call stack for an error in a readable form.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns the error message, or the word "Error" if the message is undefined.

string.name: message
string.tiptext: Contains the message associated with the Error object.

string.name: name
string.tiptext: Contains the name of the Error object.

string.name: errorID
string.tiptext: Contains the reference number associated with the specific error message.

folder.name: EvalError
folder.tiptext: The EvalError class represents an error that occurs when user code calls the eval() function or attempts to use the new operator with the Function object.

string.name: EvalError
string.tiptext: Creates a new EvalError object.

folder.name: Function
folder.tiptext: A function is the basic unit of code that can be invoked in ActionScript.

string.name: apply
string.tiptext: Specifies the object instance on which the Function is called.

string.name: call
string.tiptext: Invokes this Function.

folder.name: int
folder.tiptext: The int class lets you work with the data type representing a 32-bit signed integer.

string.name: int
string.tiptext: Constructor; creates a new int object.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns the string representation of an int object.

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Returns the primitive value of the specified int object.

string.name: toFixed
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the number in fixed-point notation.

string.name: toExponential
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the number in exponential notation.

string.name: toPrecision
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the number either in exponential notation or in fixed-point notation.

string.name: MAX_VALUE
string.tiptext: The largest representable 32-bit signed integer, which is 2,147,483,647.

string.name: MIN_VALUE
string.tiptext: The smallest representable 32-bit signed integer, which is -2,147,483,648.

folder.name: Math
folder.tiptext: The Math class contains methods and constants that represent common mathematical functions and values.

string.name: abs
string.tiptext: Returns the absolute value of the specified Number.

string.name: acos
string.tiptext: Returns the arc cosine, in radians, of the specified Number.

string.name: asin
string.tiptext: Returns the value, in radians, of the arc sine of the specified Number parameter.

string.name: atan
string.tiptext: Returns the angle, in radians, whose tangent is specified by parameter val.

string.name: atan2
string.tiptext: Returns the angle of the point y/x in radians, when measured counterclockwise from a circle's x axis.

string.name: ceil
string.tiptext: Returns the ceiling of the specified number or expression.

string.name: cos
string.tiptext: Returns the cosine of the specified angle.

string.name: exp
string.tiptext: Returns the value of the base of the natural logarithm (e), to the power of the exponent specified in the parameter val.

string.name: floor
string.tiptext: Returns the floor of the number or expression specified in the parameter val.

string.name: log
string.tiptext: Returns the natural logarithm of parameter val.

string.name: max
string.tiptext: Evaluates parameters val1 and val2 and returns the larger value.

string.name: min
string.tiptext: Evaluates parameters val1 and val2 and returns the smaller value.

string.name: pow
string.tiptext: Returns val1 to the power of val2.

string.name: random
string.tiptext: Returns a pseudo-random number n, where 0 <= n < 1.

string.name: round
string.tiptext: Returns the value of parameter val rounded up or down to the nearest integer.

string.name: sin
string.tiptext: Returns the sine of the specified angle.

string.name: sqrt
string.tiptext: Returns the square root of the specified number.

string.name: tan
string.tiptext: Returns the tangent of the specified angle.

string.name: E
string.tiptext: A mathematical constant for the base of natural logarithms, expressed as e.

string.name: LN10
string.tiptext: A mathematical constant for the natural logarithm of 10, expressed as loge10, with an approximate value of 2.302585092994046.

string.name: LN2
string.tiptext: A mathematical constant for the natural logarithm of 2, expressed as loge2, with an approximate value of 0.6931471805599453.

string.name: LOG10E
string.tiptext: A mathematical constant for the base-10 logarithm of the constant e (Math.E), expressed as log10e, with an approximate value of 0.4342944819032518.

string.name: LOG2E
string.tiptext: A mathematical constant for the base-2 logarithm of the constant e, expressed as log2e, with an approximate value of 1.442695040888963387.

string.name: PI
string.tiptext: A mathematical constant for the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter, expressed as pi, with a value of 3.141592653589793.

string.name: SQRT1_2
string.tiptext: A mathematical constant for the square root of one-half, with an approximate value of 0.7071067811865476.

string.name: SQRT2
string.tiptext: A mathematical constant for the square root of 2, with an approximate value of 1.4142135623730951.

folder.name: Namespace
folder.tiptext: The Namespace class contains methods and properties for defining and working with namespaces.

string.name: Namespace
string.tiptext: Creates a Namespace object, given the uriValue.

string.name: Namespace
string.tiptext: Creates a Namespace object, given the prefixValue and uriValue.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Equivalent to the Namespace.uri property.

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Equivalent to the Namespace.uri property.

string.name: prefix
string.tiptext: The prefix of the namespace.

string.name: uri
string.tiptext: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the namespace.

folder.name: Number
folder.tiptext: A data type representing an IEEE-754 double-precision floating-point number.

string.name: Number
string.tiptext: Creates a Number with the specified value.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns the string representation of this Number using the specified radix parameter as the numeric base.

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Returns the primitive value type of the specified Number object.

string.name: toFixed
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the number in fixed-point notation.

string.name: toExponential
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the number in exponential notation.

string.name: toPrecision
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the number either in exponential notation or in fixed-point notation.

string.name: MAX_VALUE
string.tiptext: The largest representable number (double-precision IEEE-754).

string.name: MIN_VALUE
string.tiptext: The smallest representable non-negative, non-zero, number (double-precision IEEE-754).

string.name: NaN
string.tiptext: The IEEE-754 value representing Not a Number (NaN).

string.name: NEGATIVE_INFINITY
string.tiptext: Specifies the IEEE-754 value representing negative infinity.

string.name: POSITIVE_INFINITY
string.tiptext: Specifies the IEEE-754 value representing positive infinity.

folder.name: Object
folder.tiptext: The Object class is at the root of the ActionScript class hierarchy.

string.name: Object
string.tiptext: Creates an Object object and stores a reference to the object's constructor method in the object's constructor property.

string.name: hasOwnProperty
string.tiptext: Indicates whether an object has a specified property defined.

string.name: propertyIsEnumerable
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the specified property exists and is enumerable.

string.name: isPrototypeOf
string.tiptext: Indicates whether an instance of the Object class is in the prototype chain of the object specified as the parameter.

string.name: setPropertyIsEnumerable
string.tiptext: Sets the availability of a dynamic property for loop operations.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns the string representation of the specified object.

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Returns the primitive value of the specified object.

string.name: prototype
string.tiptext: A reference to the prototype object of a class or function object.

string.name: constructor
string.tiptext: A reference to the class object or constructor function for a given object instance.

folder.name: QName
folder.tiptext: QName objects represent qualified names of XML elements and attributes.

string.name: QName
string.tiptext: Creates a QName object with a URI object from a Namespace object and a localName from a QName object.

string.name: QName
string.tiptext: Creates a QName object that is a copy of another QName object.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string composed of the URI, and the local name for the QName object, separated by "::".

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Returns the QName object.

string.name: localName
string.tiptext: The local name of the QName object.

string.name: uri
string.tiptext: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the QName object.

folder.name: RangeError
folder.tiptext: A RangeError exception is thrown when a numeric value is outside the acceptable range.

string.name: RangeError
string.tiptext: Creates a new RangeError object.

folder.name: ReferenceError
folder.tiptext: A ReferenceError exception is thrown when a reference to an undefined property is attempted on a sealed (nondynamic) object.

string.name: ReferenceError
string.tiptext: Creates a new ReferenceError object.

folder.name: RegExp
folder.tiptext: The RegExp class lets you work with regular expressions, which are patterns that you can use to perform searches in strings and to replace text in strings.

string.name: RegExp
string.tiptext: Lets you construct a regular expression from two strings.

string.name: exec
string.tiptext: Performs a search for the regular expression on the given string str.

string.name: test
string.tiptext: Tests for the match of the regular expression in the given string str.

string.name: dotall
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the dot character (.) in a regular expression pattern matches new-line characters.

string.name: extended
string.tiptext: Specifies whether to use extended mode for the regular expression.

string.name: global
string.tiptext: Specifies whether to use global matching for the regular expression.

string.name: ignoreCase
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the regular expression ignores case sensitivity.

string.name: lastIndex
string.tiptext: Specifies the index position in the string at which to start the next search.

string.name: multiline
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the m (multiline) flag is set.

string.name: source
string.tiptext: Specifies the pattern portion of the regular expression.

folder.name: SecurityError
folder.tiptext: The SecurityError exception is thrown when some type of security violation takes place.

string.name: SecurityError
string.tiptext: Creates a new SecurityError object.

folder.name: String
folder.tiptext: The String class is a data type that represents a string of characters.

string.name: String
string.tiptext: Creates a new String object initialized to the specified string.

string.name: fromCharCode
string.tiptext: Returns a string comprising the characters represented by the Unicode character codes in the parameters.

string.name: charAt
string.tiptext: Returns the character in the position specified by the index parameter.

string.name: charCodeAt
string.tiptext: Returns the numeric Unicode character code of the character at the specified index.

string.name: concat
string.tiptext: Appends the supplied arguments to the end of the String object, converting them to strings if necessary, and returns the resulting string.

string.name: indexOf
string.tiptext: Searches the string and returns the position of the first occurrence of val found at or after startIndex within the calling string.

string.name: lastIndexOf
string.tiptext: Searches the string from right to left and returns the index of the last occurrence of val found before startIndex.

string.name: localeCompare
string.tiptext: Compares the sort order of two or more strings and returns the result of the comparison as an integer.

string.name: replace
string.tiptext: Matches the specifed pattern against the string and returns a new string in which the first match of pattern is replaced with the content specified by repl.

string.name: match
string.tiptext: Matches the specifed pattern against the string.

string.name: search
string.tiptext: Searches for the specifed pattern and returns the index of the first matching substring.

string.name: slice
string.tiptext: Returns a string that includes the startIndex character and all characters up to, but not including, the endIndex character.

string.name: split
string.tiptext: Splits a String object into an array of substrings by dividing it wherever the specified delimiter parameter occurs.

string.name: substr
string.tiptext: Returns a substring consisting of the characters that start at the specified startIndex and with a length specified by len.

string.name: substring
string.tiptext: Returns a string consisting of the character specified by startIndex and all characters up to endIndex - 1.

string.name: toLowerCase
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this string, with all uppercase characters converted to lowercase.

string.name: toLocaleLowerCase
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this string, with all uppercase characters converted to lowercase.

string.name: toUpperCase
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this string, with all lowercase characters converted to uppercase.

string.name: toLocaleUpperCase
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this string, with all lowercase characters converted to uppercase.

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Returns the primitive value of a String instance.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: An integer specifying the number of characters in the specified String object.

folder.name: SyntaxError
folder.tiptext: A SyntaxError exception is thrown when a parsing error occurs.

string.name: SyntaxError
string.tiptext: Creates a new SyntaxError object.

folder.name: TypeError
folder.tiptext: A TypeError exception is thrown when the actual type of an operand is different from the expected type.

string.name: TypeError
string.tiptext: Creates a new TypeError object.

folder.name: uint
folder.tiptext: The uint class provides methods for working with a data type representing a 32-bit unsigned integer.

string.name: uint
string.tiptext: Creates a new uint object.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns the string representation of a uint object.

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Returns the primitive uint type value of the specified uint object.

string.name: toFixed
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the number in fixed-point notation.

string.name: toExponential
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the number in exponential notation.

string.name: toPrecision
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the number either in exponential notation or in fixed-point notation.

string.name: MAX_VALUE
string.tiptext: The largest representable 32-bit unsigned integer, which is 4,294,967,295.

string.name: MIN_VALUE
string.tiptext: The smallest representable unsigned integer, which is 0.

folder.name: URIError
folder.tiptext: A URIError exception is thrown when one of the global URI handling functions is used in a way that is incompatible with its definition.

string.name: URIError
string.tiptext: Creates a new URIError object.

folder.name: VerifyError
folder.tiptext: The VerifyError class represents an error that occurs when a malformed or corrupted SWF file is encountered.

string.name: VerifyError
string.tiptext: Creates a new VerifyError object.

folder.name: XML
folder.tiptext: The XML class contains methods and properties for working with XML objects.

string.name: XML
string.tiptext: Creates a new XML object.

string.name: addNamespace
string.tiptext: Adds a namespace to the set of in-scope namespaces for the XML object.

string.name: appendChild
string.tiptext: Appends the given child to the end of the XML object's properties.

string.name: attribute
string.tiptext: Returns the XML value of the attribute that has the name matching the attributeName parameter.

string.name: attributes
string.tiptext: Returns a list of attribute values for the given XML object.

string.name: child
string.tiptext: Lists the children of an XML object.

string.name: childIndex
string.tiptext: Identifies the zero-indexed position of this XML object within the context of its parent.

string.name: children
string.tiptext: Lists the children of the XML object in the sequence in which they appear.

string.name: comments
string.tiptext: Lists the properties of the XML object that contain XML comments.

string.name: contains
string.tiptext: Compares the XML object against the given value parameter.

string.name: copy
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of the given XML object.

string.name: descendants
string.tiptext: Returns all descendants (children, grandchildren, great-grandchildren, and so on) of the XML object that have the given name parameter.

string.name: defaultSettings
string.tiptext: Returns an object with the following properties set to the default values: ignoreComments, ignoreProcessingInstructions, ignoreWhitespace, prettyIndent, and prettyPrinting.

string.name: elements
string.tiptext: Lists the elements of an XML object.

string.name: hasOwnProperty
string.tiptext: Checks to see whether the object has the property specified by the p parameter.

string.name: hasComplexContent
string.tiptext: Checks to see whether the XML object contains complex content.

string.name: hasSimpleContent
string.tiptext: Checks to see whether the XML object contains simple content.

string.name: inScopeNamespaces
string.tiptext: Lists the namespaces for the XML object, based on the object's parent.

string.name: insertChildAfter
string.tiptext: Inserts the given child2 parameter after the child1 parameter in this XML object and returns the resulting object.

string.name: insertChildBefore
string.tiptext: Inserts the given child2 parameter before the child1 parameter in this XML object and returns the resulting object.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: For XML objects, this method always returns the integer 1.

string.name: localName
string.tiptext: Gives the local name portion of the qualified name of the XML object.

string.name: name
string.tiptext: Gives the qualified name for the XML object.

string.name: namespace
string.tiptext: If no parameter is provided, gives the namespace associated with the qualified name of this XML object.

string.name: namespaceDeclarations
string.tiptext: Lists namespace declarations associated with the XML object in the context of its parent.

string.name: nodeKind
string.tiptext: Specifies the type of node: text, comment, processing-instruction, attribute, or element.

string.name: normalize
string.tiptext: For the XML object and all descendant XML objects, merges adjacent text nodes and eliminates empty text nodes.

string.name: parent
string.tiptext: Returns the parent of the XML object.

string.name: processingInstructions
string.tiptext: If a name parameter is provided, lists all the children of the XML object that contain processing instructions with that name.

string.name: prependChild
string.tiptext: Inserts a copy of the provided child object into the XML element before any existing XML properties for that element.

string.name: propertyIsEnumerable
string.tiptext: Checks whether the property p is in the set of properties that can be iterated in a for..in statement applied to the XML object.

string.name: removeNamespace
string.tiptext: Removes the given namespace for this object and all descendants.

string.name: replace
string.tiptext: Replaces the properties specified by the propertyName parameter with the given value parameter.

string.name: setChildren
string.tiptext: Replaces the child properties of the XML object with the specified set of XML properties, provided in the value parameter.

string.name: setLocalName
string.tiptext: Changes the local name of the XML object to the given name parameter.

string.name: setName
string.tiptext: Sets the name of the XML object to the given qualified name or attribute name.

string.name: setNamespace
string.tiptext: Sets the namespace associated with the XML object.

string.name: setSettings
string.tiptext: Sets values for the following XML properties: ignoreComments, ignoreProcessingInstructions, ignoreWhitespace, prettyIndent, and prettyPrinting.

string.name: settings
string.tiptext: Retrieves the following properties: ignoreComments, ignoreProcessingInstructions, ignoreWhitespace, prettyIndent, and prettyPrinting.

string.name: text
string.tiptext: Returns an XMLList object of all XML properties of the XML object that represent XML text nodes.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the XML object.

string.name: toXMLString
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the XML object.

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Returns the XML object.

string.name: ignoreComments
string.tiptext: Determines whether XML comments are ignored when XML objects parse the source XML data.

string.name: ignoreProcessingInstructions
string.tiptext: Determines whether XML processing instructions are ignored when XML objects parse the source XML data.

string.name: ignoreWhitespace
string.tiptext: Determines whether white space characters at the beginning and end of text nodes are ignored during parsing.

string.name: prettyPrinting
string.tiptext: Determines whether the toString() and toXMLString() methods normalize white space characters between some tags.

string.name: prettyIndent
string.tiptext: Determines the amount of indentation applied by the toString() and toXMLString() methods when the XML.prettyPrinting property is set to true.

folder.name: XMLList
folder.tiptext: The XMLList class contains methods for working with one or more XML elements.

string.name: XMLList
string.tiptext: Creates a new XMLList object.

string.name: attribute
string.tiptext: Calls the attribute() method of each XML object and returns an XMLList object of the results.

string.name: attributes
string.tiptext: Calls the attributes() method of each XML object and returns an XMLList object of attributes for each XML object.

string.name: child
string.tiptext: Calls the child() method of each XML object and returns an XMLList object that contains the results in order.

string.name: children
string.tiptext: Calls the children() method of each XML object and returns an XMLList object that contains the results.

string.name: comments
string.tiptext: Calls the comments() method of each XML object and returns an XMLList of comments.

string.name: contains
string.tiptext: Checks whether the XMLList object contains an XML object that is equal to the given value parameter.

string.name: copy
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of the given XMLList object.

string.name: descendants
string.tiptext: Returns all descendants (children, grandchildren, great-grandchildren, and so on) of the XML object that have the given name parameter.

string.name: elements
string.tiptext: Calls the elements() method of each XML object.

string.name: hasOwnProperty
string.tiptext: Checks for the property specified by p.

string.name: hasComplexContent
string.tiptext: Checks whether the XMLList object contains complex content.

string.name: hasSimpleContent
string.tiptext: Checks whether the XMLList object contains simple content.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: Returns the number of properties in the XMLList object.

string.name: normalize
string.tiptext: Merges adjacent text nodes and eliminates empty text nodes for each of the following: all text nodes in the XMLList, all the XML objects contained in the XMLList, and the descendants of all the XML objects in the XMLList.

string.name: parent
string.tiptext: Returns the parent of the XMLList object if all items in the XMLList object have the same parent.

string.name: processingInstructions
string.tiptext: If a name parameter is provided, lists all the children of the XMLList object that contain processing instructions with that name.

string.name: propertyIsEnumerable
string.tiptext: Checks whether the property p is in the set of properties that can be iterated in a for..in statement applied to the XMLList object.

string.name: text
string.tiptext: Calls the text() method of each XML object and returns an XMLList object that contains the results.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of all the XML objects in an XMLList object.

string.name: toXMLString
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of all the XML objects in an XMLList object.

string.name: valueOf
string.tiptext: Returns the XMLList object.

folder.name: Language Elements
folder.tiptext: Language elements that perform or specify an action at runtime

string.name: trace
string.tiptext: Displays expressions, or writes to log files, while debugging.

string.name: Array
string.tiptext: Creates a new array.

string.name: Boolean
string.tiptext: Converts the expression parameter to a Boolean value and returns the value.

string.name: Date
string.tiptext: Returns a String representation of the current day, date, time, and timezone.

string.name: decodeURI
string.tiptext: Decodes an encoded URI into a string.

string.name: decodeURIComponent
string.tiptext: Decodes an encoded URI component into a string.

string.name: encodeURI
string.tiptext: Encodes a string into a valid URI (Uniform Resource Identifier).

string.name: encodeURIComponent
string.tiptext: Encodes a string into a valid URI component.

string.name: escape
string.tiptext: Converts the parameter to a string and encodes it in a URL-encoded format, where most nonalphanumeric characters are replaced with % hexadecimal sequences.

string.name: int
string.tiptext: Converts a given numeric value to an integer value.

string.name: isFinite
string.tiptext: Returns true if the value is a finite number, or false if the value is Infinity or -Infinity.

string.name: isNaN
string.tiptext: Returns true if the value is NaN(not a number).

string.name: isXMLName
string.tiptext: Determines whether the specified string is a valid name for an XML element or attribute.

string.name: Number
string.tiptext: Converts a given value to a Number value.

string.name: Object
string.tiptext: Every value in ActionScript 3.0 is an object, which means that calling Object() on a value returns that value.

string.name: parseInt
string.tiptext: Converts a string to an integer.

string.name: parseFloat
string.tiptext: Converts a string to a floating-point number.

string.name: String
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the specified parameter.

string.name: unescape
string.tiptext: Evaluates the parameter str as a string, decodes the string from URL-encoded format (converting all hexadecimal sequences to ASCII characters), and returns the string.

string.name: uint
string.tiptext: Converts a given numeric value to an unsigned integer value.

string.name: XML
string.tiptext: Converts an object to an XML object.

string.name: XMLList
string.tiptext: Converts an object to an XMLList object.

string.name: Infinity
string.tiptext: A special value representing positive Infinity.

string.name: -Infinity
string.tiptext: A special value representing negative Infinity.

string.name: NaN
string.tiptext: A special member of the Number data type that represents a value that is "not a number" (NaN).

string.name: undefined
string.tiptext: A special value that applies to untyped variables that have not been initialized or dynamic object properties that are not initialized.

folder.name: CustomActions
folder.tiptext: The methods of the CustomActions class allow a SWF file playing in the Flash authoring tool to manage any custom actions that are registered with the authoring tool.

string.name: installActions
string.tiptext: Installs a new custom action XML definition file indicated by the name parameter.

string.name: uninstallActions
string.tiptext: Removes the Custom Actions XML definition file named name.

string.name: getActions
string.tiptext: Reads the contents of the custom action XML definition file named name.

string.name: actionsList
string.tiptext: Returns an Array object containing the names of all the custom actions that are registered with the Flash authoring tool.

string.name: MMExecute
string.tiptext: MMExecute is used when the Flash Player is running within an Adobe tools product that implements JavaScript extensibility (JSAPI).

folder.name: XMLUI
folder.tiptext: The XMLUI class enables communication with SWF files that are used as custom user interfaces for the Flash authoring tool's extensibility features.

string.name: getProperty
string.tiptext: Retrieves the value of the specified property of the current XMLUI dialog box.

string.name: setProperty
string.tiptext: Modifies the value of the specified property of the current XMLUI dialog.

string.name: accept
string.tiptext: Makes the current XMLUI dialog box close with an "accept" state.

string.name: cancel
string.tiptext: Makes the current XMLUI dialog box close with a "cancel" state.

folder.name: AccImpl
folder.tiptext: The AccImpl class, also called the Accessibility Implementation class, is the base class for the implementation of accessibility in components.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a component.

folder.name: ButtonAccImpl
folder.tiptext: The ButtonAccImpl class, also called the Button Accessibility Implementation class, enables communication between a Button component and a screen reader.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a Button component.

folder.name: CheckBoxAccImpl
folder.tiptext: The CheckBoxAccImpl class, also called the CheckBox Accessibility Implementation class, is used to make a CheckBox component accessible.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a CheckBox component.

folder.name: ComboBoxAccImpl
folder.tiptext: The ComboBoxAccImpl class, also called the ComboBox Accessibility Implementation class, is used to make a ComboBox component accessible.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a ComboBox component.

folder.name: DataGridAccImpl
folder.tiptext: The DataGridAccImpl class, also called the DataGrid Accessibility Implementation class, is used to make a DataGrid component accessible.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a DataGrid component.

folder.name: LabelButtonAccImpl
folder.tiptext: The LabelButtonAccImpl class, also called the LabelButton Accessibility Implementation class, is used to make a LabelButton component accessible.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a LabelButton component.

folder.name: ListAccImpl
folder.tiptext: The ListAccImpl class, also called the List Accessiblity Implementation class, is used to make a List component accessible.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a List component.

folder.name: RadioButtonAccImpl
folder.tiptext: The RadioButtonAccImpl class, also called the RadioButton Accessibility Implementation class, is used to make a RadioButton component accessible.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a RadioButton component.

folder.name: SelectableListAccImpl
folder.tiptext: The SelectableListAccImpl class, also called the SelectableList Accessibility Implementation class, is used to make a SelectableList component accessible.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a SelectableList component.

folder.name: TileListAccImpl
folder.tiptext: The TileListAccImpl class, also called the Tile List Accessibility Implementation class, is used to make a TileList component accessible.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a TileList component.

folder.name: UIComponentAccImpl
folder.tiptext: The UIComponentAccImpl class, also called the UIComponent Accessibility Implementation class, is used to make a UIComponent accessible.

string.name: enableAccessibility
string.tiptext: Enables accessibility for a UIComponent component.

folder.name: BaseScrollPane
folder.tiptext: The BaseScrollPane class handles basic scroll pane functionality including events, styling, drawing the mask and background, the layout of scroll bars, and the handling of scroll positions.

string.name: BaseScrollPane
string.tiptext: Creates a new BaseScrollPane component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: horizontalScrollPolicy
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates the state of the horizontal scroll bar.

string.name: verticalScrollPolicy
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates the state of the vertical scroll bar.

string.name: horizontalLineScrollSize
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that describes the amount of content to be scrolled, horizontally, when a scroll arrow is clicked.

string.name: verticalLineScrollSize
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that describes how many pixels to scroll vertically when a scroll arrow is clicked.

string.name: horizontalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that describes the horizontal position of the horizontal scroll bar in the scroll pane, in pixels.

string.name: verticalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that describes the vertical position of the vertical scroll bar in the scroll pane, in pixels.

string.name: maxHorizontalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets the maximum horizontal scroll position for the current content, in pixels.

string.name: maxVerticalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets the maximum vertical scroll position for the current content, in pixels.

string.name: useBitmapScrolling
string.tiptext: When set to true, the cacheAsBitmap property for the scrolling content is set to true; when set to false this value is turned off.

string.name: horizontalPageScrollSize
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the count of pixels by which to move the scroll thumb on the horizontal scroll bar when the scroll bar track is pressed.

string.name: verticalPageScrollSize
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the count of pixels by which to move the scroll thumb on the vertical scroll bar when the scroll bar track is pressed.

string.name: horizontalScrollBar
string.tiptext: Gets a reference to the horizontal scroll bar.

string.name: verticalScrollBar
string.tiptext: Gets a reference to the vertical scroll bar.

string.name: scroll
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user scrolls content by using the scroll bars on the component or the wheel on a mouse device.

folder.name: ScrollPane
folder.tiptext: The ScrollPane component displays display objects and JPEG, GIF, and PNG files, as well as SWF files, in a scrollable area.

string.name: ScrollPane
string.tiptext: Creates a new ScrollPane component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: refreshPane
string.tiptext: Reloads the contents of the scroll pane.

string.name: update
string.tiptext: Refreshes the scroll bar properties based on the width and height of the content.

string.name: load
string.tiptext: The request parameter of this method accepts only a URLRequest object whose source property contains a string, a class, or a URLRequest object.

string.name: scrollDrag
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether scrolling occurs when a user drags on content within the scroll pane.

string.name: percentLoaded
string.tiptext: Gets a number between 0 and 100 indicating what percentage of the content is loaded.

string.name: bytesLoaded
string.tiptext: Gets the count of bytes of content that have been loaded.

string.name: bytesTotal
string.tiptext: Gets the count of bytes of content to be loaded.

string.name: content
string.tiptext: Gets a reference to the content loaded into the scroll pane.

string.name: source
string.tiptext: Gets or sets an absolute or relative URL that identifies the location of the SWF or image file to load, the class name of a movie clip in the library, a reference to a display object, or a instance name of a movie clip on the same level as the component.

string.name: scroll
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user scrolls content by using the scroll bars on the component or the wheel on a mouse device.

string.name: progress
string.tiptext: Dispatched while content is loading.

string.name: complete
string.tiptext: Dispatched when content has finished loading.

folder.name: UILoader
folder.tiptext: The UILoader class makes it possible to set content to load and to then monitor the loading operation at run time.

string.name: UILoader
string.tiptext: Creates a new UILoader component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: setSize
string.tiptext: Resizes the component to the requested size.

string.name: loadBytes
string.tiptext: Loads binary data that is stored in a ByteArray object.

string.name: load
string.tiptext: Loads the specified content or, if no content is specified, loads the content from the location identified by the source property.

string.name: unload
string.tiptext: Removes a child of this UILoader object that was loaded by using either the load() method or the source property.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Cancels a load() method operation that is currently in progress for the Loader instance.

string.name: autoLoad
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the UILoader instance automatically loads the specified content.

string.name: scaleContent
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to automatically scale the image to the size of the UILoader instance.

string.name: maintainAspectRatio
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to maintain the aspect ratio that was used in the original image or to resize the image at the curent width and height of the UILoader component.

string.name: bytesLoaded
string.tiptext: Gets the count of bytes of content that have been loaded.

string.name: bytesTotal
string.tiptext: Gets the count of bytes of content to be loaded.

string.name: content
string.tiptext: Contains the root display object of the SWF file or image file (a JPEG, PNG, or GIF format file) that was loaded by using the load() method or setting the source property.

string.name: source
string.tiptext: Gets or sets an absolute or relative URL that identifies the location of the SWF or image file to load, the class name of a movie clip in the library, a reference to a display object, or a instance name of a movie clip on the same level as the component.

string.name: percentLoaded
string.tiptext: Gets a number between 0 and 100 indicating what percentage of the content is loaded.

string.name: complete
string.tiptext: Dispatched when content loading is complete.

string.name: init
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the properties and methods of a loaded SWF file are accessible.

string.name: ioError
string.tiptext: Dispatched after an input or output error occurs.

string.name: open
string.tiptext: Dispatched after a network operation starts.

string.name: progress
string.tiptext: Dispatched when content is loading.

string.name: resize
string.tiptext: Dispatched after the component is resized.

string.name: securityError
string.tiptext: Dispatched after a security error occurs while content is loading.

folder.name: BaseButton
folder.tiptext: The BaseButton class is the base class for all button components, defining properties and methods that are common to all buttons.

string.name: BaseButton
string.tiptext: Creates a new BaseButton instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: setMouseState
string.tiptext: Set the mouse state via ActionScript.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the component can accept user input.

string.name: selected
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether a toggle button is selected.

string.name: autoRepeat
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the buttonDown event is dispatched more than one time when the user holds the mouse button down over the component.

string.name: buttonDown
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user presses the Button component.

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the value of the selected property of a toggle Button component changes.

folder.name: Button
folder.tiptext: The Button component represents a commonly used rectangular button.

string.name: Button
string.tiptext: Creates a new Button component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: emphasized
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether a border is drawn around the Button component when the button is in its up state.

folder.name: ButtonLabelPlacement
folder.tiptext: The ButtonLabelPlacement class defines constants for the values of the labelPlacement property of a Button, CheckBox, or RadioButton component.

string.name: BOTTOM
string.tiptext: The label appears below the icon.

string.name: TOP
string.tiptext: The label appears above the icon.

string.name: LEFT
string.tiptext: The label appears to the left of the icon.

string.name: RIGHT
string.tiptext: The label appears to the right of the icon.

folder.name: CheckBox
folder.tiptext: The CheckBox component displays a small box that can contain a check mark.

string.name: CheckBox
string.tiptext: Creates a new CheckBox component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: drawFocus
string.tiptext: Shows or hides the focus indicator around this component.

string.name: toggle
string.tiptext: A CheckBox toggles by definition, so the toggle property is set to true in the constructor and cannot be changed for a CheckBox.

string.name: autoRepeat
string.tiptext: A CheckBox never auto-repeats by definition, so the autoRepeat property is set to false in the constructor and cannot be changed for a CheckBox.

folder.name: ColorPicker
folder.tiptext: The ColorPicker component displays a list of one or more swatches from which the user can select a color.

string.name: ColorPicker
string.tiptext: Creates an instance of the ColorPicker class.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: open
string.tiptext: Shows the color palette.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Hides the color palette.

string.name: textField
string.tiptext: A reference to the internal text field of the ColorPicker component.

string.name: selectedColor
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the swatch that is currently highlighted in the palette of the ColorPicker component.

string.name: hexValue
string.tiptext: Gets the string value of the current color selection.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the component can accept user interaction.

string.name: editable
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the internal text field of the ColorPicker component is editable.

string.name: showTextField
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the internal text field of the ColorPicker component is displayed.

string.name: colors
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the array of custom colors that the ColorPicker component provides.

string.name: imeMode
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the mode of the input method editor (IME).

string.name: open
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user opens the color palette.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user closes the color palette.

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user clicks a color in the palette.

string.name: itemRollOver
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user rolls over a swatch in the color palette.

string.name: itemRollOut
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user rolls out of a swatch in the color palette.

string.name: enter
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user presses the Enter key after editing the internal text field of the ColorPicker component.

folder.name: ComboBox
folder.tiptext: The ComboBox component contains a drop-down list from which the user can select one value.

string.name: ComboBox
string.tiptext: Creates a new ComboBox component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: itemToLabel
string.tiptext: Retrieves the string that the renderer displays for the given data object based on the labelField and labelFunction properties.

string.name: addItem
string.tiptext: Appends an item to the end of the list of items.

string.name: addItemAt
string.tiptext: Inserts an item into the list at the specified index location.

string.name: removeAll
string.tiptext: Removes all items from the list.

string.name: removeItem
string.tiptext: Removes the specified item from the list.

string.name: removeItemAt
string.tiptext: Removes the item at the specified index position.

string.name: getItemAt
string.tiptext: Retrieves the item at the specified index.

string.name: replaceItemAt
string.tiptext: Replaces the item at the specified index location with another item.

string.name: sortItems
string.tiptext: Sorts the elements of the current data provider.

string.name: sortItemsOn
string.tiptext: Sorts the elements of the current data provider by one or more of its fields.

string.name: open
string.tiptext: Opens the drop-down list.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Closes the drop-down list.

string.name: editable
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the ComboBox component is editable or read-only.

string.name: rowCount
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the maximum number of rows that can appear in a drop-down list that does not have a scroll bar.

string.name: restrict
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the characters that a user can enter in the text field.

string.name: selectedIndex
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the index of the item that is selected in a single-selection list.

string.name: text
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the text that the text box contains in an editable ComboBox component.

string.name: labelField
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the name of the field in the dataProvider object to be displayed as the label for the TextInput field and drop-down list.

string.name: labelFunction
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the function to be used to obtain the label for the item.

string.name: selectedItem
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the value of the item that is selected in the drop-down list.

string.name: dropdown
string.tiptext: Gets a reference to the List component that the ComboBox component contains.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: Gets the number of items in the list.

string.name: textField
string.tiptext: Gets a reference to the TextInput component that the ComboBox component contains.

string.name: value
string.tiptext: Gets the label of an item in an editable ComboBox component.

string.name: dataProvider
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the data model of the list of items to be viewed.

string.name: dropdownWidth
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the maximum width of the drop-down list, in pixels.

string.name: prompt
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the prompt for the ComboBox component.

string.name: selectedLabel
string.tiptext: Gets the string that is displayed in the TextInput portion of the ComboBox component.

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user changes the selection in the ComboBox component or, if the ComboBox component is editable, each time the user enters a keystroke in the text field.

string.name: itemRollOver
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user rolls the pointer over an item in the component.

string.name: itemRollOut
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user rolls the pointer off of an item in the component.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the drop-down list is dismissed for any reason.

string.name: enter
string.tiptext: Dispatched if the editable property is set to true and the user presses the Enter key while typing in the editable text field.

string.name: open
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user clicks the drop-down button to display the drop-down list.

string.name: scroll
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user scrolls the drop-down list of the ComboBox component.

folder.name: DataGrid
folder.tiptext: The DataGrid class is a list-based component that provides a grid of rows and columns.

string.name: DataGrid
string.tiptext: Creates a new DataGrid component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: addColumn
string.tiptext: Adds a column to the end of the columns array.

string.name: addColumnAt
string.tiptext: Inserts a column at the specified index in the columns array.

string.name: removeColumnAt
string.tiptext: Removes the column that is located at the specified index of the columns array.

string.name: removeAllColumns
string.tiptext: Removes all columns from the DataGrid component.

string.name: getColumnAt
string.tiptext: Retrieves the column that is located at the specified index of the columns array.

string.name: getColumnIndex
string.tiptext: Retrieves the index of the column of the specified name, or -1 if no match is found.

string.name: getColumnCount
string.tiptext: Retrieves the number of columns in the DataGrid component.

string.name: spaceColumnsEqually
string.tiptext: Resets the widths of the visible columns to the same size.

string.name: editField
string.tiptext: Edits a given field or property in the DataGrid component.

string.name: itemToCellRenderer
string.tiptext: The DataGrid component has multiple cells for any given item, so the itemToCellRenderer method always returns null.

string.name: createItemEditor
string.tiptext: Uses the editor specified by the itemEditor property to create an item editor for the item renderer at the column and row index identified by the editedItemPosition property.

string.name: destroyItemEditor
string.tiptext: Closes an item editor that is currently open on an item renderer.

string.name: getCellRendererAt
string.tiptext: Get the instance of a cell renderer at the specified position in the DataGrid.

string.name: scrollToIndex
string.tiptext: Scrolls the list to the item at the specified index.

string.name: editable
string.tiptext: Indicates whether or not the user can edit items in the data provider.

string.name: resizableColumns
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the user can change the size of the columns.

string.name: sortableColumns
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the user can sort the items in the data provider by clicking on a column header cell.

string.name: itemEditorInstance
string.tiptext: A reference to the currently active instance of the item editor, if one exists.

string.name: horizontalScrollPolicy
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the horizontal scroll bar is always on.

string.name: columns
string.tiptext: Gets or sets an array of DataGridColumn objects, one for each column that can be displayed.

string.name: minColumnWidth
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the minimum width of a DataGrid column, in pixels.

string.name: labelFunction
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a function that determines which fields of each item to use for the label text.

string.name: rowCount
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the number of rows that are at least partially visible in the list.

string.name: rowHeight
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the height of each row in the DataGrid component, in pixels.

string.name: headerHeight
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the height of the DataGrid header, in pixels.

string.name: showHeaders
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the DataGrid component shows column headers.

string.name: sortIndex
string.tiptext: Gets the index of the column to be sorted.

string.name: sortDescending
string.tiptext: Gets the order in which a column is sorted when the user clicks its header.

string.name: imeMode
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the mode of the input method editor (IME).

string.name: editedItemRenderer
string.tiptext: Gets a reference to the item renderer in the DataGrid component whose item is currently being edited.

string.name: editedItemPosition
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the column and row index of the item renderer for the data provider item that is being edited.

string.name: headerRelease
string.tiptext: Dispatched after the user clicks a header cell.

string.name: columnStretch
string.tiptext: Dispatched after a user expands a column horizontally.

string.name: itemEditBeginning
string.tiptext: Dispatched after a user prepares to edit an item, for example, by releasing the mouse button over the item.

string.name: itemEditBegin
string.tiptext: Dispatched after the editedItemPosition property is set and the item can be edited.

string.name: itemEditEnd
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an item editing session ends for any reason.

string.name: itemFocusIn
string.tiptext: Dispatched after an item receives focus.

string.name: itemFocusOut
string.tiptext: Dispatched after an item loses focus.

folder.name: Label
folder.tiptext: A Label component displays one or more lines of plain or HTML-formatted text that can be formatted for alignment and size.

string.name: Label
string.tiptext: Creates a new Label component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: textField
string.tiptext: A reference to the internal text field of the Label component.

string.name: text
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the plain text to be displayed by the Label component.

string.name: htmlText
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the text to be displayed by the Label component, including HTML markup that expresses the styles of that text.

string.name: condenseWhite
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether extra white space such as spaces and line breaks should be removed from a Label component that contains HTML text.

string.name: selectable
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text can be selected.

string.name: wordWrap
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text field supports word wrapping.

string.name: autoSize
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a string that indicates how a label is sized and aligned to fit the value of its text property.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the width of the component, in pixels.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the height of the component, in pixels.

string.name: resize
string.tiptext: Dispatched after there is a change in the width or height of the component.

folder.name: LabelButton
folder.tiptext: The LabelButton class is an abstract class that extends the BaseButton class by adding a label, an icon, and toggle functionality.

string.name: LabelButton
string.tiptext: Creates a new LabelButton component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: textField
string.tiptext: A reference to the component's internal text field.

string.name: label
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the text label for the component.

string.name: labelPlacement
string.tiptext: Position of the label in relation to a specified icon.

string.name: toggle
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether a button can be toggled.

string.name: selected
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether a toggle button is toggled in the on or off position.

string.name: click
string.tiptext: Dispatched after the toggle button receives input from a mouse device or from the spacebar.

string.name: labelChange
string.tiptext: Dispatched after the label value changes.

folder.name: List
folder.tiptext: The List component displays list-based information and is ideally suited for the display of arrays of information.

string.name: List
string.tiptext: Creates a new List component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: scrollToIndex
string.tiptext: Scrolls the list to the item at the specified index.

string.name: itemToLabel
string.tiptext: Retrieves the string that the renderer displays for the given data object based on the labelField and labelFunction properties.

string.name: labelField
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the name of the field in the dataProvider object to be displayed as the label for the TextInput field and drop-down list.

string.name: labelFunction
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the function to be used to obtain the label for the item.

string.name: iconField
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the item field that provides the icon for the item.

string.name: iconFunction
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the function to be used to obtain the icon for the item.

string.name: rowCount
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the number of rows that are at least partially visible in the list.

string.name: rowHeight
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the height of each row in the list, in pixels.

folder.name: NumericStepper
folder.tiptext: The NumericStepper component displays an ordered set of numbers from which the user can make a selection.

string.name: NumericStepper
string.tiptext: Creates a new NumericStepper component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: drawFocus
string.tiptext: Shows or hides the focus indicator on this component.

string.name: setFocus
string.tiptext: Sets focus to the component instance.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the component can accept user interaction.

string.name: maximum
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the maximum value in the sequence of numeric values.

string.name: minimum
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the minimum number in the sequence of numeric values.

string.name: nextValue
string.tiptext: Gets the next value in the sequence of values.

string.name: previousValue
string.tiptext: Gets the previous value in the sequence of values.

string.name: stepSize
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a nonzero number that describes the unit of change between values.

string.name: value
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the current value of the NumericStepper component.

string.name: textField
string.tiptext: Gets a reference to the TextInput component that the NumericStepper component contains.

string.name: imeMode
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the mode of the input method editor (IME).

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user changes the value of the NumericStepper component.

folder.name: ProgressBar
folder.tiptext: The ProgressBar component displays the progress of content that is being loaded.

string.name: ProgressBar
string.tiptext: Creates a new ProgressBar component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: setProgress
string.tiptext: Sets the state of the bar to reflect the amount of progress made when using manual mode.

string.name: reset
string.tiptext: Resets the progress bar for a new load operation.

string.name: direction
string.tiptext: Indicates the fill direction for the progress bar.

string.name: indeterminate
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of fill that the progress bar uses and whether the loading source is known or unknown.

string.name: minimum
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the minimum value for the progress bar when the ProgressBar.mode property is set to ProgressBarMode.MANUAL.

string.name: maximum
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the maximum value for the progress bar when the ProgressBar.mode property is set to ProgressBarMode.MANUAL.

string.name: value
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates the amount of progress that has been made in the load operation.

string.name: source
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a reference to the content that is being loaded and for which the ProgressBar is measuring the progress of the load operation.

string.name: percentComplete
string.tiptext: Gets a number between 0 and 100 that indicates the percentage of the content has already loaded.

string.name: mode
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the method to be used to update the progress bar.

string.name: complete
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the load operation completes.

string.name: progress
string.tiptext: Dispatched as content loads in event mode or polled mode.

folder.name: ProgressBarDirection
folder.tiptext: The ProgressBarDirection class defines the values for the direction property of the ProgressBar class.

string.name: RIGHT
string.tiptext: Fill the progress bar from left to right.

string.name: LEFT
string.tiptext: Fill the progress bar from right to left.

folder.name: ProgressBarMode
folder.tiptext: The ProgressBarMode class defines the values for the mode property of the ProgressBar class.

string.name: MANUAL
string.tiptext: Manually update the status of the ProgressBar component.

string.name: EVENT
string.tiptext: The component specified by the source property must dispatch progress and complete events.

string.name: POLLED
string.tiptext: Progress is updated by polling the source.

folder.name: RadioButton
folder.tiptext: The RadioButton component lets you force a user to make a single selection from a set of choices.

string.name: RadioButton
string.tiptext: Creates a new RadioButton component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: drawFocus
string.tiptext: Shows or hides the focus indicator around this component instance.

string.name: toggle
string.tiptext: A radio button is a toggle button; its toggle property is set to true in the constructor and cannot be changed.

string.name: autoRepeat
string.tiptext: A radio button never auto-repeats by definition, so the autoRepeat property is set to false in the constructor and cannot be changed.

string.name: selected
string.tiptext: Indicates whether a radio button is currently selected (true) or deselected (false).

string.name: groupName
string.tiptext: The group name for a radio button instance or group.

string.name: group
string.tiptext: The RadioButtonGroup object to which this RadioButton belongs.

string.name: value
string.tiptext: A user-defined value that is associated with a radio button.

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the radio button instance's selected property changes.

string.name: click
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user clicks the radio button with the mouse or spacebar.

folder.name: RadioButtonGroup
folder.tiptext: The RadioButtonGroup class defines a group of RadioButton components to act as a single component.

string.name: RadioButtonGroup
string.tiptext: Creates a new RadioButtonGroup instance.

string.name: getGroup
string.tiptext: Retrieves a reference to the specified radio button group.

string.name: addRadioButton
string.tiptext: Adds a radio button to the internal radio button array for use with radio button group indexing, which allows for the selection of a single radio button in a group of radio buttons.

string.name: removeRadioButton
string.tiptext: Clears the RadioButton instance from the internal list of radio buttons.

string.name: getRadioButtonIndex
string.tiptext: Returns the index of the specified RadioButton instance.

string.name: getRadioButtonAt
string.tiptext: Retrieves the RadioButton component at the specified index location.

string.name: name
string.tiptext: Gets the instance name of the radio button.

string.name: selection
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a reference to the radio button that is currently selected from the radio button group.

string.name: selectedData
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the selected radio button's value property.

string.name: numRadioButtons
string.tiptext: Gets the number of radio buttons in this radio button group.

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the selected RadioButton instance in a group changes.

string.name: click
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a RadioButton instance is clicked.

folder.name: ScrollBar
folder.tiptext: The ScrollBar component provides the end user with a way to control the portion of data that is displayed when there is too much data to fit in the display area.

string.name: ScrollBar
string.tiptext: Creates a new ScrollBar component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: setSize
string.tiptext: Sets the component to the specified width and height.

string.name: setScrollProperties
string.tiptext: Sets the range and viewport size of the ScrollBar component.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the width of the component, in pixels.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the height of the component, in pixels.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the scroll bar is enabled.

string.name: scrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the current scroll position and updates the position of the thumb.

string.name: minScrollPosition
