string.tiptext: Gets or sets a number that represents the minimum scroll position.

string.name: maxScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a number that represents the maximum scroll position.

string.name: pageSize
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the number of lines that a page contains.

string.name: pageScrollSize
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that represents the increment by which the page is scrolled when the scroll bar track is pressed.

string.name: lineScrollSize
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that represents the increment by which to scroll the page when the scroll bar track is pressed.

string.name: direction
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the scroll bar scrolls horizontally or vertically.

string.name: scroll
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the ScrollBar instance's scrollPosition property changes.

folder.name: ScrollBarDirection
folder.tiptext: Defines the values for the direction property of the ScrollBar component.

string.name: VERTICAL
string.tiptext: Indicates that the ScrollBar component instance is used for vertical scrolling.

string.name: HORIZONTAL
string.tiptext: Indicates that the ScrollBar component instance is used for horizontal scrolling.

folder.name: ScrollPolicy
folder.tiptext: Values for the horizontalScrollPolicy and verticalScrollPolicy properties of the BaseScrollPane class.

string.name: ON
string.tiptext: Always show the scroll bar.

string.name: AUTO
string.tiptext: Show the scroll bar if the children exceed the owner's dimensions.

string.name: OFF
string.tiptext: Never show the scroll bar.

folder.name: SelectableList
folder.tiptext: The SelectableList is the base class for all list-based components--for example, the List, TileList, DataGrid, and ComboBox components.

string.name: SelectableList
string.tiptext: Creates a new SelectableList instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: clearSelection
string.tiptext: Clears the currently selected item in the list and sets the selectedIndex property to -1.

string.name: itemToCellRenderer
string.tiptext: Retrieves the ICellRenderer for a given item object, if there is one.

string.name: addItem
string.tiptext: Appends an item to the end of the list of items.

string.name: addItemAt
string.tiptext: Inserts an item into the list at the specified index location.

string.name: removeAll
string.tiptext: Removes all items from the list.

string.name: getItemAt
string.tiptext: Retrieves the item at the specified index.

string.name: removeItem
string.tiptext: Removes the specified item from the list.

string.name: removeItemAt
string.tiptext: Removes the item at the specified index position.

string.name: replaceItemAt
string.tiptext: Replaces the item at the specified index location with another item.

string.name: invalidateList
string.tiptext: Invalidates the whole list, forcing the list items to be redrawn.

string.name: invalidateItem
string.tiptext: Invalidates a specific item renderer.

string.name: invalidateItemAt
string.tiptext: Invalidates the renderer for the item at the specified index.

string.name: sortItems
string.tiptext: Sorts the elements of the current data provider.

string.name: sortItemsOn
string.tiptext: Sorts the elements of the current data provider by one or more of its fields.

string.name: isItemSelected
string.tiptext: Checks whether the specified item is selected in the list.

string.name: scrollToSelected
string.tiptext: Scrolls the list to the item at the location indicated by the current value of the selectedIndex property.

string.name: scrollToIndex
string.tiptext: Scrolls the list to the item at the specified index.

string.name: getNextIndexAtLetter
string.tiptext: Returns the index of the next item in the dataProvider in which the label's first character matches a specified string character.

string.name: itemToLabel
string.tiptext: Retrieves the string that the renderer displays for the given data object based on the label properties of the object.

string.name: setRendererStyle
string.tiptext: Sets a style on the renderers in the list.

string.name: getRendererStyle
string.tiptext: Retrieves a style that is set on the renderers in the list.

string.name: clearRendererStyle
string.tiptext: Clears a style that is set on the renderers in the list.

string.name: dataProvider
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the data model of the list of items to be viewed.

string.name: maxHorizontalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the number of pixels that the list scrolls to the right when the horizontalScrollPolicy property is set to ScrollPolicy.ON.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: Gets the number of items in the data provider.

string.name: allowMultipleSelection
string.tiptext: Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether more than one list item can be selected at a time.

string.name: selectable
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the items in the list can be selected.

string.name: selectedIndex
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the index of the item that is selected in a single-selection list.

string.name: selectedIndices
string.tiptext: Gets or sets an array that contains the items that were selected from a multiple-selection list.

string.name: selectedItem
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the item that was selected from a single-selection list.

string.name: selectedItems
string.tiptext: Gets or sets an array that contains the objects for the items that were selected from the multiple-selection list.

string.name: rowCount
string.tiptext: Gets the number of rows that are at least partially visible in the list.

string.name: itemRollOut
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user rolls the pointer off of an item in the component.

string.name: itemRollOver
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user rolls the pointer over an item in the component.

string.name: rollOver
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user rolls the pointer over the component.

string.name: rollOut
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user rolls the pointer off of the component.

string.name: itemClick
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user clicks an item in the component.

string.name: itemDoubleClick
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user clicks an item in the component twice in rapid succession.

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a different item is selected in the list.

string.name: scroll
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user scrolls horizontally or vertically.

folder.name: Slider
folder.tiptext: The Slider component lets users select a value by moving a slider thumb between the end points of the slider track.

string.name: Slider
string.tiptext: Creates a new Slider component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: setSize
string.tiptext: Sets the component to the specified width and height.

string.name: direction
string.tiptext: Sets the direction of the slider.

string.name: minimum
string.tiptext: The minimum value allowed on the Slider component instance.

string.name: maximum
string.tiptext: The maximum allowed value on the Slider component instance.

string.name: tickInterval
string.tiptext: The spacing of the tick marks relative to the maximum value of the component.

string.name: snapInterval
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the increment by which the value is increased or decreased as the user moves the slider thumb.

string.name: liveDragging
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the SliderEvent.CHANGE event is dispatched continuously as the user moves the slider thumb.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the component can accept user interaction.

string.name: value
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the current value of the Slider component.

string.name: thumbPress
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the slider thumb is pressed.

string.name: thumbRelease
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the slider thumb is pressed and released.

string.name: thumbDrag
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the slider thumb is pressed and then moved by the mouse.

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the value of the Slider component changes as a result of mouse or keyboard interaction.

folder.name: SliderDirection
folder.tiptext: The orientation of the Slider component.

string.name: HORIZONTAL
string.tiptext: Position the Slider component on the horizontal axis.

string.name: VERTICAL
string.tiptext: Position the Slider component on the vertical axis.

folder.name: TextArea
folder.tiptext: The TextArea component is a multiline text field with a border and optional scroll bars.

string.name: TextArea
string.tiptext: Creates a new TextArea component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: drawFocus
string.tiptext: Shows or hides the focus indicator on this component.

string.name: getLineMetrics
string.tiptext: Retrieves information about a specified line of text.

string.name: setSelection
string.tiptext: Sets the range of a selection made in a text area that has focus.

string.name: appendText
string.tiptext: Appends the specified string after the last character that the TextArea component contains.

string.name: textField
string.tiptext: A reference to the internal text field of the TextArea component.

string.name: horizontalScrollBar
string.tiptext: Gets a reference to the horizontal scroll bar.

string.name: verticalScrollBar
string.tiptext: Gets a reference to the vertical scroll bar.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the component can accept user interaction.

string.name: text
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a string which contains the text that is currently in the TextInput component.

string.name: htmlText
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the HTML representation of the string that the text field contains.

string.name: condenseWhite
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether extra white space is removed from a TextArea component that contains HTML text.

string.name: horizontalScrollPolicy
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the scroll policy for the horizontal scroll bar.

string.name: verticalScrollPolicy
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the scroll policy for the vertical scroll bar.

string.name: horizontalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the change in the position of the scroll bar thumb, in pixels, after the user scrolls the text field horizontally.

string.name: verticalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the change in the position of the scroll bar thumb, in pixels, after the user scrolls the text field vertically.

string.name: textWidth
string.tiptext: Gets the width of the text, in pixels.

string.name: textHeight
string.tiptext: Gets the height of the text, in pixels.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: Gets the count of characters that the TextArea component contains.

string.name: restrict
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the string of characters that the text field accepts from a user.

string.name: maxChars
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the maximum number of characters that a user can enter in the text field.

string.name: maxHorizontalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets the maximum value of the horizontalScrollPosition property.

string.name: maxVerticalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets the maximum value of the verticalScrollPosition property.

string.name: wordWrap
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the text wraps at the end of the line.

string.name: selectionBeginIndex
string.tiptext: Gets the index position of the first selected character in a selection of one or more characters.

string.name: selectionEndIndex
string.tiptext: Gets the index position of the last selected character in a selection of one or more characters.

string.name: displayAsPassword
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the TextArea component instance is the text field for a password.

string.name: editable
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the user can edit the text in the component.

string.name: imeMode
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the mode of the input method editor (IME).

string.name: alwaysShowSelection
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether Flash Player highlights a selection in the text field when the text field does not have focus.

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the text in the TextArea component changes.

string.name: textInput
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user enters, deletes, or pastes text into the component.

string.name: enter
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user presses the Enter key while in the component.

string.name: scroll
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the content is scrolled.

folder.name: TextInput
folder.tiptext: The TextInput component is a single-line text component that contains a native ActionScript TextField object.

string.name: TextInput
string.tiptext: Creates a new TextInput component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: drawFocus
string.tiptext: Shows or hides the focus indicator on this component.

string.name: setSelection
string.tiptext: Sets the range of a selection made in a text area that has focus.

string.name: getLineMetrics
string.tiptext: Retrieves information about a specified line of text.

string.name: appendText
string.tiptext: Appends the specified string after the last character that the TextArea contains.

string.name: textField
string.tiptext: A reference to the internal text field of the TextInput component.

string.name: text
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a string which contains the text that is currently in the TextInput component.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the component can accept user interaction.

string.name: imeMode
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the mode of the input method editor (IME).

string.name: alwaysShowSelection
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates how a selection is displayed when the text field does not have focus.

string.name: editable
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the text field can be edited by the user.

string.name: horizontalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the position of the thumb of the horizontal scroll bar.

string.name: maxHorizontalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets a value that describes the furthest position to which the text field can be scrolled to the right.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: Gets the number of characters in a TextInput component.

string.name: maxChars
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the maximum number of characters that a user can enter in the text field.

string.name: displayAsPassword
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the current TextInput component instance was created to contain a password or to contain text.

string.name: restrict
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the string of characters that the text field accepts from a user.

string.name: selectionBeginIndex
string.tiptext: Gets the index value of the first selected character in a selection of one or more characters.

string.name: selectionEndIndex
string.tiptext: Gets the index position of the last selected character in a selection of one or more characters.

string.name: condenseWhite
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether extra white space is removed from a TextInput component that contains HTML text.

string.name: htmlText
string.tiptext: Contains the HTML representation of the string that the text field contains.

string.name: textHeight
string.tiptext: The height of the text, in pixels.

string.name: textWidth
string.tiptext: The width of the text, in pixels.

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched when user input changes text in the TextInput component.

string.name: enter
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user presses the Enter key.

string.name: textInput
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user inputs text.

folder.name: TileList
folder.tiptext: The TileList class provides a grid of rows and columns that is typically used to format and display images in a "tiled" format.

string.name: TileList
string.tiptext: Creates a new List component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: scrollToIndex
string.tiptext: Scrolls the list to the item at the specified index.

string.name: itemToLabel
string.tiptext: Retrieves the string that the renderer displays for a given data object based on the labelField and labelFunction properties.

string.name: dataProvider
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the data model of the list of items to be viewed.

string.name: labelField
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a field in each item that contains a label for each tile.

string.name: labelFunction
string.tiptext: Gets a function that indicates the fields of an item that provide the label text for a tile.

string.name: iconField
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the item field that provides the icon for the item.

string.name: iconFunction
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the function to be used to obtain the icon for the item.

string.name: sourceField
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the item field that provides the source path for a tile.

string.name: sourceFunction
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the function to be used to obtain the source path for a tile.

string.name: rowCount
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the number of rows that are at least partially visible in the list.

string.name: rowHeight
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the height that is applied to each row in the list, in pixels.

string.name: columnCount
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the number of columns that are at least partially visible in the list.

string.name: columnWidth
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the width that is applied to a column in the list, in pixels.

string.name: innerWidth
string.tiptext: Gets the width of the content area, in pixels.

string.name: innerHeight
string.tiptext: Gets the height of the content area, in pixels.

string.name: direction
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the TileList component scrolls horizontally or vertically.

string.name: scrollPolicy
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the scroll policy for the TileList component.

string.name: maxHorizontalScrollPosition
string.tiptext: Gets the maximum horizontal scroll position for the current content, in pixels.

folder.name: UIScrollBar
folder.tiptext: The UIScrollBar class includes all of the scroll bar functionality, but adds a scrollTarget() method so it can be attached to a TextField component instance.

string.name: UIScrollBar
string.tiptext: Creates a new UIScrollBar component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: update
string.tiptext: Forces the scroll bar to update its scroll properties immediately.

string.name: setScrollProperties
string.tiptext: Sets the range and viewport size of the ScrollBar component.

string.name: scrollTarget
string.tiptext: Registers a TextField component instance with the ScrollBar component instance.

string.name: direction
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the scroll bar scrolls horizontally or vertically.

folder.name: DataGridCellEditor
folder.tiptext: The DataGridCellEditor class defines the default item editor for a DataGrid control.

string.name: DataGridCellEditor
string.tiptext: Creates a new DataGridCellEditor instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: setMouseState
string.tiptext: Sets the current cell to a specific mouse state.

string.name: listData
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the list properties that are applied to the cell--for example, the index and selected values.

string.name: data
string.tiptext: Gets or sets an Object that represents the data that is associated with a component.

string.name: selected
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the cell is included in the indices that were selected by the owner.

folder.name: DataGridColumn
folder.tiptext: The DataGridColumn class describes a column in a DataGrid component.

string.name: DataGridColumn
string.tiptext: Creates a new DataGridColumn instance.

string.name: itemToLabel
string.tiptext: Returns the string that the item renderer displays for the given data object.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the DataGridColumn object.

string.name: sortable
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the user can click on the header of the current column to sort the data provider.

string.name: resizable
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the user is allowed to change the width of the column.

string.name: editable
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the items in the column can be edited.

string.name: itemEditor
string.tiptext: Indicates the class of the instances of the item editor to use for the column, when it is editable.

string.name: editorDataField
string.tiptext: Identifies the name of the property of the item editor that contains the new data for the list item.

string.name: dataField
string.tiptext: Identifies the name of the field or property in the data provider item that is associated with the column.

string.name: sortDescending
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the DataGridColumn is to be sorted in ascending or descending order.

string.name: sortOptions
string.tiptext: One or more defined constants, identified by name or number and separated by the bitwise OR (|) operator.

string.name: cellRenderer
string.tiptext: The class that is used to render the items in this column.

string.name: headerRenderer
string.tiptext: The class that is used to render the header of this column.

string.name: headerText
string.tiptext: The column name to be displayed in the column header.

string.name: imeMode
string.tiptext: The mode of the input method editor (IME).

string.name: labelFunction
string.tiptext: A function that determines the text to be displayed in this column.

string.name: minWidth
string.tiptext: The minimum width of the column, in pixels.

string.name: sortCompareFunction
string.tiptext: A callback function that is called when sorting the data in the column.

string.name: visible
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the column is visible.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: The width of the column, in pixels.

string.tiptext: Gets or sets the list properties that are applied to the cell--for example, the index and selected values.

string.tiptext: Gets or sets an Object that represents the data that is associated with a component.

string.name: setMouseState

string.tiptext: Gets or sets the list properties that are applied to the cell--for example, the index and selected values.

string.name: data
string.tiptext: Gets or sets an Object that represents the data that is associated with a component.

string.tiptext: Creates a new instance of the ListData class as specified by its parameters.

string.tiptext: Gets or sets an absolute or relative URL that identifies the location of the SWF or image file to load, the class name of a movie clip in the library, or a reference to a display object.

folder.name: IndeterminateBar
folder.tiptext: The IndeterminateBar class handles the drawing of the progress bar component when the size of the source that is being loaded is unknown.

string.name: IndeterminateBar
string.tiptext: Creates a new instance of the IndeterminateBar component.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: visible
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the indeterminate bar is visible.

folder.name: InvalidationType
folder.tiptext: The InvalidationType class defines InvalidationType constants that are used by the type property of an event object that is dispatched after a component is invalidated.

string.name: ALL
string.tiptext: The InvalidationType.ALL constant defines the value of the type property of the event object that is dispatched to indicate that the component should redraw itself entirely.

string.name: SIZE
string.tiptext: The InvalidationType.SIZE constant defines the value of the type property of the event object that is dispatched to indicate that the screen dimensions of the component are invalid.

string.name: STYLES
string.tiptext: The InvalidationType.STYLES constant defines the value of the type property of the event object that is dispatched to indicate that the styles of the component are invalid.

string.name: RENDERER_STYLES
string.tiptext: The InvalidationType.RENDERER_STYLES constant defines the value of the type property of the event object that is dispatched to indicate that the renderer styles of the component are invalid.

string.name: STATE
string.tiptext: The InvalidationType.STATE constant defines the value of the type property of the event object that is dispatched to indicate that the state of the component is invalid.

string.name: DATA
string.tiptext: The InvalidationType.DATA constant defines the value of the type property of the event object that is dispatched to indicate that the data that belongs to a component is invalid.

string.name: SCROLL
string.tiptext: The InvalidationType.SCROLL constant defines the value of the type property of the event object that is dispatched to indicate that the scroll position of the component is invalid.

string.name: SELECTED
string.tiptext: The InvalidationType.SELECTED constant defines the value of the type property of the event object that is dispatched to indicate that the selected property of the component is invalid.

folder.name: UIComponent
folder.tiptext: The UIComponent class is the base class for all visual components, both interactive and noninteractive.

string.name: UIComponent
string.tiptext: Creates a new UIComponent component instance.

string.name: getStyleDefinition
string.tiptext: Retrieves the default style map for the current component.

string.name: mergeStyles
string.tiptext: Merges the styles from multiple classes into one object.

string.name: setSize
string.tiptext: Sets the component to the specified width and height.

string.name: setStyle
string.tiptext: Sets a style property on this component instance.

string.name: clearStyle
string.tiptext: Deletes a style property from this component instance.

string.name: getStyle
string.tiptext: Retrieves a style property that is set in the style lookup chain of the component.

string.name: move
string.tiptext: Moves the component to the specified position within its parent.

string.name: validateNow
string.tiptext: Validates and updates the properties and layout of this object, redrawing it if necessary.

string.name: invalidate
string.tiptext: Marks a property as invalid and redraws the component on the next frame unless otherwise specified.

string.name: drawFocus
string.tiptext: Shows or hides the focus indicator on this component.

string.name: setFocus
string.tiptext: Sets the focus to this component.

string.name: getFocus
string.tiptext: Retrieves the object that currently has focus.

string.name: drawNow
string.tiptext: Initiates an immediate draw operation, without invalidating everything as invalidateNow does.

string.name: version
string.tiptext: The version number of the components.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the component can accept user interaction.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the width of the component, in pixels.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the height of the component, in pixels.

string.name: x
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the x coordinate that represents the position of the component along the x axis within its parent container.

string.name: y
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the y coordinate that represents the position of the component along the y axis within its parent container.

string.name: scaleX
string.tiptext: Multiplies the current width of the component by a scale factor.

string.name: scaleY
string.tiptext: Multiplies the current height of the component by a scale factor.

string.name: visible
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the current component instance is visible.

string.name: focusEnabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the component can receive focus after the user clicks it.

string.name: mouseFocusEnabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the component can receive focus after the user clicks it.

string.name: focusManager
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the FocusManager that controls focus for this component and its peers.

string.name: move
string.tiptext: Dispatched after the component is moved.

string.name: resize
string.tiptext: Dispatched after the component is resized.

string.name: show
string.tiptext: Dispatched after the component visibility changes from invisible to visible.

string.name: hide
string.tiptext: Dispatched after the component visibility changes from visible to invisible.

folder.name: DataProvider
folder.tiptext: The DataProvider class provides methods and properties that allow you to query and modify the data in any list-based component--for example, in a List, DataGrid, TileList, or ComboBox component.

string.name: DataProvider
string.tiptext: Creates a new DataProvider object using a list, XML instance or an array of data objects as the data source.

string.name: invalidateItemAt
string.tiptext: Invalidates the item at the specified index.

string.name: invalidateItem
string.tiptext: Invalidates the specified item.

string.name: invalidate
string.tiptext: Invalidates all the data items that the DataProvider contains and dispatches a DataChangeEvent.INVALIDATE_ALL event.

string.name: addItemAt
string.tiptext: Adds a new item to the data provider at the specified index.

string.name: addItem
string.tiptext: Appends an item to the end of the data provider.

string.name: addItemsAt
string.tiptext: Adds several items to the data provider at the specified index and dispatches a DataChangeType.ADD event.

string.name: addItems
string.tiptext: Appends multiple items to the end of the DataProvider and dispatches a DataChangeType.ADD event.

string.name: concat
string.tiptext: Concatenates the specified items to the end of the current data provider.

string.name: merge
string.tiptext: Appends the specified data into the data that the data provider contains and removes any duplicate items.

string.name: getItemAt
string.tiptext: Returns the item at the specified index.

string.name: getItemIndex
string.tiptext: Returns the index of the specified item.

string.name: removeItemAt
string.tiptext: Removes the item at the specified index and dispatches a DataChangeType.REMOVE event.

string.name: removeItem
string.tiptext: Removes the specified item from the data provider and dispatches a DataChangeType.REMOVE event.

string.name: removeAll
string.tiptext: Removes all items from the data provider and dispatches a DataChangeType.REMOVE_ALL event.

string.name: replaceItem
string.tiptext: Replaces an existing item with a new item and dispatches a DataChangeType.REPLACE event.

string.name: replaceItemAt
string.tiptext: Replaces the item at the specified index and dispatches a DataChangeType.REPLACE event.

string.name: sort
string.tiptext: Sorts the items that the data provider contains and dispatches a DataChangeType.SORT event.

string.name: sortOn
string.tiptext: Sorts the items that the data provider contains by the specified field and dispatches a DataChangeType.SORT event.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the current DataProvider object.

string.name: toArray
string.tiptext: Creates an Array object representation of the data that the data provider contains.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Creates a string representation of the data that the data provider contains.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: The number of items that the data provider contains.

string.name: preDataChange
string.tiptext: Dispatched before the data is changed.

string.name: dataChange
string.tiptext: Dispatched after the data is changed.

folder.name: DataChangeType

string.name: CHANGE
string.tiptext: A change was made to the component data.

string.name: INVALIDATE
string.tiptext: A change was made to the data contained in an item.

string.name: INVALIDATE_ALL
string.tiptext: The data set is invalid.

string.name: ADD
string.tiptext: Items were added to the data provider.

string.name: REMOVE
string.tiptext: Items were removed from the data provider.

string.name: REMOVE_ALL
string.tiptext: All items were removed from the data provider.

string.tiptext: The items in the data provider were replaced by new items.

string.name: SORT
string.tiptext: The data provider was sorted.

string.tiptext: The DataGridEvent.ITEM_EDIT_END constant defines the value of the type property of an itemEditEnd event object.

string.name: ITEM_FOCUS_OUT
string.tiptext: The DataGridEvent.ITEM_FOCUS_OUT constant defines the value of the type property of an itemFocusOut event object.

string.name: itemRenderer
string.tiptext: Gets the item renderer for the item that is being edited or the header renderer that is being clicked or resized.

string.name: dataField
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the name of the field or property in the data associated with the column.

string.name: reason
string.tiptext: Gets the reason the itemEditEnd event was dispatched.

folder.name: DataGridEventReason
folder.tiptext: The DataGridEventReason class defines constants that are used for the values of the reason property of the DataGridEvent object when the value of the type property is itemEditEnd.

string.name: CANCELLED
string.tiptext: The user canceled editing and does not want to save the edited data.

string.name: OTHER
string.tiptext: The list component lost focus, was scrolled, or is in a state where editing is not allowed.

string.name: NEW_COLUMN
string.tiptext: The user moved focus to a new column in the same row.

string.name: NEW_ROW
string.tiptext: Indicates that the user moved focus to a new row.

string.name: MOUSE
string.tiptext: The InteractionInputType.MOUSE constant defines the value of the type property of a mouse event object.

string.name: KEYBOARD
string.tiptext: The InteractionInputType.KEYBOARD constant defines the value of the type property of a keyboard event object.

folder.name: ListEvent
folder.tiptext: The ListEvent class defines events for list-based components including the List, DataGrid, TileList, and ComboBox components.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the ListEvent object.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the ListEvent object and sets the value of each parameter to match the original.

string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an itemRollOut event object.

string.name: ITEM_DOUBLE_CLICK
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an itemDoubleClick event object.

string.name: rowIndex
string.tiptext: Gets the row index of the item that is associated with this event.

string.name: columnIndex
string.tiptext: Gets the column index of the item that is associated with this event.

string.name: index
string.tiptext: Gets the zero-based index of the cell that contains the renderer.

string.name: item
string.tiptext: Gets the data that belongs to the current cell renderer.

string.tiptext: Gets the size of the change in scroll position, in pixels.

string.tiptext: Gets the current scroll position, in pixels.

string.tiptext: Gets the type of device that was used to send the input.

folder.tiptext: The SliderEventClickTarget class defines constants for the values of the clickTarget property of the SliderEvent class.

string.name: TRACK
string.tiptext: The Slider track was clicked.

folder.name: Locale
folder.tiptext: The fl.lang.Locale class allows you to control how multilanguage text is displayed in a SWF file.

string.name: getDefaultLang
string.tiptext: The default language code as set in the Strings panel dialog box or by calling the setDefaultLang() method.

string.name: setDefaultLang
string.tiptext: Sets the default language code.

string.name: addXMLPath
string.tiptext: Adds the {languageCode and languagePath} pair into the internal array for later use.

string.name: addDelayedInstance
string.tiptext: Adds the {instance, string ID} pair into the internal array for later use.

string.name: checkXMLStatus
string.tiptext: Returns true if the XML file is loaded; false otherwise.

string.name: setLoadCallback
string.tiptext: Sets the callback function that is called after the XML file is loaded.

string.name: loadString
string.tiptext: Returns the string value associated with the given string ID in the current language.

string.name: loadStringEx
string.tiptext: Returns the string value associated with the given string ID and language code.

string.name: setString
string.tiptext: Sets the new string value of a given string ID and language code.

string.name: initialize
string.tiptext: Automatically determines the language to use and loads the XML language file.

string.name: loadLanguageXML
string.tiptext: Loads the specified XML language file.

string.name: autoReplace
string.tiptext: Determines whether strings are replaced automatically after loading the XML file.

string.name: languageCodeArray
string.tiptext: An array containing language codes for the languages that have been specified or loaded into the FLA file.

string.name: stringIDArray
string.tiptext: An array containing all the string IDs in the FLA file.

folder.name: LivePreviewParent
folder.tiptext: The LivePreviewParent class provides the timeline for a SWC file or for a compiled clip that is being exported when ActionScript 3.0 is selected.

string.name: LivePreviewParent
string.tiptext: Initializes the scale and align modes of the Stage, sets the myInstance property, resizes myInstance to the proper size and uses the ExternalInterface class to expose functions to Flash.

string.name: onResize
string.tiptext: Resizes the component instance on the Stage to the specified dimensions, either by calling a user-defined method, or by separately setting the width and height properties.

string.name: onUpdate
string.tiptext: Updates the properties of the component instance.

string.name: myInstance
string.tiptext: The component instance.

folder.name: FocusManager
folder.tiptext: The FocusManager class manages focus for a set of components that are navigated by mouse or keyboard as a tab loop.

string.name: FocusManager
string.tiptext: Creates a new FocusManager instance.

string.name: activate
string.tiptext: Activates the FocusManager instance.

string.name: deactivate
string.tiptext: Deactivates the FocusManager.

string.name: getNextFocusManagerComponent
string.tiptext: Retrieves the interactive object that would receive focus if the user pressed the Tab key to navigate to the next object.

string.name: getFocus
string.tiptext: Gets the interactive object that currently has focus.

string.name: setFocus
string.tiptext: Sets focus on an IFocusManagerComponent component.

string.name: showFocus
string.tiptext: Sets the showFocusIndicator value to true and draws the visual focus indicator on the object with focus, if any.

string.name: hideFocus
string.tiptext: Sets the showFocusIndicator value to false and removes the visual focus indicator from the object that has focus, if any.

string.name: findFocusManagerComponent
string.tiptext: Retrieves the interactive object that contains the given object, if any.

string.name: defaultButton
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the current default button.

string.name: defaultButtonEnabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the default button is enabled.

string.name: nextTabIndex
string.tiptext: Gets the next unique tab index to use in this tab loop.

string.name: showFocusIndicator
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a component that has focus should be marked with a visual indicator of focus.

folder.name: IFocusManager
folder.tiptext: Implement the IFocusManager interface to create a custom focus manager.

string.name: getFocus
string.tiptext: Retrieves the IFocusManagerComponent component that currently has focus.

string.name: setFocus
string.tiptext: Sets focus to an IFocusManagerComponent component.

string.name: showFocus
string.tiptext: Sets the showFocusIndicator property to true.

string.name: hideFocus
string.tiptext: Sets the showFocusIndicator property to false.

string.name: activate
string.tiptext: Activates a focus manager.

string.name: deactivate
string.tiptext: Deactivates a focus manager.

string.name: findFocusManagerComponent
string.tiptext: Retrieves the IFocusManagerComponent object that contains the specified object, if there is one.

string.name: getNextFocusManagerComponent
string.tiptext: Retrieves the component that receives focus next if the user causes focus to move by using the Tab key.

string.name: defaultButton
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a reference to the default button.

string.name: defaultButtonEnabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the default button is enabled.

string.name: nextTabIndex
string.tiptext: Gets the next unique tab index to use in the current tab loop.

string.name: showFocusIndicator
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the user interface changes to indicate that a specific component has focus.

folder.name: IFocusManagerComponent
folder.tiptext: The IFocusManagerComponent interface provides methods and properties that give components the capability to receive focus.

string.name: setFocus
string.tiptext: Sets focus for a component.

string.name: drawFocus
string.tiptext: Draws a visual focus indicator.

string.name: focusEnabled
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether a selected component can receive focus from the focus manager.

string.name: mouseFocusEnabled
string.tiptext: Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether a component that is selected by using a mouse device can receive focus.

string.name: tabEnabled
string.tiptext: Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether pressing the Tab key can move focus to this component.

string.name: tabIndex
string.tiptext: Gets the order in which the component receives focus, if tabEnabledis set to true.

folder.name: IFocusManagerGroup
folder.tiptext: The IFocusManagerGroup interface provides properties that are used to manage a set of components of which only one can be selected at a time.

string.name: groupName
string.tiptext: Gets or sets the name of the group of components to which this component belongs.

string.name: selected
string.tiptext: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether this component is selected.

folder.name: StyleManager
folder.tiptext: The StyleManager class provides static methods that can be used to get and set styles for a component instance, an entire component type, or all user interface components in a Flash document.

string.name: StyleManager
string.tiptext: Creates a new StyleManager object.

string.name: registerInstance
string.tiptext: Registers a component instance with the style manager.

string.name: getComponentStyle
string.tiptext: Gets a style that exists on a specific component.

string.name: clearComponentStyle
string.tiptext: Removes a style from the specified component.

string.name: setComponentStyle
string.tiptext: Sets a style on all instances of a component type, for example, on all instances of a Button component, or on all instances of a ComboBox component.

string.name: setStyle
string.tiptext: Sets a global style for all user interface components in a document.

string.name: clearStyle
string.tiptext: Removes a global style from all user interface components in a document.

string.name: getStyle
string.tiptext: Gets a global style by name.

folder.name: Animator
folder.tiptext: The Animator class applies an XML description of a motion tween to a display object.

string.name: Animator
string.tiptext: Creates an Animator object to apply the XML-based motion tween description to a display object.

string.name: fromXMLString
string.tiptext: Creates an Animator object from a string of XML.

string.name: nextFrame
string.tiptext: Advances Flash Player to the next frame in the animation sequence.

string.name: play
string.tiptext: Begins the animation.

string.name: end
string.tiptext: Stops the animation and Flash Player goes immediately to the last frame in the animation sequence.

string.name: stop
string.tiptext: Stops the animation and Flash Player goes back to the first frame in the animation sequence.

string.name: pause
string.tiptext: Pauses the animation until you call the resume() method.

string.name: resume
string.tiptext: Resumes the animation after it has been paused by the pause() method.

string.name: rewind
string.tiptext: Sets Flash Player to the first frame of the animation.

string.name: orientToPath
string.tiptext: Sets the position of the display object along the motion path.

string.name: transformationPoint
string.tiptext: The point of reference for rotating or scaling a display object.

string.name: autoRewind
string.tiptext: Sets the animation to restart after it finishes.

string.name: positionMatrix
string.tiptext: The Matrix object that applies an overall transformation to the motion path.

string.name: repeatCount
string.tiptext: Number of times to repeat the animation.

string.name: motion
string.tiptext: The object that contains the motion tween properties for the animation.

string.name: isPlaying
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the animation is currently playing.

string.name: target
string.tiptext: The display object being animated.

string.name: time
string.tiptext: A zero-based integer that indicates and controls the time in the current animation.

string.name: motionEnd
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the motion finishes playing, either when it reaches the end, or when the motion has been interrupted by a call to the stop() or end() methods.

string.name: motionStart
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the motion starts playing.

string.name: motionUpdate
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the motion has changed and the screen has been updated.

string.name: timeChange
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the Animator's time value has changed, but the screen has not yet been updated (i.e., the motionUpdate event).

folder.name: BezierEase
folder.tiptext: The BezierEase class provides precise easing control for a motion tween between two keyframes.

string.name: BezierEase
string.tiptext: Constructor for BezierEase instances.

string.name: getValue
string.tiptext: Calculates an interpolated value for a numerical property of animation, using a Bezier easing curve.

string.name: points
string.tiptext: An ordered collection of points in the custom easing curve.

string.name: target
string.tiptext: The name of the animation property to target.

folder.name: BezierSegment
folder.tiptext: A Bezier segment consists of four Point objects that define a single cubic Bezier curve.

string.name: BezierSegment
string.tiptext: Constructor for BezierSegment instances.

string.name: getValue
string.tiptext: Calculates the location of a two-dimensional cubic Bezier curve at a specific time.

string.name: getSingleValue
string.tiptext: Calculates the value of a one-dimensional cubic Bezier equation at a specific time.

string.name: getYForX
string.tiptext: Finds the y value of a cubic Bezier curve at a given x coordinate.

string.name: getCubicCoefficients
string.tiptext: Calculates the coefficients for a cubic polynomial equation, given the values of the corresponding cubic Bezier equation.

string.name: getCubicRoots
string.tiptext: Finds the real solutions, if they exist, to a cubic polynomial equation of the form: at^3 + bt^2 + ct + d.

string.name: getQuadraticRoots
string.tiptext: Finds the real solutions, if they exist, to a quadratic equation of the form: at^2 + bt + c.

string.name: a
string.tiptext: The first point of the Bezier curve.

string.name: b
string.tiptext: The second point of the Bezier curve.

string.name: c
string.tiptext: The third point of the Bezier curve.

string.name: d
string.tiptext: The fourth point of the Bezier curve.

folder.name: Color
folder.tiptext: The Color class extends the Flash Player ColorTransform class, adding the ability to control brightness and tint.

string.name: Color
string.tiptext: Constructor for Color instances.

string.name: setTint
string.tiptext: Sets the tint color and amount at the same time.

string.name: fromXML
string.tiptext: Creates a Color instance from XML.

string.name: interpolateTransform
string.tiptext: Blends smoothly from one ColorTransform object to another.

string.name: interpolateColor
string.tiptext: Blends smoothly from one color value to another.

string.name: brightness
string.tiptext: The percentage of brightness, as a decimal between -1 and 1.

string.name: tintColor
string.tiptext: The tinting color value in the 0xRRGGBB format.

string.name: tintMultiplier
string.tiptext: The percentage to apply the tint color, as a decimal value between 0 and 1.

folder.name: CustomEase
folder.tiptext: The CustomEase class is used to modify specific properties of the easing behavior of a motion tween as the tween progresses over time.

string.name: CustomEase
string.tiptext: Constructor for CustomEase instances.

string.name: getValue
string.tiptext: Calculates an interpolated value for a numerical property of animation, using a custom easing curve.

string.name: points
string.tiptext: An ordered collection of points in the custom easing curve.

string.name: target
string.tiptext: The name of the animation property to target.

folder.name: FunctionEase
folder.tiptext: The FunctionEase class allows custom interpolation functions to be used with the fl.motion framework in place of other interpolations like SimpleEase and CustomEase.

string.name: FunctionEase
string.tiptext: Constructor for FunctionEase instances.

string.name: getValue
string.tiptext: Calculates an interpolated value for a numerical property of animation, using the specified easing function.

string.name: easingFunction
string.tiptext: A reference to a function with a (t, b, c, d) signature like the methods in the fl.motion.easing classes.

string.name: parameters
string.tiptext: An optional array of values to be passed to the easing function as additional arguments.

string.name: functionName
string.tiptext: The fully qualified name of an easing function, such as fl.motion.easing.Bounce.easeOut().

string.name: target
string.tiptext: The name of the animation property to target.

folder.name: ITween
folder.tiptext: The ITween interface defines the application programming interface (API) that interpolation classes implement in order to work with the fl.motion classes.

string.name: getValue
string.tiptext: Calculates an interpolated value for a numerical property of animation.

string.name: target
string.tiptext: The name of the animation property to target.

folder.name: Keyframe
folder.tiptext: The Keyframe class defines the visual state at a specific time in a motion tween.

string.name: Keyframe
string.tiptext: Constructor for keyframe instances.

string.name: getValue
string.tiptext: Retrieves the value of a specific tweenable property on the keyframe.

string.name: setValue
string.tiptext: Changes the value of a specific tweenable property on the keyframe.

string.name: getTween
string.tiptext: Retrieves an ITween object for a specific animation property.

string.name: affectsTweenable
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the keyframe has an influence on a specific animation property.

string.name: x
string.tiptext: The horizontal position of the target object's transformation point in its parent's coordinate space.

string.name: y
string.tiptext: The vertical position of the target object's transformation point in its parent's coordinate space.

string.name: scaleX
string.tiptext: Indicates the horizontal scale as a percentage of the object as applied from the transformation point.

string.name: scaleY
string.tiptext: Indicates the vertical scale as a percentage of the object as applied from the transformation point.

string.name: skewX
string.tiptext: Indicates the horizontal skew angle of the target object in degrees as applied from the transformation point.

string.name: skewY
string.tiptext: Indicates the vertical skew angle of the target object in degrees as applied from the transformation point.

string.name: tweens
string.tiptext: An array that contains each tween object to be applied to the target object at a particular keyframe.

string.name: filters
string.tiptext: An array that contains each filter object to be applied to the target object at a particular keyframe.

string.name: color
string.tiptext: A color object that adjusts the color transform in the target object.

string.name: label
string.tiptext: A string used to describe the keyframe.

string.name: tweenScale
string.tiptext: A flag that controls whether scale will be interpolated during a tween.

string.name: tweenSnap
string.tiptext: Stores the value of the Snap checkbox for motion tweens, which snaps the object to a motion guide.

string.name: tweenSync
string.tiptext: Stores the value of the Sync checkbox for motion tweens, which affects graphic symbols only.

string.name: loop
string.tiptext: Stores the value of the Loop checkbox for motion tweens, which affects graphic symbols only.

string.name: firstFrame
string.tiptext: Stores the name of the first frame for motion tweens, which affects graphic symbols only.

string.name: cacheAsBitmap
string.tiptext: If set to true, Flash Player caches an internal bitmap representation of the display object.

string.name: blendMode
string.tiptext: A value from the BlendMode class that specifies how Flash Player mixes the display object's colors with graphics underneath it.

string.name: rotateDirection
string.tiptext: Controls how the target object rotates during a motion tween, with a value from the RotateDirection class.

string.name: rotateTimes
string.tiptext: Adds rotation to the target object during a motion tween, in addition to any existing rotation.

string.name: orientToPath
string.tiptext: If set to true, this property causes the target object to rotate automatically to follow the angle of its path.

string.name: blank
string.tiptext: Indicates that the target object should not be displayed on this keyframe.

string.name: index
string.tiptext: The keyframe's unique time value in the motion tween.

string.name: rotation
string.tiptext: Indicates the rotation of the target object in degrees from its original orientation as applied from the transformation point.

folder.name: MatrixTransformer
folder.tiptext: The MatrixTransformer class contains methods for modifying individual properties of a transformation matrix: horizontal and vertical scale, horizontal and vertical skew, and rotation.

string.name: getScaleX
string.tiptext: Calculates the horizontal scale present in a matrix.

string.name: setScaleX
string.tiptext: Changes the horizontal scale in a matrix.

string.name: getScaleY
string.tiptext: Calculates the vertical scale present in a matrix.

string.name: setScaleY
string.tiptext: Changes the vertical scale in a matrix.

string.name: getSkewXRadians
string.tiptext: Calculates the angle of horizontal skew present in a matrix, in radians.

string.name: setSkewXRadians
string.tiptext: Changes the horizontal skew in a matrix.

string.name: getSkewYRadians
string.tiptext: Calculates the angle of vertical skew present in a matrix, in radians.

string.name: setSkewYRadians
string.tiptext: Changes the vertical skew in a matrix.

string.name: getSkewX
string.tiptext: Calculates the angle of horizontal skew present in a matrix, in degrees.

string.name: setSkewX
string.tiptext: Changes the horizontal skew in a matrix.

string.name: getSkewY
string.tiptext: Calculates the angle of vertical skew present in a matrix, in degrees.

string.name: setSkewY
string.tiptext: Changes the vertical skew in a matrix.

string.name: getRotationRadians
string.tiptext: Calculates the angle of rotation present in a matrix, in radians.

string.name: setRotationRadians
string.tiptext: Changes the angle of rotation in a matrix.

string.name: getRotation
string.tiptext: Calculates the angle of rotation present in a matrix, in degrees.

string.name: setRotation
string.tiptext: Changes the angle of rotation in a matrix.

string.name: rotateAroundInternalPoint
string.tiptext: Rotates a matrix about a point defined inside the matrix's transformation space.

string.name: rotateAroundExternalPoint
string.tiptext: Rotates a matrix about a point defined outside the matrix's transformation space.

string.name: matchInternalPointWithExternal
string.tiptext: Moves a matrix as necessary to align an internal point with an external point.

folder.name: Motion
folder.tiptext: The Motion class stores a keyframe animation sequence that can be applied to a visual object.

string.name: Motion
string.tiptext: Constructor for Motion instances.

string.name: getCurrentKeyframe
string.tiptext: Retrieves the keyframe that is currently active at a specific frame in the Motion instance.

string.name: getNextKeyframe
string.tiptext: Retrieves the next keyframe after a specific frame in the Motion instance.

string.name: setValue
string.tiptext: Sets the value of a specific tweenables property at a given time index in the Motion instance.

string.name: getColorTransform
string.tiptext: Retrieves an interpolated ColorTransform object at a specific time index in the Motion instance.

string.name: getFilters
string.tiptext: Retrieves an interpolated array of filters at a specific time index in the Motion instance.

string.name: getValue
string.tiptext: Retrieves the value for an animation property at a point in time.

string.name: addKeyframe
string.tiptext: Adds a keyframe object to the Motion instance.

string.name: fromXMLString
string.tiptext: A method needed to create a Motion instance from a string of XML.

string.name: interpolateFilters
string.tiptext: Blends filters smoothly from one array of filter objects to another.

string.name: interpolateFilter
string.tiptext: Blends filters smoothly from one filter object to another.

string.name: source
string.tiptext: An object that stores information about the context in which the motion was created, such as framerate, dimensions, transformation point, and initial position, scale, rotation and skew.

string.name: keyframes
string.tiptext: An array of keyframes that define the motion's behavior over time.

string.name: keyframesCompact
string.tiptext: A compact array of keyframes, where each index is occupied by a keyframe.

string.name: duration
string.tiptext: Controls the Motion instance's length of time, measured in frames.

folder.name: MotionEvent
folder.tiptext: The MotionEvent class represents events that are broadcast by the fl.motion.Animator class.

string.name: MOTION_START
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Motion instance has started playing.

string.name: MOTION_END
string.tiptext: Indicates that the motion has stopped, whether by an explicit call to Animator.stop() or Animator.end(), or by reaching the end of the Motion instance.

string.name: MOTION_UPDATE
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Motion instance has changed and the screen has been updated.

string.name: TIME_CHANGE
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Animator instance's time value has changed, but the screen has not yet been updated (Flash Player has not dispatched the motionUpdate event).

folder.name: RotateDirection
folder.tiptext: The RotateDirection class provides constant values for rotation behavior during a tween.

string.name: AUTO
string.tiptext: Chooses a direction of rotation that requires the least amount of turning.

string.name: NONE
string.tiptext: Prevents the object from rotating during a tween until the next keyframe is reached.

string.name: CW
string.tiptext: Ensures that the object rotates clockwise during a tween to match the rotation of the object in the following keyframe.

string.name: CCW
string.tiptext: Ensures that the object rotates counterclockwise during a tween to match the rotation of the object in the following keyframe.

folder.name: SimpleEase
folder.tiptext: The SimpleEase class allows you to control an animation with the kind of percentage easing that is used in the Flash timeline.

string.name: SimpleEase
string.tiptext: Constructor for SimpleEase instances.

string.name: easeQuadPercent
string.tiptext: Calculates an interpolated value for a numerical property of animation, using a percentage of quadratic easing.

string.name: easeNone
string.tiptext: Calculates an interpolated value for a numerical property of animation, using a linear tween of constant velocity.

string.name: getValue
string.tiptext: Calculates an interpolated value for a numerical property of animation, using a percentage of quadratic easing.

string.name: ease
string.tiptext: A percentage between -1 (100% ease in or acceleration) and 1 (100% ease out or deceleration).

string.name: target
string.tiptext: The name of the animation property to target.

folder.name: Source
folder.tiptext: The Source class stores information about the context in which a Motion instance was generated.

string.name: Source
string.tiptext: Constructor for Source instances.

string.name: frameRate
string.tiptext: Indicates the frames per second of the movie in which the Motion instance was generated.

string.name: elementType
string.tiptext: Indicates the type of object from which the Motion instance was generated.

string.name: symbolName
string.tiptext: Indicates the name of the symbol from which the Motion instance was generated.

string.name: instanceName
string.tiptext: Indicates the instance name given to the movie clip from which the Motion instance was generated.

string.name: linkageID
string.tiptext: Indicates the library linkage identifier for the symbol from which the Motion instance was generated.

string.name: x
string.tiptext: Indicates the x value of the original object.

string.name: y
string.tiptext: Indicates the y value of the original object.

string.name: scaleX
string.tiptext: Indicates the scaleX value of the original object.

string.name: scaleY
string.tiptext: Indicates the scaleY value of the original object.

string.name: skewX
string.tiptext: Indicates the skewX value of the original object.

string.name: skewY
string.tiptext: Indicates the skewY value of the original object.

string.name: rotation
string.tiptext: Indicates the rotation value of the original object.

string.name: transformationPoint
string.tiptext: Specifies the location of the transformation or "pivot" point of the original object, from which transformations are applied.

string.name: dimensions
string.tiptext: Indicates the position and size of the bounding box of the object from which the Motion instance was generated.

folder.name: Tweenables
folder.tiptext: The Tweenables class provides constant values for the names of animation properties used in the Motion and Keyframe classes.

string.name: X
string.tiptext: Constant for the x property.

string.name: Y
string.tiptext: Constant for the y property.

string.name: SCALE_X
string.tiptext: Constant for the scaleX property.

string.name: SCALE_Y
string.tiptext: Constant for the scaleY property.

string.name: SKEW_X
string.tiptext: Constant for the skewX property.

string.name: SKEW_Y
string.tiptext: Constant for the skewY property.

string.name: ROTATION
string.tiptext: Constant for the rotation property.

folder.name: Back
folder.tiptext: The Back class defines three easing functions to implement motion with ActionScript animations.

string.name: easeIn
string.tiptext: The easeIn() method starts the motion by backtracking and then reversing direction and moving toward the target.

string.name: easeOut
string.tiptext: The easeOut() method starts the motion by moving towards the target, overshooting it slightly, and then reversing direction back toward the target.

string.name: easeInOut
string.tiptext: The easeInOut() method combines the motion of the easeIn() and easeOut() methods to start the motion by backtracking, then reversing direction and moving toward the target, overshooting the target slightly, reversing direction again, and then moving back toward the target.

folder.name: Bounce
folder.tiptext: The Bounce class defines three easing functions to implement bouncing motion with ActionScript animation, similar to a ball falling and bouncing on a floor with several decaying rebounds.

string.name: easeOut
string.tiptext: The easeOut() method starts the bounce motion fast and then decelerates motion as it executes.

string.name: easeIn
string.tiptext: The easeIn() method starts the bounce motion slowly and then accelerates motion as it executes.

string.name: easeInOut
string.tiptext: The easeInOut() method combines the motion of the easeIn() and easeOut() methods to start the bounce motion slowly, accelerate motion, then decelerate.

folder.name: Circular
folder.tiptext: The Circular class defines three easing functions to implement motion with ActionScript animation.

string.name: easeIn
string.tiptext: The easeIn() method starts motion from zero velocity and then accelerates motion as it executes.

string.name: easeOut
string.tiptext: The easeOut() method starts motion fast and then decelerates motion to a zero velocity as it executes.

string.name: easeInOut
string.tiptext: The easeInOut() method combines the motion of the easeIn() and easeOut() methods to start the motion from a zero velocity, accelerate motion, then decelerate to a zero velocity.

folder.name: Cubic
folder.tiptext: The Cubic class defines three easing functions to implement motion with ActionScript animation.

string.name: easeIn
string.tiptext: The easeIn() method starts motion from zero velocity and then accelerates motion as it executes.

string.name: easeOut
string.tiptext: The easeOut() method starts motion fast and then decelerates motion to a zero velocity as it executes.

string.name: easeInOut
string.tiptext: The easeInOut() method combines the motion of the easeIn() and easeOut() methods to start the motion from a zero velocity, accelerate motion, then decelerate to a zero velocity.

folder.name: Elastic
folder.tiptext: The Elastic class defines three easing functions to implement motion with ActionScript animation, where the motion is defined by an exponentially decaying sine wave.

string.name: easeIn
string.tiptext: The easeIn() method starts motion slowly and then accelerates motion as it executes.

string.name: easeOut
string.tiptext: The easeOut() method starts motion fast and then decelerates motion as it executes.

string.name: easeInOut
string.tiptext: The easeInOut() method combines the motion of the easeIn() and easeOut() methods to start the motion slowly, accelerate motion, then decelerate.

string.tiptext: The easeIn() method starts motion slowly and then accelerates motion as it executes.

string.name: easeOut
string.tiptext: The easeOut() method starts motion fast and then decelerates motion to a zero velocity as it executes.

string.name: easeInOut
string.tiptext: The easeInOut() method combines the motion of the easeIn() and easeOut() methods to start the motion from a zero velocity, accelerate motion, then decelerate to a zero velocity.

string.tiptext: The easeNone() method defines a constant motion with no acceleration.

string.tiptext: The easeIn() method defines a constant motion with no acceleration.

string.name: easeOut
string.tiptext: The easeOut() method defines a constant motion with no acceleration.

string.name: easeInOut

string.name: easeInOut
string.tiptext: The easeInOut() method combines the motion of the easeIn() and easeOut() methods to start the motion from a zero velocity, accelerate motion, then decelerate to a zero velocity.

string.name: easeInOut
string.tiptext: The easeInOut() method combines the motion of the easeIn() and easeOut() methods to start the motion from a zero velocity, accelerate motion, then decelerate to a zero velocity.

string.name: easeIn
string.tiptext: The easeIn() method starts motion from zero velocity and then accelerates motion as it executes.

string.name: easeOut

string.name: easeInOut
string.tiptext: The easeInOut() method combines the motion of the easeIn() and easeOut() methods to start the motion from a zero velocity, accelerate motion, then decelerate to a zero velocity.

string.name: easeIn
string.tiptext: The easeIn() method starts motion from zero velocity and then accelerates motion as it executes.

string.name: easeOut
string.tiptext: The easeOut() method starts motion fast and then decelerates motion to a zero velocity as it executes.

folder.name: Iris
folder.tiptext: The Iris class reveals the movie clip object by using an animated mask of a square shape or a circle shape that zooms in or out.

string.name: SQUARE
string.tiptext: Used to specify a square mask shape for the transition effect.

string.name: CIRCLE
string.tiptext: Used to specify a circle mask shape for the transition effect.

folder.name: Transition
folder.tiptext: The Transition class is the base class for all transition classes.

string.name: IN
string.tiptext: Constant for the direction property that determines the type of easing.

string.name: OUT
string.tiptext: Constant for the direction property that determines the type of easing.

string.name: direction
string.tiptext: Determines the easing direction for the Tween instance.

string.name: duration
string.tiptext: Determines the length of time for the Tween instance.

string.name: easing
string.tiptext: Sets the tweening effect for the animation.

folder.name: TransitionManager
folder.tiptext: The TransitionManager class defines animation effects.

string.name: TransitionManager
string.tiptext: Constructor function for creating a new TransitionManager instance.

string.name: start
string.tiptext: Creates a new TransitionManager instance, designates the target object, applies a transition, and starts the transition.

string.name: startTransition
string.tiptext: Creates a transition instance and starts it.

string.name: content
string.tiptext: The movie clip instance to which TransitionManager is to apply a transition.

string.name: contentAppearance
string.tiptext: An object that contains the saved visual properties of the content (target movie clip) to which the transitions will be applied.

folder.name: Tween
folder.tiptext: The Tween class lets you use ActionScript to move, resize, and fade movie clips by specifying a property of the target movie clip to animate over a number of frames or seconds.

string.name: Tween
string.tiptext: Creates an instance of the Tween class.

string.name: continueTo
string.tiptext: Instructs the tweened animation to continue tweening from its current animation point to a new finish and duration point.

string.name: yoyo
string.tiptext: Instructs the tweened animation to play in reverse from its last direction of tweened property increments.

string.name: start
string.tiptext: Starts the play of a tweened animation from its starting point.

string.name: stop
string.tiptext: Stops the play of a tweened animation at its current value.

string.name: resume
string.tiptext: Resumes the play of a tweened animation that has been stopped.

string.name: rewind
string.tiptext: Moves the play of a tweened animation back to its starting value.

string.name: fforward
string.tiptext: Forwards the tweened animation directly to the final value of the tweened animation.

string.name: nextFrame
string.tiptext: Forwards the tweened animation to the next frame of an animation that was stopped.

string.name: prevFrame
string.tiptext: Plays the previous frame of the tweened animation from the current stopping point of an animation that was stopped.

string.name: isPlaying
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the tween is currently playing.

string.name: obj
string.tiptext: The target object that is being tweened.

string.name: prop
string.tiptext: The name of the property affected by the tween of the target object.

string.name: func
string.tiptext: The easing function which is used with the tween.

string.name: begin
string.tiptext: The initial value of the target object's designated property before the tween starts.

string.name: useSeconds
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the tween plays over a period of frames or seconds.

string.name: looping
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the tween will loop.

string.name: time
string.tiptext: The current time within the duration of the animation.

string.name: duration
string.tiptext: The duration of the tweened animation in frames or seconds.

string.name: FPS
string.tiptext: The number of frames per second calculated into the tweened animation.

string.name: position
string.tiptext: The current value of the target object property being tweened.

string.name: finish
string.tiptext: A number indicating the ending value of the target object property that is to be tweened.

string.name: motionChange
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Tween has changed and the screen has been updated.

string.name: motionFinish
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Tween has reached the end and finished.

string.name: motionLoop
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Tween has restarted playing from the beginning in looping mode.

string.name: motionResume
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Tween has resumed playing after being paused.

string.name: motionStart
string.tiptext: Indicates that the motion has started playing.

string.name: motionStop
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Tween has been stopped with an explicit call to Tween.stop().

folder.name: TweenEvent
folder.tiptext: The TweenEvent class represents events that are broadcast by the fl.transitions.Tween class.

string.name: TweenEvent
string.tiptext: Constructor function for a TweenEvent object.

string.name: MOTION_START
string.tiptext: Indicates that the motion has started playing.

string.name: MOTION_STOP
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Tween has been stopped with an explicit call to Tween.stop().

string.name: MOTION_FINISH
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Tween has reached the end and finished.

string.name: MOTION_CHANGE
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Tween has changed and the screen has been updated.

string.name: MOTION_RESUME
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Tween has resumed playing after being paused.

string.name: MOTION_LOOP
string.tiptext: Indicates that the Tween has restarted playing from the beginning in looping mode.

string.name: time
string.tiptext: The time of the Tween when the event occurred.

string.name: position
string.tiptext: The value of the property controlled by the Tween, when the event occurred.

folder.name: Back

folder.name: AutoLayoutEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches an AutoLayoutEvent object when the video player is resized and laid out automatically.

string.name: AutoLayoutEvent
string.tiptext: Creates an Event object that contains information about autoLayout events.

string.name: AUTO_LAYOUT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an autoLayout event object.

string.name: vp
string.tiptext: The index of the VideoPlayer object involved in this event.

folder.name: CaptionChangeEvent
folder.tiptext: The CaptionChangeEvent is dispatched any time a caption is added or removed from the caption target text field.

string.name: CaptionChangeEvent
string.tiptext: Creates an Event object that contains information about captionChange events.

string.name: CAPTION_CHANGE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a captionChange event object.

string.name: added
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that determines whether the caption was added or removed.

string.name: captionCuePointObject
string.tiptext: The cue point object for the caption that was added or removed.

folder.name: CaptionTargetEvent
folder.tiptext: Type for the captionTargetCreated event, dispatched after the captionTargetCreated event is created automatically and before any captions have been added to it.

string.name: CaptionTargetEvent
string.tiptext: Creates an Event object that contains information about caption target events.

string.name: CAPTION_TARGET_CREATED
string.tiptext: The CaptionTargetEvent.CAPTION_TARGET_CREATED constant defines the value of the type property of a captionTargetCreated event object.

string.name: captionTarget
string.tiptext: The caption target from the FLVPlaybackCaptioning instance property of the same name.

folder.name: CuePointType
folder.tiptext: The CuePointType class provides constant values for the type property on the info object of a MetadataEvent instance of type CUE_POINT.

string.name: ALL
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type parameter of the findCuePoint() and findNearestCuePoint() methods.

string.name: EVENT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type parameter of the findCuePoint() and findNearestCuePoint() methods.

string.name: NAVIGATION
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type parameter of the findCuePoint() and findNearestCuePoint() methods.

string.name: FLV
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type parameter of the findCuePoint() and findNearestCuePoint() methods.

string.name: ACTIONSCRIPT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type parameter of the findCuePoint() and findNearestCuePoint() methods.

folder.name: FLVPlayback
folder.tiptext: FLVPlayback extends the Sprite class and wraps a VideoPlayer object.

string.name: FLVPlayback
string.tiptext: FLVPlayback constructor

string.name: setSize
string.tiptext: setSize method

string.tiptext: setScale method

string.tiptext: load method

string.tiptext: play method

string.tiptext: playWhenEnoughDownloaded method

string.tiptext: pause method
