folder.name: VideoPlayer
folder.tiptext: The VideoPlayer class lets you create a video player with a slightly smaller SWF file than if you used the FLVPlayback component.

string.name: VideoPlayer
string.tiptext: Creates a VideoPlayer object with a specified width and height.

string.name: setSize
string.tiptext: Sets the width and height properties simultaneously.

string.name: setScale
string.tiptext: Sets the scaleX and scaleY properties simultaneously.

string.name: play
string.tiptext: play method

string.name: playWhenEnoughDownloaded
string.tiptext: playWhenEnoughDownloaded method

string.name: load
string.tiptext: Similar to the play() method, but causes the FLV file to load without playing.

string.name: pause
string.tiptext: Pauses video playback.

string.name: stop
string.tiptext: Stops video playback.

string.name: seek
string.tiptext: Seeks to a given time in the file, specified in seconds, with a precision of three decimal places (milliseconds).

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Forces the video stream and Flash Media Server connection to close.

string.name: ncConnected
string.tiptext: Called by INCManager after the connection is complete or failed after a call to the INCManager.connectToURL() method.

string.name: ncReconnected
string.tiptext: Called by INCManager after the reconnection is complete or has failed after a call to the INCManager.reconnect() method.

string.name: VERSION
string.tiptext: State variable indicating the long version number of the component.

string.name: SHORT_VERSION
string.tiptext: State variable indicating the short version number of the component.

string.name: iNCManagerClass
string.tiptext: To make all VideoPlayer objects use your custom class as the default INCManager implementation, set the iNCManagerClass property to the class object or string name of your custom class.

string.name: scaleX
string.tiptext: A number that is the horizontal scale.

string.name: scaleY
string.tiptext: A number that is the vertical scale.

string.name: x
string.tiptext: A number that specifies the horizontal position (in pixels) of the video player.

string.name: y
string.tiptext: A number that specifies the vertical position (in pixels) of the video player.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: A number that specifies the width of the VideoPlayer instance on the Stage.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: A number that specifies the height of the VideoPlayer instance (in pixels).

string.name: registrationX
string.tiptext: The x coordinate used to align the video content when autoresizing.

string.name: registrationY
string.tiptext: The y coordinate used to align the video content when autoresizing.

string.name: registrationWidth
string.tiptext: The width used to align the video content when autoresizing.

string.name: registrationHeight
string.tiptext: The height used to align the video content when autoresizing.

string.name: videoWidth
string.tiptext: The source width of the loaded FLV file.

string.name: videoHeight
string.tiptext: The source width of the loaded FLV file.

string.name: visible
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that, if true, makes the VideoPlayer instance visible.

string.name: align
string.tiptext: Specifies how the video is displayed relative to the registrationX, registrationY, registrationWidth and registrationHeight properties.

string.name: scaleMode
string.tiptext: Specifies how the video resizes after loading.

string.name: autoRewind
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that, if true, causes the FLV file to rewind to Frame 1 when play stops, either because the player reached the end of the stream or the stop() method was called.

string.name: playheadTime
string.tiptext: A number that is the current playhead time or position, measured in seconds, which can be a fractional value.

string.name: source
string.tiptext: A string that specifies the URL of the FLV file to stream and how to stream it.

string.name: volume
string.tiptext: A number in the range of 0 to 1 that indicates the volume control setting.

string.name: soundTransform
string.tiptext: Provides direct access to the NetStream.soundTransform property to expose more sound control.

string.name: isRTMP
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that is true if the FLV file is streaming from Flash Media Server (FMS) using RTMP.

string.name: isLive
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that is true if the video stream is live.

string.name: state
string.tiptext: A string that specifies the state of the component.

string.name: stateResponsive
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that is true if the state is responsive.

string.name: bytesLoaded
string.tiptext: A number that indicates the extent of downloading, in number of bytes, for an HTTP download.

string.name: bytesTotal
string.tiptext: A number that specifies the total number of bytes downloaded for an HTTP download.

string.name: totalTime
string.tiptext: A number that is the total playing time for the video in seconds.

string.name: bufferTime
string.tiptext: A number that specifies the number of seconds to buffer in memory before beginning to play a video stream.

string.name: idleTimeout
string.tiptext: The amount of time, in milliseconds, before Flash terminates an idle connection to a video server, such as Flash Media Server, because playing paused or stopped.

string.name: playheadUpdateInterval
string.tiptext: A number that is the amount of time, in milliseconds, between each playheadUpdate event.

string.name: progressInterval
string.tiptext: A number that is the amount of time, in milliseconds, between each progress event.

string.name: ncMgr
string.tiptext: An INCManager object that provides access to an instance of the class implementing INCManager, which is an interface to the NCManager class.

string.name: netConnection
string.tiptext: Allows direct access to the NetConnection instance created by the video player.

string.name: netStream
string.tiptext: Allows direct access to the NetStream instance created by the video player.

string.name: metadata
string.tiptext: An object that is a metadata information packet that is received from a call to the NetSteam.onMetaData() callback method, if available.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Dispatched by the VideoPlayer instance when it closes the NetConnection by timing out or through a call to the close() method, or when you call the load() or play() methods or set the source property and cause the RTMP connection to close as a result.

string.name: complete
string.tiptext: Dispatched when playing completes because the player reached the end of the FLV file.

string.name: cuePoint
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a cue point is reached.

string.name: metadataReceived
string.tiptext: Dispatched the first time the FLV file's metadata is reached.

string.name: playheadUpdate
string.tiptext: Dispatched while the FLV file is playing at the frequency specified by the playheadUpdateInterval property or when rewinding starts.

string.name: progress
string.tiptext: Indicates progress made in number of bytes downloaded.

string.name: ready
string.tiptext: Event dispatched when an FLV file is loaded and ready to display.

string.name: layout
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the video player is resized or laid out.

string.name: autoRewound
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the playhead is moved to the start of the video player because the autoRewind property is set to true.

string.name: stateChange
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the playback state changes.

folder.name: VideoProgressEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches a VideoProgressEvent object when the user makes a request for the number of bytes loaded during a progressive HTTP download of their video.

string.name: VideoProgressEvent
string.tiptext: Creates an Event object that contains information about progress events.

string.name: PROGRESS
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a progress event object.

string.name: vp
string.tiptext: The index of the VideoPlayer object involved in this event.

folder.name: VideoScaleMode
folder.tiptext: The VideoScaleMode class provides constant values to use for the FLVPlayback.scaleMode and VideoPlayer.scaleMode properties.

string.name: MAINTAIN_ASPECT_RATIO
string.tiptext: Specifies that the video be constrained within the rectangle determined by the registrationX, registrationY, registrationWidth, and registrationHeight properties but that its original aspect ratio be preserved.

string.name: NO_SCALE
string.tiptext: Specifies that the video be displayed at exactly the height and width of the source video.

string.name: EXACT_FIT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the video be displayed at the height and width specified by the registrationHeight or height and registrationWidth or width properties.

folder.name: VideoState
folder.tiptext: The VideoState class provides constant values for the read-only FLVPlayback.state and VideoPlayer.state properties.

string.name: DISCONNECTED
string.tiptext: The video player is in the disconnected state.

string.name: STOPPED
string.tiptext: The video player is in the stopped state.

string.name: PLAYING
string.tiptext: The video player is in the playing state.

string.name: PAUSED
string.tiptext: The video player is in the paused state.

string.name: BUFFERING
string.tiptext: The video player is in the buffering state.

string.name: LOADING
string.tiptext: The video player is in the loading state.

string.name: CONNECTION_ERROR
string.tiptext: The video player is in the connection error state.

string.name: REWINDING
string.tiptext: The video player is in the rewinding state.

string.name: SEEKING
string.tiptext: The video player is in the seeking state.

string.name: RESIZING
string.tiptext: The video player is in the resizing state.

folder.name: Accessibility
folder.tiptext: The Accessibility class manages communication with screen readers.

string.name: updateProperties
string.tiptext: Tells Flash Player to apply any accessibility changes made by using the DisplayObject.accessibilityProperties property.

string.name: active
string.tiptext: Indicates whether a screen reader is currently active and the player is communicating with it.

folder.name: AccessibilityProperties
folder.tiptext: The AccessibilityProperties class lets you control the presentation of Flash objects to accessibility aids, such as screen readers.

string.name: AccessibilityProperties
string.tiptext: Creates a new AccessibilityProperties object.

string.name: name
string.tiptext: Provides a name for this display object in the accessible presentation.

string.name: description
string.tiptext: Provides a description for this display object in the accessible presentation.

string.name: shortcut
string.tiptext: Indicates a keyboard shortcut associated with this display object.

string.name: silent
string.tiptext: If true, excludes this display object from accessible presentation.

string.name: forceSimple
string.tiptext: If true, causes Flash® Player to exclude child objects within this display object from the accessible presentation.

string.name: noAutoLabeling
string.tiptext: If true, disables the Flash Player default auto-labeling system.

folder.name: ActionScriptVersion
folder.tiptext: The ActionScriptVersion class is an enumeration of constant values that indicate the language version of a loaded SWF file.

string.name: ACTIONSCRIPT2
string.tiptext: ActionScript language version 2.0 and earlier.

string.name: ACTIONSCRIPT3
string.tiptext: ActionScript language version 3.0.

folder.name: Bitmap
folder.tiptext: The Bitmap class represents display objects that represent bitmap images.

string.name: Bitmap
string.tiptext: Initializes a Bitmap object to refer to the specified BitmapData object.

string.name: pixelSnapping
string.tiptext: Controls whether or not the Bitmap object is snapped to the nearest pixel.

string.name: smoothing
string.tiptext: Controls whether or not the bitmap is smoothed when scaled.

string.name: bitmapData
string.tiptext: The BitmapData object being referenced.

folder.name: BitmapData
folder.tiptext: The BitmapData class lets you work with the data (pixels) of a Bitmap object.

string.name: BitmapData
string.tiptext: Creates a BitmapData object with a specified width and height.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a new BitmapData object with an exact copy of the original bitmap.

string.name: getPixel
string.tiptext: Returns an integer representing a RGB pixel value from a BitmapData object at a specific point.

string.name: getPixel32
string.tiptext: Returns an ARGB color value that contains alpha channel data and RGB data.

string.name: setPixel
string.tiptext: Sets a single pixel of a BitmapData object.

string.name: setPixel32
string.tiptext: Sets the color and alpha transparency values of a single pixel of a BitmapData object.

string.name: applyFilter
string.tiptext: Takes a source image and a filter object and generates the filtered image.

string.name: colorTransform
string.tiptext: Adjusts the color values in a specified area of a bitmap image by using a ColorTransform object.

string.name: compare
string.tiptext: Compares two BitmapData objects.

string.name: copyChannel
string.tiptext: Transfers data from one channel of another BitmapData object or the current BitmapData object into a channel of the current BitmapData object.

string.name: copyPixels
string.tiptext: Provides a fast routine to perform pixel manipulation between images with no stretching, rotation, or color effects.

string.name: dispose
string.tiptext: Frees memory that is used to store the BitmapData object.

string.name: draw
string.tiptext: Draws the source display object onto the bitmap image, using the Flash Player vector renderer.

string.name: fillRect
string.tiptext: Fills a rectangular area of pixels with a specified ARGB color.

string.name: floodFill
string.tiptext: Performs a flood fill operation on an image starting at a (x, y) coordinate.

string.name: generateFilterRect
string.tiptext: Determines the destination rectangle that will be affected by the applyFilter() call.

string.name: getColorBoundsRect
string.tiptext: Determines a rectangular region that either fully encloses all pixels of a specified color within the bitmap image (if the findColor parameter is set to true) or fully encloses all pixels that do not include the specified color (if the findColor parameter is set to false).

string.name: getPixels
string.tiptext: Generates a byte array from a rectangular region of pixel data.

string.name: hitTest
string.tiptext: Performs pixel-level hit detection between one bitmap image and a point, rectangle, or other bitmap image.

string.name: merge
string.tiptext: Performs per-channel blending from a source image to a destination image.

string.name: noise
string.tiptext: Fills an image with pixels representing random noise.

string.name: paletteMap
string.tiptext: Remaps the color channel values in an image that has up to four arrays of color palette data, one for each channel.

string.name: perlinNoise
string.tiptext: Generates a Perlin noise image.

string.name: pixelDissolve
string.tiptext: Performs a pixel dissolve either from a source image to a destination image or by using the same image.

string.name: scroll
string.tiptext: Scrolls an image by a certain (x, y) pixel amount.

string.name: setPixels
string.tiptext: Converts a byte array into a rectangular region of pixel data.

string.name: threshold
string.tiptext: Tests pixel values in an image against a specified threshold and sets pixels that pass the test to new color values.

string.name: lock
string.tiptext: Locks an image so that any objects that reference the BitmapData object, such as Bitmap objects, are not updated when this BitmapData object changes.

string.name: unlock
string.tiptext: Unlocks an image so that any objects that reference the BitmapData object, such as Bitmap objects, are updated when this BitmapData object changes.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: The width of the bitmap image in pixels.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: The height of the bitmap image in pixels.

string.name: transparent
string.tiptext: Defines whether the bitmap image supports per-pixel transparency.

string.name: rect
string.tiptext: The rectangle that defines the size and location of the bitmap image.

folder.name: BitmapDataChannel
folder.tiptext: The BitmapDataChannel class is an enumeration of constant values that indicate which channel to use: red, blue, green, or alpha transparency.

string.name: RED
string.tiptext: The red channel.

string.name: GREEN
string.tiptext: The green channel.

string.name: BLUE
string.tiptext: The blue channel.

string.name: ALPHA
string.tiptext: The alpha channel.

folder.name: BlendMode
folder.tiptext: A class that provides constant values for visual blend mode effects.

string.name: NORMAL
string.tiptext: The display object appears in front of the background.

string.name: LAYER
string.tiptext: Forces the creation of a transparency group for the display object.

string.name: MULTIPLY
string.tiptext: Multiplies the values of the display object constituent colors by the constituent colors of the background color, and normalizes by dividing by 0xFF, resulting in darker colors.

string.name: SCREEN
string.tiptext: Multiplies the complement (inverse) of the display object color by the complement of the background color, resulting in a bleaching effect.

string.name: LIGHTEN
string.tiptext: Selects the lighter of the constituent colors of the display object and the colors of the background (the colors with the larger values).

string.name: DARKEN
string.tiptext: Selects the darker of the constituent colors of the display object and the colors of the background (the colors with the smaller values).

string.name: ADD
string.tiptext: Adds the values of the constituent colors of the display object to the colors of its background, applying a ceiling of 0xFF.

string.name: SUBTRACT
string.tiptext: Subtracts the values of the constituent colors in the display object from the values of the backgroundcolor, applying a floor of 0.

string.name: DIFFERENCE
string.tiptext: Compares the constituent colors of the display object with the colors of its background, and subtracts the darker of the values of the two constituent colors from the lighter value.

string.name: INVERT
string.tiptext: Inverts the background.

string.name: OVERLAY
string.tiptext: Adjusts the color of each pixel based on the darkness of the background.

string.name: HARDLIGHT
string.tiptext: Adjusts the color of each pixel based on the darkness of the display object.

string.name: ALPHA
string.tiptext: Applies the alpha value of each pixel of the display object to the background.

string.name: ERASE
string.tiptext: Erases the background based on the alpha value of the display object.

folder.name: CapsStyle
folder.tiptext: The CapsStyle class is an enumeration of constant values that specify the caps style to use in drawing lines.

string.name: ROUND
string.tiptext: Used to specify round caps in the caps parameter of the flash.display.Graphics.lineStyle() method.

string.name: NONE
string.tiptext: Used to specify no caps in the caps parameter of the flash.display.Graphics.lineStyle() method.

string.name: SQUARE
string.tiptext: Used to specify square caps in the caps parameter of the flash.display.Graphics.lineStyle() method.

folder.name: DisplayObject
folder.tiptext: The DisplayObject class is the base class for all objects that can be placed on the display list.

string.name: globalToLocal
string.tiptext: Converts the point object from Stage (global) coordinates to the display object's (local) coordinates.

string.name: localToGlobal
string.tiptext: Converts the point object from the display object's (local) coordinates to the Stage (global) coordinates.

string.name: getBounds
string.tiptext: Returns a rectangle that defines the area of the display object relative to the coordinate system of the targetCoordinateSpace object.

string.name: getRect
string.tiptext: Returns a rectangle that defines the boundary of the display object, based on the coordinate system defined by the targetCoordinateSpace parameter, excluding any strokes on shapes.

string.name: hitTestObject
string.tiptext: Evaluates the display object to see if it overlaps or intersects with the display object passed as a parameter.

string.name: hitTestPoint
string.tiptext: Evaluates the display object to see if it overlaps or intersects with a point specified by x and y.

string.name: root
string.tiptext: For a display object in a loaded SWF file, the root property is the top-most display object in the portion of the display list's tree structure represented by that SWF file.

string.name: stage
string.tiptext: The Stage of the display object.

string.name: name
string.tiptext: Indicates the instance name of the DisplayObject.

string.name: parent
string.tiptext: Indicates the DisplayObjectContainer object that contains this display object.

string.name: mask
string.tiptext: The calling display object is masked by the specified mask object.

string.name: visible
string.tiptext: Whether or not the display object is visible.

string.name: x
string.tiptext: Indicates the x coordinate of the DisplayObject instance relative to the local coordinates of the parent DisplayObjectContainer.

string.name: y
string.tiptext: Indicates the y coordinate of the DisplayObject instance relative to the local coordinates of the parent DisplayObjectContainer.

string.name: scaleX
string.tiptext: Indicates the horizontal scale (percentage) of the object as applied from the registration point.

string.name: scaleY
string.tiptext: Indicates the vertical scale (percentage) of an object as applied from the registration point of the object.

string.name: mouseX
string.tiptext: Indicates the x coordinate of the mouse position, in pixels.

string.name: mouseY
string.tiptext: Indicates the y coordinate of the mouse position, in pixels.

string.name: rotation
string.tiptext: Indicates the rotation of the DisplayObject instance, in degrees, from its original orientation.

string.name: alpha
string.tiptext: Indicates the alpha transparency value of the object specified.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: Indicates the width of the display object, in pixels.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: Indicates the height of the display object, in pixels.

string.name: cacheAsBitmap
string.tiptext: If set to true, Flash Player caches an internal bitmap representation of the display object.

string.name: opaqueBackground
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the display object is opaque with a certain background color.

string.name: scrollRect
string.tiptext: The scroll rectangle bounds of the display object.

string.name: filters
string.tiptext: An indexed array that contains each filter object currently associated with the display object.

string.name: blendMode
string.tiptext: A value from the BlendMode class that specifies which blend mode to use.

string.name: transform
string.tiptext: An object with properties pertaining to a display object's matrix, color transform, and pixel bounds.

string.name: scale9Grid
string.tiptext: The current scaling grid that is in effect.

string.name: loaderInfo
string.tiptext: Returns a LoaderInfo object containing information about loading the file to which this display object belongs.

string.name: accessibilityProperties
string.tiptext: The current accessibility options for this display object.

string.name: added
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a display object is added to the display list.

string.name: addedToStage
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a display object is added to the on stage display list, either directly or through the addition of a sub tree in which the display object is contained.

string.name: enterFrame
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the playhead is entering a new frame.

string.name: removed
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a display object is about to be removed from the display list.

string.name: removedFromStage
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a display object is about to be removed from the display list, either directly or through the removal of a sub tree in which the display object is contained.

string.name: render
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the display list is about to be updated and rendered.

folder.name: DisplayObjectContainer
folder.tiptext: The DisplayObjectContainer class is the base class for all objects that can serve as display object containers on the display list.

string.name: DisplayObjectContainer
string.tiptext: Calling the new DisplayObjectContainer() constructor throws an ArgumentError exception.

string.name: addChild
string.tiptext: Adds a child object to this DisplayObjectContainer instance.

string.name: addChildAt
string.tiptext: Adds a child object to this DisplayObjectContainer instance.

string.name: removeChild
string.tiptext: Removes a child display object from the DisplayObjectContainer instance.

string.name: removeChildAt
string.tiptext: Removes a child display object, at the specified index position, from the DisplayObjectContainer instance.

string.name: getChildIndex
string.tiptext: Returns the index number of a child DisplayObject instance.

string.name: setChildIndex
string.tiptext: Changes the index number of an existing child.

string.name: getChildAt
string.tiptext: Returns the child display object instance that exists at the specified index.

string.name: getChildByName
string.tiptext: Returns the child display object that exists with the specified name.

string.name: getObjectsUnderPoint
string.tiptext: Returns an array of objects that lie under the specified point and are children (or grandchildren, and so on) of this DisplayObjectContainer instance.

string.name: areInaccessibleObjectsUnderPoint
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the security restrictions would cause any display objects to be omitted from the list returned by calling the DisplayObjectContainer.getObjectsUnderPoint() method with the specified point point.

string.name: contains
string.tiptext: Determines whether the specified display object is a child of the DisplayObjectContainer instance or the instance itself.

string.name: swapChildrenAt
string.tiptext: Swaps the z-order (front-to-back order) of the child objects at the two specified index positions in the child list.

string.name: swapChildren
string.tiptext: Swaps the z-order (front-to-back order) of the two specified child objects.

string.name: numChildren
string.tiptext: Returns the number of children of this object.

string.name: textSnapshot
string.tiptext: Returns a TextSnapshot object for this DisplayObjectContainer instance.

string.name: tabChildren
string.tiptext: Determines whether the children of the object are tab enabled.

string.name: mouseChildren
string.tiptext: Determines whether or not the children of the object are mouse enabled.

folder.name: FrameLabel
folder.tiptext: The FrameLabel object contains properties that specify a frame number and the corresponding label name.

string.name: name
string.tiptext: The name of the label.

string.name: frame
string.tiptext: The frame number containing the label.

folder.name: GradientType
folder.tiptext: The GradientType class provides values for the type parameter in the beginGradientFill() and lineGradientFill() methods of the flash.display.Graphics class.

string.name: LINEAR
string.tiptext: Value used to specify a linear gradient fill.

string.name: RADIAL
string.tiptext: Value used to specify a radial gradient fill.

folder.name: Graphics
folder.tiptext: The Graphics class contains a set of methods that you can use to create a vector shape.

string.name: clear
string.tiptext: Clears the graphics that were drawn to this Graphics object, and resets fill and line style settings.

string.name: beginFill
string.tiptext: Specifies a single-color fill.

string.name: beginGradientFill
string.tiptext: Specifies a gradient fill.

string.name: beginBitmapFill
string.tiptext: Begins a bitmap filled shape.

string.name: lineGradientStyle
string.tiptext: Specifies a gradient for the line style that Flash Player uses for subsequent calls to other Graphics methods (such as lineTo() or drawCircle()) for the object.

string.name: lineStyle
string.tiptext: Specifies a line style that Flash uses for drawing lines.

string.name: drawRect
string.tiptext: Draws a round rectangle.

string.name: drawRoundRect
string.tiptext: Draws a round rectangle.

string.name: drawCircle
string.tiptext: Draws a circle.

string.name: drawEllipse
string.tiptext: Draws an ellipse.

string.name: moveTo
string.tiptext: Moves the current drawing position to (x, y).

string.name: lineTo
string.tiptext: Draws a line from the current drawing position to (x, y).

string.name: curveTo
string.tiptext: Draws a curve from the current drawing position to (anchorX, anchorY) using the control point specified by (controlX, controlY).

string.name: endFill
string.tiptext: Applies a fill to the lines and curves.

folder.name: InteractiveObject
folder.tiptext: The InteractiveObject class is the abstract base class for all display objects with which the user can interact, using the mouse and keyboard.

string.name: InteractiveObject
string.tiptext: Calling the new InteractiveObject() constructor throws an ArgumentError exception.

string.name: tabEnabled
string.tiptext: Specifies whether this object is in the tab order.

string.name: tabIndex
string.tiptext: Specifies the tab ordering of objects in a SWF file.

string.name: focusRect
string.tiptext: Specifies whether this object displays a focus rectangle.

string.name: mouseEnabled
string.tiptext: Specifies whether this object receives mouse messages.

string.name: doubleClickEnabled
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the object receives doubleClick events.

string.name: contextMenu
string.tiptext: Specifies the context menu associated with this object.

string.name: focusIn
string.tiptext: Dispatched after a display object gains focus.

string.name: focusOut
string.tiptext: Dispatched after a display object loses focus.

string.name: keyFocusChange
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user attempts to change focus by using keyboard navigation.

string.name: mouseFocusChange
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user attempts to change focus by using a pointer device.

string.name: click
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a user presses and releases the main button of the user's pointing device over the same InteractiveObject.

string.name: doubleClick
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a user presses and releases the main button of a pointing device twice in rapid succession over the same InteractiveObject when that object's doubleClickEnabled flag is set to true.

string.name: mouseDown
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a user presses the pointing device button over an InteractiveObject instance in the Flash Player window.

string.name: mouseMove
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a user moves the pointing device while it is over an InteractiveObject.

string.name: mouseOut
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user moves a pointing device away from an InteractiveObject instance.

string.name: mouseOver
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user moves a pointing device over an InteractiveObject instance in the Flash Player window.

string.name: mouseUp
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a user releases the pointing device button over an InteractiveObject instance in the Flash Player window.

string.name: mouseWheel
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a mouse wheel is spun over an InteractiveObject instance in the Flash Player window.

string.name: rollOut
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user moves a pointing device away from an InteractiveObject instance.

string.name: rollOver
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user moves a pointing device over an InteractiveObject instance.

string.name: keyDown
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user presses a key.

string.name: keyUp
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user releases a key.

string.name: tabChildrenChange
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the value of the object's tabChildren flag changes.

string.name: tabEnabledChange
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the object's tabEnabled flag changes.

string.name: tabIndexChange
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the value of the object's tabIndex property changes.

folder.name: InterpolationMethod
folder.tiptext: The InterpolationMethod class provides values for the interpolationMethod parameter in the Graphics.beginGradientFill() and Graphics.lineGradientStyle() methods.

string.name: RGB
string.tiptext: Specifies that the RGB interpolation method should be used.

string.name: LINEAR_RGB
string.tiptext: Specifies that the linear RGB interpolation method should be used.

folder.name: JointStyle
folder.tiptext: The JointStyle class is an enumeration of constant values that specify the joint style to use in drawing lines.

string.name: ROUND
string.tiptext: Specifies round joints in the joints parameter of the flash.display.Graphics.lineStyle() method.

string.name: BEVEL
string.tiptext: Specifies beveled joints in the joints parameter of the flash.display.Graphics.lineStyle() method.

string.name: MITER
string.tiptext: Specifies mitered joints in the joints parameter of the flash.display.Graphics.lineStyle() method.

folder.name: LineScaleMode
folder.tiptext: The LineScaleMode class provides values for the scaleMode parameter in the Graphics.lineStyle() method.

string.name: NORMAL
string.tiptext: With this setting used as the scaleMode parameter of the lineStyle() method, the thickness of the line always scales when the object is scaled (the default).

string.name: VERTICAL
string.tiptext: With this setting used as the scaleMode parameter of the lineStyle() method, the thickness of the line scales only horizontally.

string.name: HORIZONTAL
string.tiptext: With this setting used as the scaleMode parameter of the lineStyle() method, the thickness of the line scales only vertically.

string.name: NONE
string.tiptext: With this setting used as the scaleMode parameter of the lineStyle() method, the thickness of the line never scales.

folder.name: Loader
folder.tiptext: The Loader class is used to load SWF files or image (JPG, PNG, or GIF) files.

string.name: Loader
string.tiptext: Creates a Loader object that you can use to load files, such as SWF, JPEG, GIF, or PNG files.

string.name: load
string.tiptext: Loads a SWF file or image file into a DisplayObject that is a child of this Loader instance.

string.name: loadBytes
string.tiptext: Loads from binary data stored in a ByteArray object.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Cancels a load() method operation that is currently in progress for the Loader instance.

string.name: unload
string.tiptext: Removes a child of this Loader object that was loaded by using the load() method.

string.name: content
string.tiptext: Contains the root display object of the SWF file or image (JPG, PNG, or GIF) file that was loaded by using the load() or loadBytes() methods.

string.name: contentLoaderInfo
string.tiptext: Returns a LoaderInfo object corresponding to the object being loaded.

folder.name: LoaderInfo
folder.tiptext: The LoaderInfo class provides information about a loaded SWF file or a loaded image file (JPEG, GIF, or PNG).

string.name: loaderURL
string.tiptext: The URL of the SWF file that initiated the loading of the media described by this LoaderInfo object.

string.name: url
string.tiptext: The URL of the media being loaded.

string.name: bytesLoaded
string.tiptext: The number of bytes that are loaded for the media.

string.name: bytesTotal
string.tiptext: The number of compressed bytes in the entire media file.

string.name: applicationDomain
string.tiptext: When an external SWF file is loaded, all ActionScript 3.0 definitions contained in the loaded class are stored in the applicationDomain property.

string.name: swfVersion
string.tiptext: The file format version of the loaded SWF file.

string.name: actionScriptVersion
string.tiptext: The ActionScript version of the loaded SWF file.

string.name: frameRate
string.tiptext: The nominal frame rate, in frames per second, of the loaded SWF file.

string.name: parameters
string.tiptext: An object that contains name-value pairs that represent the parameters provided to the loaded SWF file.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: The nominal width of the loaded content.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: The nominal height of the loaded file.

string.name: contentType
string.tiptext: The MIME type of the loaded file.

string.name: sharedEvents
string.tiptext: An EventDispatcher instance that can be used to exchange events across security boundaries.

string.name: sameDomain
string.tiptext: Expresses the domain relationship between the loader and the content: true if they have the same origin domain; false otherwise.

string.name: childAllowsParent
string.tiptext: Expresses the trust relationship from content (child) to the Loader (parent).

string.name: parentAllowsChild
string.tiptext: Expresses the trust relationship from Loader (parent) to the content (child).

string.name: loader
string.tiptext: The Loader object associated with this LoaderInfo object.

string.name: content
string.tiptext: The loaded object associated with this LoaderInfo object.

string.name: complete
string.tiptext: Dispatched when data has loaded successfully.

string.name: init
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the properties and methods of a loaded SWF file are accessible.

string.name: ioError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an input or output error occurs that causes a load operation to fail.

string.name: open
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a load operation starts.

string.name: progress
string.tiptext: Dispatched when data is received as the download operation progresses.

string.name: unload
string.tiptext: Dispatched by a LoaderInfo object whenever a loaded object is removed by using the unload() method of the Loader object, or when a second load is performed by the same Loader object and the original content is removed prior to the load beginning.

string.name: httpStatus
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a network request is made over HTTP and Flash Player can detect the HTTP status code.

folder.name: MovieClip
folder.tiptext: The MovieClip class inherits from the following classes: Sprite, DisplayObjectContainer, InteractiveObject, DisplayObject, and EventDispatcher.

string.name: MovieClip
string.tiptext: Creates a new MovieClip instance.

string.name: play
string.tiptext: Moves the playhead in the timeline of the movie clip.

string.name: stop
string.tiptext: Stops the playhead in the movie clip.

string.name: nextFrame
string.tiptext: Sends the playhead to the next frame and stops it.

string.name: prevFrame
string.tiptext: Sends the playhead to the previous frame and stops it.

string.name: gotoAndPlay
string.tiptext: Starts playing the SWF file at the specified frame.

string.name: gotoAndStop
string.tiptext: Brings the playhead to the specified frame of the movie clip and stops it there.

string.name: prevScene
string.tiptext: Moves the playhead to the previous scene of the MovieClip instance.

string.name: nextScene
string.tiptext: Moves the playhead to the next scene of the MovieClip instance.

string.name: currentFrame
string.tiptext: Specifies the number of the frame in which the playhead is located in the timeline of the MovieClip instance.

string.name: framesLoaded
string.tiptext: The number of frames that are loaded from a streaming SWF file.

string.name: totalFrames
string.tiptext: The total number of frames in the MovieClip instance.

string.name: trackAsMenu
string.tiptext: Indicates whether other display objects that are SimpleButton or MovieClip objects can receive mouse release events.

string.name: scenes
string.tiptext: An array of Scene objects, each listing the name, the number of frames, and the frame labels for a scene in the MovieClip instance.

string.name: currentScene
string.tiptext: The current scene in which the playhead is located in the timeline of the MovieClip instance.

string.name: currentLabel
string.tiptext: The current label in which the playhead is located in the timeline of the MovieClip instance.

string.name: currentLabels
string.tiptext: Returns an array of FrameLabel objects from the current scene.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that indicates whether a movie clip is enabled.

folder.name: PixelSnapping
folder.tiptext: The PixelSnapping class is an enumeration of constant values for setting the pixel snapping options by using the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object.

string.name: NEVER
string.tiptext: A constant value used in the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object to specify that no pixel snapping occurs.

string.name: ALWAYS
string.tiptext: A constant value used in the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object to specify that the bitmap image is always snapped to the nearest pixel, independent of any transformation.

string.name: AUTO
string.tiptext: A constant value used in the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object to specify that the bitmap image is snapped to the nearest pixel if it is drawn with no rotation or skew and it is drawn at a scale factor of 99.9% to 100.1%.

folder.name: Scene
folder.tiptext: The Scene class includes properties for identifying the name, labels, and number of frames in a scene.

string.name: name
string.tiptext: The name of the scene.

string.name: labels
string.tiptext: An array of FrameLabel objects for the scene.

string.name: numFrames
string.tiptext: The number of frames in the scene.

folder.name: Shape
folder.tiptext: The Shape class is used to create lightweight shapes by using the ActionScript drawing application program interface (API).

string.name: Shape
string.tiptext: Creates a new Shape object.

string.name: graphics
string.tiptext: Specifies the Graphics object belonging to this Shape object, where vector drawing commands can occur.

folder.name: SimpleButton
folder.tiptext: The SimpleButton class lets you control all instances of button symbols in a SWF file.

string.name: SimpleButton
string.tiptext: Creates a new SimpleButton instance.

string.name: useHandCursor
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that, when set to true, indicates whether Flash Player displays the hand cursor when the mouse rolls over a button.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that specifies whether a button is enabled.

string.name: trackAsMenu
string.tiptext: Indicates whether other display objects that are SimpleButton or MovieClip objects can receive mouse release events.

string.name: upState
string.tiptext: Specifies a display object that is used as the visual object for the button up state — the state that the button is in when the mouse is not positioned over the button.

string.name: overState
string.tiptext: Specifies a display object that is used as the visual object for the button over state — the state that the button is in when the mouse is positioned over the button.

string.name: downState
string.tiptext: Specifies a display object that is used as the visual object for the button "Down" state —the state that the button is in when the user clicks the hitTestState object.

string.name: hitTestState
string.tiptext: Specifies a display object that is used as the hit testing object for the button.

string.name: soundTransform
string.tiptext: The SoundTransform object assigned to this button.

folder.name: SpreadMethod
folder.tiptext: The SpreadMethod class provides values for the spreadMethod parameter in the beginGradientFill() and lineGradientStyle() methods of the Graphics class.

string.name: PAD
string.tiptext: Specifies that the gradient use the pad spread method.

string.name: REFLECT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the gradient use the reflect spread method.

string.name: REPEAT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the gradient use the repeat spread method.

folder.name: Sprite
folder.tiptext: The Sprite class is a basic display list building block: a display list node that can display graphics and can also contain children.

string.name: Sprite
string.tiptext: Creates a new Sprite instance.

string.name: startDrag
string.tiptext: Lets the user drag the specified sprite.

string.name: stopDrag
string.tiptext: Ends the startDrag() method.

string.name: graphics
string.tiptext: Specifies the Graphics object that belongs to this sprite where vector drawing commands can occur.

string.name: buttonMode
string.tiptext: Specifies the button mode of this sprite.

string.name: dropTarget
string.tiptext: Specifies the display object over which the sprite is being dragged, or on which the sprite was dropped.

string.name: hitArea
string.tiptext: Designates another sprite to serve as the hit area for a sprite.

string.name: useHandCursor
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that indicates whether the pointing hand (hand cursor) appears when the mouse rolls over a sprite in which the buttonMode property is set to true.

string.name: soundTransform
string.tiptext: Controls sound within this sprite.

folder.name: Stage
folder.tiptext: The Stage class represents the main drawing area.

string.name: invalidate
string.tiptext: Signals Flash Player to update properties of display objects on the next opportunity it has to refresh the Stage.

string.name: isFocusInaccessible
string.tiptext: Determines whether the Stage.focus property would return null for security reasons.

string.name: addChild
string.tiptext: Adds a child DisplayObject instance to this DisplayObjectContainer instance.

string.name: addChildAt
string.tiptext: Adds a child DisplayObject instance to this DisplayObjectContainer instance.

string.name: setChildIndex
string.tiptext: Changes the position of an existing child in the display object container.

string.name: addEventListener
string.tiptext: Registers an event listener object with an EventDispatcher object so that the listener receives notification of an event.

string.name: dispatchEvent
string.tiptext: Dispatches an event into the event flow.

string.name: hasEventListener
string.tiptext: Checks whether the EventDispatcher object has any listeners registered for a specific type of event.

string.name: willTrigger
string.tiptext: Checks whether an event listener is registered with this EventDispatcher object or any of its ancestors for the specified event type.

string.name: removeChildAt
string.tiptext: Removes a child DisplayObject from the specified index position in the child list of the DisplayObjectContainer.

string.name: swapChildrenAt
string.tiptext: Swaps the z-order (front-to-back order) of the child objects at the two specified index positions in the child list.

string.name: frameRate
string.tiptext: Gets and sets the frame rate of the stage.

string.name: scaleMode
string.tiptext: A value from the StageScaleMode class that specifies which scale mode to use.

string.name: align
string.tiptext: A value from the StageAlign class that specifies the alignment of the stage in Flash Player or the browser.

string.name: stageWidth
string.tiptext: Specifies the current width, in pixels, of the Stage.

string.name: stageHeight
string.tiptext: The current height, in pixels, of the Stage.

string.name: showDefaultContextMenu
string.tiptext: Specifies whether to show or hide the default items in the Flash Player context menu.

string.name: focus
string.tiptext: The interactive object with keyboard focus; or null if focus is not set or if the focused object belongs to a security sandbox to which the calling object does not have access.

string.name: stageFocusRect
string.tiptext: Specifies whether or not objects display a glowing border when they have focus.

string.name: quality
string.tiptext: A value from the StageQuality class that specifies which rendering quality Flash Player uses.

string.name: displayState
string.tiptext: A value from the StageDisplayState class that specifies which display state to use.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: Indicates the width of the display object, in pixels.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: Indicates the height of the display object, in pixels.

string.name: textSnapshot
string.tiptext: Returns a TextSnapshot object for this DisplayObjectContainer instance.

string.name: mouseChildren
string.tiptext: Determines whether or not the children of the object are mouse enabled.

string.name: numChildren
string.tiptext: Returns the number of children of this object.

string.name: tabChildren
string.tiptext: Determines whether the children of the object are tab enabled.

string.name: mouseLeave
string.tiptext: Dispatched by the Stage object when the mouse pointer moves out of the Flash Player window area.

string.name: resize
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the scaleMode property of the Stage object is set to StageScaleMode.NO_SCALE and the SWF file is resized.

string.name: fullScreen
string.tiptext: Dispatched by Flash Player when the Stage object enters, or leaves, full-screen mode.

folder.name: StageAlign
folder.tiptext: The StageAlign class provides constant values to use for the Stage.align property.

string.name: TOP
string.tiptext: Specifies that the Stage is aligned at the top.

string.name: LEFT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the Stage is aligned on the left.

string.name: BOTTOM
string.tiptext: Specifies that the Stage is aligned at the bottom.

string.name: RIGHT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the Stage is aligned to the right.

string.name: TOP_LEFT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the Stage is aligned in the top-left corner.

string.name: TOP_RIGHT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the Stage is aligned in the top-right corner.

string.name: BOTTOM_LEFT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the Stage is aligned in the bottom-left corner.

string.name: BOTTOM_RIGHT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the Stage is aligned in the bottom-right corner.

folder.name: StageDisplayState
folder.tiptext: The StageDisplayState class provides values for the Stage.displayState property.

string.name: FULL_SCREEN
string.tiptext: Specifies that the Stage is in full-screen mode.

string.name: NORMAL
string.tiptext: Specifies that the Stage is in normal mode.

folder.name: StageQuality
folder.tiptext: The StageQuality class provides values for the Stage.quality property.

string.name: LOW
string.tiptext: Specifies low rendering quality: graphics are not anti-aliased, and bitmaps are not smoothed.

string.name: MEDIUM
string.tiptext: Specifies medium rendering quality: graphics are anti-aliased using a 2 x 2 pixel grid, but bitmaps are not smoothed.

string.name: HIGH
string.tiptext: Specifies high rendering quality: graphics are anti-aliased using a 4 x 4 pixel grid, and bitmaps are smoothed if the movie is static.

string.name: BEST
string.tiptext: Specifies very high rendering quality: graphics are anti-aliased using a 4 x 4 pixel grid and bitmaps are always smoothed.

folder.name: StageScaleMode
folder.tiptext: The StageScaleMode class provides values for the Stage.scaleMode property.

string.name: SHOW_ALL
string.tiptext: Specifies that the entire Flash application be visible in the specified area without distortion while maintaining the original aspect ratio of the application.

string.name: EXACT_FIT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the entire Adobe® Flash® application be visible in the specified area without trying to preserve the original aspect ratio.

string.name: NO_BORDER
string.tiptext: Specifies that the entire Flash application fill the specified area, without distortion but possibly with some cropping, while maintaining the original aspect ratio of the application.

string.name: NO_SCALE
string.tiptext: Specifies that the size of the Flash application be fixed, so that it remains unchanged even as the size of the player window changes.

folder.name: SWFVersion
folder.tiptext: The SWFVersion class is an enumeration of constant values that indicate the file format version of a loaded SWF file.

string.name: FLASH1
string.tiptext: SWF file format version 1.0.

string.name: FLASH2
string.tiptext: SWF file format version 2.0.

string.name: FLASH3
string.tiptext: SWF file format version 3.0.

string.name: FLASH4
string.tiptext: SWF file format version 4.0.

string.name: FLASH5
string.tiptext: SWF file format version 5.0.

string.name: FLASH6
string.tiptext: SWF file format version 6.0.

string.name: FLASH7
string.tiptext: SWF file format version 7.0.

string.name: FLASH8
string.tiptext: SWF file format version 8.0.

string.name: FLASH9
string.tiptext: SWF file format version 9.0.

folder.name: EOFError
folder.tiptext: An EOFError exception is thrown when you attempt to read past the end of the available data.

string.name: EOFError
string.tiptext: Creates a new EOFError object.

folder.name: IllegalOperationError
folder.tiptext: The IllegalOperationError exception is thrown when a method is not implemented or the implementation doesn't cover the current usage.

string.name: IllegalOperationError
string.tiptext: Creates a new IllegalOperationError object.

folder.name: IOError
folder.tiptext: The IOError exception is thrown when some type of input or output failure occurs.

string.name: IOError
string.tiptext: Creates a new IOError object.

folder.name: MemoryError
folder.tiptext: The MemoryError exception is thrown when a memory allocation request fails.

string.name: MemoryError
string.tiptext: Creates a new MemoryError object.

folder.name: ScriptTimeoutError
folder.tiptext: The ScriptTimeoutError exception is thrown when the script timeout interval is reached.

string.name: ScriptTimeoutError
string.tiptext: Creates a new ScriptTimeoutError object.

folder.name: StackOverflowError
folder.tiptext: ActionScript throws a StackOverflowError exception when the stack available to the script is exhausted.

string.name: StackOverflowError
string.tiptext: Creates a new StackOverflowError object.

folder.name: ActivityEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches an ActivityEvent object whenever a camera or microphone reports that it has become active or inactive.

string.name: ActivityEvent
string.tiptext: Constructor for ActivityEvent objects.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of an ActivityEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the ActivityEvent object.

string.name: ACTIVITY
string.tiptext: The ActivityEvent.ACTIVITY constant defines the value of the type property of an activity event object.

string.name: activating
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the device is activating (true) or deactivating (false).

folder.name: AsyncErrorEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches an AsyncErrorEvent when an exception is thrown from native asynchronous code, which could be from, for example, LocalConnection, NetConnection, SharedObject, or NetStream.

string.name: AsyncErrorEvent
string.tiptext: Constructor for AsyncErrorEvent objects.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the AsyncErrorEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the AsyncErrorEvent object.

string.name: ASYNC_ERROR
string.tiptext: The AsyncErrorEvent.ASYNC_ERROR constant defines the value of the type property of an asyncError event object.

string.name: error
string.tiptext: The exception that was thrown.

folder.name: ContextMenuEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches ContextMenuEvent objects when a user generates or interacts with the context menu.

string.name: ContextMenuEvent
string.tiptext: Constructor for ContextMenuEvent objects.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the ContextMenuEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the ContextMenuEvent object.

string.name: MENU_ITEM_SELECT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a menuItemSelect event object.

string.name: MENU_SELECT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a menuSelect event object.

string.name: mouseTarget
string.tiptext: The display list object on which the user right-clicked to display the context menu.

string.name: contextMenuOwner
string.tiptext: The display list object to which the menu is attached.

folder.name: DataEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches DataEvent objects when raw data has completed loading into Flash Player.

string.name: DataEvent
string.tiptext: Constructor for DataEvent objects.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the DataEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the DataEvent object.

string.name: DATA
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a data event object.

string.name: UPLOAD_COMPLETE_DATA
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an uploadCompleteData event object.

string.name: data
string.tiptext: The raw data loaded into Flash Player.

folder.name: ErrorEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches ErrorEvent objects when an error causes a network operation to fail.

string.name: ErrorEvent
string.tiptext: Constructor for ErrorEvent objects.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the ErrorEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the ErrorEvent object.

string.name: ERROR
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an error event object.

folder.name: Event
folder.tiptext: The Event class is used as the base class for the creation of Event objects, which are passed as parameters to event listeners when an event occurs.

string.name: Event
string.tiptext: Used to create new Event object.

string.name: formatToString
string.tiptext: A utility function for implementing the toString() method in your custom Event class.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Duplicates an instance of an Event subclass.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string containing all the properties of the Event object.

string.name: stopPropagation
string.tiptext: Prevents processing of any event listeners in nodes subsequent to the current node in the event flow.

string.name: stopImmediatePropagation
string.tiptext: Prevents processing of any event listeners in the current node and any subsequent nodes in the event flow.

string.name: preventDefault
string.tiptext: Cancels an event's default behavior if that behavior can be canceled.

string.name: isDefaultPrevented
string.tiptext: Checks whether preventDefault() has been called on the event.

string.name: ACTIVATE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an activate event object.

string.name: ADDED
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an added event object.

string.name: ADDED_TO_STAGE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an addedToStage event object.

string.name: CANCEL
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a cancel event object.

string.name: CHANGE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a change event object.

string.name: CLOSE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a close event object.

string.name: COMPLETE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a complete event object.

string.name: CONNECT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a connect event object.

string.name: DEACTIVATE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a deactivate event object.

string.name: ENTER_FRAME
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an enterFrame event object.

string.name: ID3
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an id3 event object.

string.name: INIT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an init event object.

string.name: MOUSE_LEAVE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a mouseLeave event object.

string.name: OPEN
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an open event object.

string.name: REMOVED
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a removed event object.

string.name: REMOVED_FROM_STAGE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a removedFromStage event object.

string.name: RENDER
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a render event object.

string.name: RESIZE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a resize event object.

string.name: SCROLL
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a scroll event object.

string.name: SELECT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a select event object.

string.name: SOUND_COMPLETE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a soundComplete event object.

string.name: TAB_CHILDREN_CHANGE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a tabChildrenChange event object.

string.name: TAB_ENABLED_CHANGE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a tabEnabledChange event object.

string.name: TAB_INDEX_CHANGE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a tabIndexChange event object.

string.name: UNLOAD
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an unload event object.

string.name: FULLSCREEN
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a fullScreen event object.

string.name: type
string.tiptext: The type of event.

string.name: bubbles
string.tiptext: Indicates whether an event is a bubbling event.

string.name: cancelable
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the behavior associated with the event can be prevented.

string.name: target
string.tiptext: The event target.

string.name: currentTarget
string.tiptext: The object that is actively processing the Event object with an event listener.

string.name: eventPhase
string.tiptext: The current phase in the event flow.

folder.name: EventDispatcher
folder.tiptext: The EventDispatcher class implements the IEventDispatcher interface and is the base class for the DisplayObject class.

string.name: EventDispatcher
string.tiptext: Aggregates an instance of the EventDispatcher class.

string.name: addEventListener
string.tiptext: Registers an event listener object with an EventDispatcher object so that the listener receives notification of an event.

string.name: removeEventListener
string.tiptext: Removes a listener from the EventDispatcher object.

string.name: dispatchEvent
string.tiptext: Dispatches an event into the event flow.

string.name: hasEventListener
string.tiptext: Checks whether the EventDispatcher object has any listeners registered for a specific type of event.

string.name: willTrigger
string.tiptext: Checks whether an event listener is registered with this EventDispatcher object or any of its ancestors for the specified event type.

string.name: activate
string.tiptext: Dispatched when Flash Player gains operating system focus and becomes active.

string.name: deactivate
string.tiptext: Dispatched when Flash Player loses operating system focus and is becoming inactive.

folder.name: EventPhase
folder.tiptext: The EventPhase class provides values for the eventPhase property of the Event class.

string.name: CAPTURING_PHASE
string.tiptext: The capturing phase, which is the first phase of the event flow.

string.name: AT_TARGET
string.tiptext: The target phase, which is the second phase of the event flow.

string.name: BUBBLING_PHASE
string.tiptext: The bubbling phase, which is the third phase of the event flow.

folder.name: FocusEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches FocusEvent objects when the user changes the focus from one object in the display list to another.

string.name: FocusEvent
string.tiptext: Constructor for FocusEvent objects.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the FocusEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the FocusEvent object.

string.name: FOCUS_IN
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a focusIn event object.

string.name: FOCUS_OUT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a focusOut event object.

string.name: KEY_FOCUS_CHANGE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a keyFocusChange event object.

string.name: MOUSE_FOCUS_CHANGE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a mouseFocusChange event object.

string.name: relatedObject
string.tiptext: A reference to the complementary InteractiveObject instance that is affected by the change in focus.

string.name: shiftKey
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the Shift key modifier is activated, in which case the value is true.

string.name: keyCode
string.tiptext: The key code value of the key pressed to trigger a keyFocusChange event.

folder.name: FullScreenEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches a FullScreenEvent object whenever the Stage enters or leaves full-screen display mode.

string.name: FullScreenEvent
string.tiptext: Constructor for FullScreenEvent objects.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of a FullScreenEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the FullScreenEvent object.

string.name: FULL_SCREEN
string.tiptext: The FullScreenEvent.FULL_SCREEN constant defines the value of the type property of a fullScreen event object.

string.name: fullScreen
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the Stage object is in full-screen mode (true) or not (false).

folder.name: IEventDispatcher
folder.tiptext: The IEventDispatcher interface defines methods for adding or removing event listeners, checks whether specific types of event listeners are registered, and dispatches events.

string.name: addEventListener
string.tiptext: Registers an event listener object with an EventDispatcher object so that the listener receives notification of an event.

string.name: removeEventListener
string.tiptext: Removes a listener from the EventDispatcher object.

string.name: dispatchEvent
string.tiptext: Dispatches an event into the event flow.

string.name: hasEventListener
string.tiptext: Checks whether the EventDispatcher object has any listeners registered for a specific type of event.

string.name: willTrigger
string.tiptext: Checks whether an event listener is registered with this EventDispatcher object or any of its ancestors for the specified event type.

string.name: IMEEvent

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the IMEEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the IMEEvent object.

string.name: IME_COMPOSITION
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an imeComposition event object.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the IOErrorEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the IOErrorEvent object.

string.name: IO_ERROR
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of an ioError event object.

folder.name: KeyboardEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches KeyboardEvent objects in response to user input through a keyboard.

string.name: KeyboardEvent
string.tiptext: Constructor for KeyboardEvent objects.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the KeyboardEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the KeyboardEvent object.

string.name: updateAfterEvent
string.tiptext: Instructs Flash Player to render after processing of this event completes, if the display list has been modified

string.name: KEY_DOWN
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a keyDown event object.

string.name: KEY_UP
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a keyUp event object.

string.name: charCode
string.tiptext: Contains the character code value of the key pressed or released.

string.name: keyCode
string.tiptext: The key code value of the key pressed or released.

string.name: keyLocation
string.tiptext: Indicates the location of the key on the keyboard.

string.name: ctrlKey
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the Control key is active (true) or inactive (false).

string.name: altKey
string.tiptext: Reserved for future use.

string.name: shiftKey
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the Shift key modifier is active (true) or inactive (false).

string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the MouseEvent object.

string.name: updateAfterEvent
string.tiptext: Instructs Flash Player to render after processing of this event completes, if the display list has been modified.

string.name: CLICK
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a click event object.

string.name: DOUBLE_CLICK
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a doubleClick event object.

string.name: MOUSE_DOWN
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a mouseDown event object.

string.name: MOUSE_MOVE
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a mouseMove event object.

string.name: MOUSE_OUT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a mouseOut event object.

string.name: MOUSE_OVER
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a mouseOver event object.

string.name: MOUSE_UP
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a mouseUp event object.

string.name: MOUSE_WHEEL
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a mouseWheel event object.

string.name: ROLL_OUT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a rollOut event object.

string.name: ROLL_OVER
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a rollOver event object.

string.name: localX
string.tiptext: The horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the containing sprite.

string.name: localY
string.tiptext: The vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the containing sprite.

string.name: relatedObject
string.tiptext: A reference to a display list object that is related to the event.

string.name: ctrlKey
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the Control key is active (true) or inactive (false).

string.name: altKey
string.tiptext: Reserved for future use.

string.name: shiftKey
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the Shift key is active (true) or inactive (false).

string.name: buttonDown
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the primary mouse button is pressed (true) or not (false).

string.name: delta
string.tiptext: Indicates how many lines should be scrolled for each unit the user rotates the mouse wheel.

string.name: stageX
string.tiptext: The horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred in global Stage coordinates.

string.name: stageY
string.tiptext: The vertical coordinate at which the event occurred in global Stage coordinates.

string.name: PROGRESS
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a progress event object.

string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a socketData event object.

string.name: bytesLoaded
string.tiptext: The number of items or bytes loaded when the listener processes the event.

string.name: bytesTotal
string.tiptext: The total number of items or bytes that will be loaded if the loading process succeeds.

string.name: SECURITY_ERROR
string.tiptext: The SecurityErrorEvent.SECURITY_ERROR constant defines the value of the type property of a securityError event object.

folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches StatusEvent objects when a device, such as a camera or microphone, or an object such as a LocalConnection object reports its status.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the StatusEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: level
string.tiptext: The category of the message, such as "status", "warning" or "error".

folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches SyncEvent objects when a remote SharedObject instance has been updated by the server.

string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the SyncEvent object.

string.name: SYNC
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a sync event object.

string.name: changeList
string.tiptext: An array of objects; each object contains properties that describe the changed members of a remote shared object.

folder.name: TextEvent
folder.tiptext: Flash® Player dispatches TextEvent objects when a user enters text in a text field or clicks a hyperlink in an HTML-enabled text field.

string.name: TextEvent
string.tiptext: Constructor for TextEvent objects.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the TextEvent object and sets the value of each property to match that of the original.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the properties of the TextEvent object.

string.name: LINK
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a link event object.

string.name: TEXT_INPUT
string.tiptext: Defines the value of the type property of a textInput event object.

string.name: text
string.tiptext: For a textInput event, the character or sequence of characters entered by the user.

folder.name: ExternalInterface
folder.tiptext: The ExternalInterface class is the External API, an application programming interface that enables straightforward communication between ActionScript and the Flash Player container; for example, an HTML page with JavaScript.

string.name: addCallback
string.tiptext: Registers an ActionScript method as callable from the container.

string.name: call
string.tiptext: Calls a function in the container.

string.name: available
string.tiptext: Indicates whether this player is in a container that offers an external interface.

string.name: objectID
string.tiptext: Returns the id attribute of the <object> tag in Internet Explorer, or the name attribute of the <embed> tag in Netscape.

folder.name: BevelFilter
folder.tiptext: The BevelFilter class lets you add a bevel effect to display objects.

string.name: BevelFilter
string.tiptext: Initializes a new BevelFilter instance with the specified parameters.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this filter object.

string.name: distance
string.tiptext: The offset distance of the bevel.

string.name: angle
string.tiptext: The angle of the bevel.

string.name: highlightColor
string.tiptext: The highlight color of the bevel.

string.name: highlightAlpha
string.tiptext: The alpha transparency value of the highlight color.

string.name: shadowColor
string.tiptext: The shadow color of the bevel.

string.name: shadowAlpha
string.tiptext: The alpha transparency value of the shadow color.

string.name: blurX
string.tiptext: The amount of horizontal blur, in pixels.

string.name: blurY
string.tiptext: The amount of vertical blur, in pixels.

string.name: knockout
string.tiptext: Applies a knockout effect (true), which effectively makes the object's fill transparent and reveals the background color of the document.

string.name: quality
string.tiptext: The number of times to apply the filter.

string.name: strength
string.tiptext: The strength of the imprint or spread.

string.name: type
string.tiptext: The placement of the bevel on the object.

folder.name: BitmapFilter
folder.tiptext: The BitmapFilter class is the base class for all image filter effects.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: A copy of the BitmapFilter object.

folder.name: BitmapFilterQuality
folder.tiptext: The BitmapFilterQuality class contains values to set the rendering quality of a BitmapFilter object.

string.name: LOW
string.tiptext: Defines the low quality filter setting.

string.name: MEDIUM
string.tiptext: Defines the medium quality filter setting.

string.name: HIGH
string.tiptext: Defines the high quality filter setting.

folder.name: BitmapFilterType
folder.tiptext: The BitmapFilterType class contains values to set the type of a BitmapFilter.

string.name: INNER
string.tiptext: Defines the setting that applies a filter to the inner area of an object.

string.name: OUTER
string.tiptext: Defines the setting that applies a filter to the outer area of an object.

string.name: FULL
string.tiptext: Defines the setting that applies a filter to the entire area of an object.

folder.name: BlurFilter
folder.tiptext: The BlurFilter class lets you apply a blur visual effect to display objects.

string.name: BlurFilter
string.tiptext: Initializes the filter.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this filter object.

string.name: blurX
string.tiptext: The amount of horizontal blur.

string.name: blurY
string.tiptext: The amount of vertical blur.

string.name: quality
string.tiptext: The number of times to perform the blur.

folder.name: ColorMatrixFilter
folder.tiptext: The ColorMatrixFilter class lets you apply a 4 x 5 matrix transformation on the RGBA color and alpha valuesof every pixel in the input image to produce a result with a new set of RGBA color and alpha values.

string.name: ColorMatrixFilter
string.tiptext: Initializes a new ColorMatrixFilter instance.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this filter object.

string.name: matrix
string.tiptext: An array of 20 items for 4 x 5 color transform.

folder.name: ConvolutionFilter
folder.tiptext: The ConvolutionFilter class applies a matrix convolution filter effect.

string.name: ConvolutionFilter
string.tiptext: Initializes a ConvolutionFilter instance with the specified parameters.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this filter object.

string.name: matrix
string.tiptext: An array of values used for matrix transformation.

string.name: matrixX
string.tiptext: The x dimension of the matrix (the number of columns in the matrix).

string.name: matrixY
string.tiptext: The y dimension of the matrix (the number of rows in the matrix).

string.name: divisor
string.tiptext: The divisor used during matrix transformation.

string.name: bias
string.tiptext: The amount of bias to add to the result of the matrix transformation.

string.name: preserveAlpha
string.tiptext: Indicates if the alpha channel is preserved without the filter effect or if the convolution filter is applied to the alpha channel as well as the color channels.

string.name: clamp
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the image should be clamped.

string.name: color
string.tiptext: The hexadecimal color to substitute for pixels that are off the source image.

string.name: alpha
string.tiptext: The alpha transparency value of the substitute color.

folder.name: DisplacementMapFilter
folder.tiptext: The DisplacementMapFilter class uses the pixel values from the specified BitmapData object (called the displacement map image) to perform a displacement of an object.

string.name: DisplacementMapFilter
string.tiptext: Initializes a DisplacementMapFilter instance.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this filter object.

string.name: mapBitmap
string.tiptext: A BitmapData object containing the displacement map data.

string.name: mapPoint
string.tiptext: A value that contains the offset of the upper-left corner of the target display object from the upper-left corner of the map image.

string.name: componentX
