string.tiptext: Describes which color channel to use in the map image to displace the x result.

string.name: componentY
string.tiptext: Describes which color channel to use in the map image to displace the y result.

string.name: scaleX
string.tiptext: The multiplier to use to scale the x displacement result from the map calculation.

string.name: scaleY
string.tiptext: The multiplier to use to scale the y displacement result from the map calculation.

string.name: mode
string.tiptext: The mode for the filter.

string.name: color
string.tiptext: Specifies what color to use for out-of-bounds displacements.

string.name: alpha
string.tiptext: Specifies the alpha transparency value to use for out-of-bounds displacements.

folder.name: DisplacementMapFilterMode
folder.tiptext: The DisplacementMapFilterMode class provides values for the mode propertyof the DisplacementMapFilter class.

string.name: WRAP
string.tiptext: Wraps the displacement value to the other side of the source image.

string.name: CLAMP
string.tiptext: Clamps the displacement value to the edge of the source image.

string.name: IGNORE
string.tiptext: If the displacement value is out of range, ignores the displacement and uses the source pixel.

string.name: COLOR
string.tiptext: If the displacement value is outside the image, substitutes the values in the color and alpha properties.

folder.name: DropShadowFilter
folder.tiptext: The DropShadowFilter class lets you add a drop shadow to display objects.

string.name: DropShadowFilter
string.tiptext: Creates a new DropShadowFilter instance with the specified parameters.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this filter object.

string.name: distance
string.tiptext: The offset distance for the shadow, in pixels.

string.name: angle
string.tiptext: The angle of the shadow.

string.name: color
string.tiptext: The color of the shadow.

string.name: alpha
string.tiptext: The alpha transparency value for the shadow color.

string.name: blurX
string.tiptext: The amount of horizontal blur.

string.name: blurY
string.tiptext: The amount of vertical blur.

string.name: hideObject
string.tiptext: Indicates whether or not the object is hidden.

string.name: inner
string.tiptext: Indicates whether or not the shadow is an inner shadow.

string.name: knockout
string.tiptext: Applies a knockout effect (true), which effectively makes the object's fill transparent and reveals the background color of the document.

string.name: quality
string.tiptext: The number of times to apply the filter.

string.name: strength
string.tiptext: The strength of the imprint or spread.

folder.name: GlowFilter
folder.tiptext: The GlowFilter class lets you apply a glow effect to display objects.

string.name: GlowFilter
string.tiptext: Initializes a new GlowFilter instance with the specified parameters.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this filter object.

string.name: color
string.tiptext: The color of the glow.

string.name: alpha
string.tiptext: The alpha transparency value for the color.

string.name: blurX
string.tiptext: The amount of horizontal blur.

string.name: blurY
string.tiptext: The amount of vertical blur.

string.name: inner
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the glow is an inner glow.

string.name: knockout
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the object has a knockout effect.

string.name: quality
string.tiptext: The number of times to apply the filter.

string.name: strength
string.tiptext: The strength of the imprint or spread.

folder.name: GradientBevelFilter
folder.tiptext: The GradientBevelFilter class lets you apply a gradient bevel effect to display objects.

string.name: GradientBevelFilter
string.tiptext: Initializes the filter with the specified parameters.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this filter object.

string.name: distance
string.tiptext: The offset distance.

string.name: angle
string.tiptext: The angle, in degrees.

string.name: colors
string.tiptext: An array of RGB hexadecimal color values to use in the gradient.

string.name: alphas
string.tiptext: An array of alpha transparency values for the corresponding colors in the colors array.

string.name: ratios
string.tiptext: An array of color distribution ratios for the corresponding colors in the colors array.

string.name: blurX
string.tiptext: The amount of horizontal blur.

string.name: blurY
string.tiptext: The amount of vertical blur.

string.name: knockout
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the object has a knockout effect.

string.name: quality
string.tiptext: The number of times to apply the filter.

string.name: strength
string.tiptext: The strength of the imprint or spread.

string.name: type
string.tiptext: The placement of the bevel effect.

folder.name: GradientGlowFilter
folder.tiptext: The GradientGlowFilter class lets you apply a gradient glow effect to display objects.

string.name: GradientGlowFilter
string.tiptext: Initializes the filter with the specified parameters.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this filter object.

string.name: angle
string.tiptext: The angle, in degrees.

string.name: alphas
string.tiptext: An array of alpha transparency values for the corresponding colors in the colors array.

string.name: blurX
string.tiptext: The amount of horizontal blur.

string.name: blurY
string.tiptext: The amount of vertical blur.

string.name: colors
string.tiptext: An array of colors that defines a gradient.

string.name: distance
string.tiptext: The offset distance of the glow.

string.name: knockout
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the object has a knockout effect.

string.name: quality
string.tiptext: The number of times to apply the filter.

string.name: ratios
string.tiptext: An array of color distribution ratios for the corresponding colors in the colors array.

string.name: strength
string.tiptext: The strength of the imprint or spread.

string.name: type
string.tiptext: The placement of the filter effect.

folder.name: ColorTransform
folder.tiptext: The ColorTransform class lets you adjust the color values in a display object.

string.name: ColorTransform
string.tiptext: Creates a ColorTransform object for a display object.

string.name: concat
string.tiptext: Concatenates the ColorTranform object specified by the second parameter with the current ColorTransform object and sets the current object as the result, which is an additive combination of the two color transformations.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Formats and returns a string that describes all of the properties of the ColorTransform object.

string.name: redMultiplier
string.tiptext: A decimal value that is multiplied with the red channel value.

string.name: greenMultiplier
string.tiptext: A decimal value that is multiplied with the green channel value.

string.name: blueMultiplier
string.tiptext: A decimal value that is multiplied with the blue channel value.

string.name: alphaMultiplier
string.tiptext: A decimal value that is multiplied with the alpha transparency channel value.

string.name: redOffset
string.tiptext: A number from -255 to 255 that is added to the red channel value after it has been multiplied by the redMultiplier value.

string.name: greenOffset
string.tiptext: A number from -255 to 255 that is added to the green channel value after it has been multiplied by the greenMultiplier value.

string.name: blueOffset
string.tiptext: A number from -255 to 255 that is added to the blue channel value after it has been multiplied by the blueMultiplier value.

string.name: alphaOffset
string.tiptext: A number from -255 to 255 that is added to the alpha transparency channel value after it has been multiplied by the alphaMultiplier value.

string.name: color
string.tiptext: The RGB color value for a ColorTransform object.

folder.name: Matrix
folder.tiptext: The Matrix class represents a transformation matrix that determines how to map points from one coordinate space to another.

string.name: Matrix
string.tiptext: Creates a new two-dimensional Matrix object.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a new Matrix object that is a copy of the current matrix.

string.name: concat
string.tiptext: Concatenates a matrix with the current matrix, effectively combining the geometric effects of the two.

string.name: invert
string.tiptext: Performs the opposite transformation of the original matrix.

string.name: identity
string.tiptext: Sets each matrix property to a value that causes a null transformation.

string.name: createBox
string.tiptext: Creates a Matrix with scaling, rotation, and translation values.

string.name: createGradientBox
string.tiptext: Creates the specific style of matrix expected by the beginGradientFill() method of the Graphics class.

string.name: rotate
string.tiptext: Applies a rotation transformation to the Matrix object.

string.name: translate
string.tiptext: A transformation that moves an object along the x and y axes.

string.name: scale
string.tiptext: Applies a scaling transformation to the matrix.

string.name: deltaTransformPoint
string.tiptext: Given a point in the pretransform coordinate space, returns the coordinates of that point after the transformation occurs.

string.name: transformPoint
string.tiptext: Returns the result of a geometric transformation to a Point object.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a text value listing the properties of this Matrix object.

string.name: a
string.tiptext: The value in the first row and first column of the Matrix object, which affects the positioning of pixels along the x axis when scaling or rotating an image.

string.name: b
string.tiptext: The value in the first row and second column of the Matrix object, which affects the positioning of pixels along the y axis when rotating or skewing an image.

string.name: c
string.tiptext: The value in the second row and first column of the Matrix object, which affects the positioning of pixels along the x axis when rotating or skewing an image.

string.name: d
string.tiptext: The value in the second row and second column of the Matrix object, which affects the positioning of pixels along the y axis when scaling or rotating an image.

string.name: tx
string.tiptext: The distance by which to translate each point along the x axis.

string.name: ty
string.tiptext: The distance by which to translate each point along the y axis.

folder.name: Point
folder.tiptext: The Point object represents a location in a two-dimensional coordinate system, where x represents the horizontal axis and y represents the vertical axis.

string.name: Point
string.tiptext: Creates a new point.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the Point object.

string.name: offset
string.tiptext: Offsets the Point object by the specified amount.

string.name: equals
string.tiptext: Determines whether two points are equal.

string.name: interpolate
string.tiptext: Determines a point between two specified points.

string.name: subtract
string.tiptext: Subtracts the coordinates of another point from the coordinates of this point to create a new point.

string.name: add
string.tiptext: Adds the coordinates of another point to the coordinates of this point to create a new point.

string.name: distance
string.tiptext: Returns the distance between pt1 and pt2.

string.name: polar
string.tiptext: Converts a pair of polar coordinates to a Cartesian point coordinate.

string.name: normalize
string.tiptext: Scales the line segment between (0,0) and the current point to a set length.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains the values of the x and y coordinates.

string.name: x
string.tiptext: The horizontal coordinate of the point.

string.name: y
string.tiptext: The vertical coordinate of the point.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: The length of the line segment from (0,0) to this point.

folder.name: Rectangle
folder.tiptext: A Rectangle object is an area defined by its position, as indicated by its top-left corner point (x, y) and by its width and its height.

string.name: Rectangle
string.tiptext: Creates a new Rectangle object with the top-left corner specified by the x and y parameters and with the specified width and height.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of this Rectangle object.

string.name: isEmpty
string.tiptext: Determines whether or not this Rectangle object is empty.

string.name: setEmpty
string.tiptext: Sets all properties to 0.

string.name: inflate
string.tiptext: Increases the size of the Rectangle object by the specified amounts, in pixels.

string.name: inflatePoint
string.tiptext: Increases the size of the Rectangle object using a Point object as a parameter.

string.name: offset
string.tiptext: Adjusts the location of the Rectangle object.

string.name: offsetPoint
string.tiptext: Adjusts the location of the Rectangle object using a Point object as a parameter.

string.name: contains
string.tiptext: Determines if the specified point is contained within the rectangular region.

string.name: containsPoint
string.tiptext: Determines if the specified point is contained within the rectangular region defined by this Rectangle object using a Point object as a parameter.

string.name: containsRect
string.tiptext: Determines if the Rectangle object specified by the rect parameter is contained within this Rectangle object.

string.name: intersection
string.tiptext: Returns the area of intersection.

string.name: intersects
string.tiptext: Determines if the object specified in the toIntersect parameter intersects with this Rectangle object.

string.name: union
string.tiptext: Adds two rectangles together to create a new Rectangle object.

string.name: equals
string.tiptext: Determines if the object specified in the toCompare parameter is equal to this Rectangle object.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Builds and returns a string that lists the horizontal and vertical positions and the width and height of the Rectangle object.

string.name: x
string.tiptext: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

string.name: y
string.tiptext: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: The width of the rectangle, in pixels.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: The height of the rectangle, in pixels.

string.name: left
string.tiptext: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

string.name: right
string.tiptext: The sum of the x and width properties.

string.name: top
string.tiptext: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

string.name: bottom
string.tiptext: The sum of the y and height properties.

string.name: topLeft
string.tiptext: The location of the Rectangle object's top-left corner, determined by the x and y coordinates of the point.

string.name: bottomRight
string.tiptext: The location of the Rectangle object's bottom-right corner, determined by the values of the right and bottom properties.

string.name: size
string.tiptext: The size of the Rectangle object, expressed as a Point object with the values of the width and height properties.

folder.name: Transform
folder.tiptext: The Transform class collects data about color transformations and coordinate transformations that are applied to a display object.

string.name: matrix
string.tiptext: A Matrix object containing values that affect the scaling, rotation, and translation of the display object.

string.name: colorTransform
string.tiptext: A ColorTransform object containing values that universally adjust the colors in the display object.

string.name: concatenatedMatrix
string.tiptext: A Matrix object representing the combined transformation matrixes of the display object and all of its parent objects, back to the root level.

string.name: concatenatedColorTransform
string.tiptext: A ColorTransform object representing the combined color transformations applied to the display object and all of its parent objects, back to the root level.

string.name: pixelBounds
string.tiptext: A Rectangle object that defines the bounding rectangle of the display object on the Stage.

folder.name: Camera
folder.tiptext: The Camera class is primarily for use with Flash Media Server, but can be used in a limited way without the server.

string.name: getCamera
string.tiptext: Returns a reference to a Camera object for capturing video.

string.name: setKeyFrameInterval
string.tiptext: Specifies which video frames are transmitted in full (called keyframes) instead of being interpolated by the video compression algorithm.

string.name: setLoopback
string.tiptext: Specifies whether to use a compressed video stream for a local view of the camera.

string.name: setMode
string.tiptext: Sets the camera capture mode to the native mode that best meets the specified requirements.

string.name: setMotionLevel
string.tiptext: Specifies how much motion is required to dispatch the activity event.

string.name: setQuality
string.tiptext: Sets the maximum amount of bandwidth per second or the required picture quality of the current outgoing video feed.

string.name: activityLevel
string.tiptext: A numeric value that specifies the amount of motion the camera is detecting.

string.name: bandwidth
string.tiptext: An integer that specifies the maximum amount of bandwidth the current outgoing video feed can use, in bytes.

string.name: currentFPS
string.tiptext: The rate at which the camera is capturing data, in frames per second.

string.name: fps
string.tiptext: The maximum rate at which you want the camera to capture data, in frames per second.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: The current capture height, in pixels.

string.name: index
string.tiptext: A zero-based integer that specifies the index of the camera, as reflected in the array returned by the names property.

string.name: keyFrameInterval
string.tiptext: Specifies which video frames are transmitted in full (called keyframes) instead of being interpolated by the video compression algorithm.

string.name: loopback
string.tiptext: Specifies whether a local view of what the camera is capturing is compressed and decompressed (true), as it would be for live transmission using Flash Media Server, or uncompressed (false).

string.name: motionLevel
string.tiptext: A numeric value that specifies the amount of motion required to invoke the activity event.

string.name: motionTimeout
string.tiptext: The number of milliseconds between the time the camera stops detecting motion and the time the activity event is invoked.

string.name: muted
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that specifies whether the user has denied access to the camera (true) or allowed access (false) in the Flash Player Privacy panel.

string.name: name
string.tiptext: A string that specifies the name of the current camera, as returned by the camera hardware.

string.name: names
string.tiptext: Retrieves an array of strings reflecting the names of all available cameras without displaying the Flash Player Privacy panel.

string.name: quality
string.tiptext: An integer specifying the required level of picture quality, as determined by the amount of compression being applied to each video frame.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: The current capture width, in pixels.

string.name: activity
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a camera begins or ends a session.

string.name: status
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a camera reports its status.

folder.name: ID3Info
folder.tiptext: The ID3Info class contains properties that reflect ID3 metadata.

string.name: songName
string.tiptext: The name of the song; corresponds to the ID3 2.0 tag TIT2.

string.name: artist
string.tiptext: The name of the artist; corresponds to the ID3 2.0 tag TPE1.

string.name: album
string.tiptext: The name of the album; corresponds to the ID3 2.0 tag TALB.

string.name: year
string.tiptext: The year of the recording; corresponds to the ID3 2.0 tag TYER.

string.name: comment
string.tiptext: A comment about the recording; corresponds to the ID3 2.0 tag COMM.

string.name: genre
string.tiptext: The genre of the song; corresponds to the ID3 2.0 tag TCON.

string.name: track
string.tiptext: The track number; corresponds to the ID3 2.0 tag TRCK.

folder.name: Microphone
folder.tiptext: The Microphone class lets you capture audio from a microphone attached to the computer that is running Flash Player.

string.name: getMicrophone
string.tiptext: To create or reference a Microphone object, use the Microphone.getMicrophone() method to get the index value of the current microphone.

string.name: setSilenceLevel
string.tiptext: Sets the minimum input level that should be considered sound and (optionally) the amount of silent time signifying that silence has actually begun.

string.name: setUseEchoSuppression
string.tiptext: Specifies whether to use the echo suppression feature of the audio codec.

string.name: setLoopBack
string.tiptext: Sets the microphone into loopback mode or turns it off.

string.name: names
string.tiptext: The names of all available sound capture devices.

string.name: gain
string.tiptext: The microphone gain--that is, the amount by which the microphone should multiply the signal before transmitting it.

string.name: rate
string.tiptext: The rate at which the microphone is capturing sound, in kHz.

string.name: activityLevel
string.tiptext: The amount of sound the microphone is detecting.

string.name: index
string.tiptext: The index of the microphone, as reflected in the array returned by Microphone.names.

string.name: muted
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the user has denied access to the microphone (true) or allowed access (false).

string.name: name
string.tiptext: The name of the current sound capture device, as returned by the sound capture hardware.

string.name: silenceLevel
string.tiptext: The amount of sound required to activate the microphone and dispatch the activity event.

string.name: silenceTimeout
string.tiptext: The number of milliseconds between the time the microphone stops detecting sound and the time the activity event is dispatched.

string.name: useEchoSuppression
string.tiptext: Returns true if echo suppression is enabled; false otherwise.

string.name: soundTransform
string.tiptext: Controls the sound of this microphone object when it is in loopback mode.

string.name: activity
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a microphone begins or ends a session.

string.name: status
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a microphone reports its status.

folder.name: Sound
folder.tiptext: The Sound class lets you work with sound in an application.

string.name: Sound
string.tiptext: Creates a new Sound object.

string.name: load
string.tiptext: Initiates loading of an external MP3 file from the specified URL.

string.name: play
string.tiptext: Generates a new SoundChannel object to play back the sound.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Closes the stream, causing any download of data to cease.

string.name: url
string.tiptext: The URL from which this sound was loaded.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: The length of the current sound in milliseconds.

string.name: isBuffering
string.tiptext: Returns the buffering state of external MP3 files.

string.name: bytesLoaded
string.tiptext: Returns the currently available number of bytes in this sound object.

string.name: bytesTotal
string.tiptext: Returns the total number of bytes in this sound object.

string.name: id3
string.tiptext: Provides access to the metadata that is part of an MP3 file.

string.name: complete
string.tiptext: Dispatched when data has loaded successfully.

string.name: id3
string.tiptext: Dispatched by a Sound object when ID3 data is available for an MP3 sound.

string.name: ioError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an input/output error occurs that causes a load operation to fail.

string.name: open
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a load operation starts.

string.name: progress
string.tiptext: Dispatched when data is received as a load operation progresses.

folder.name: SoundChannel
folder.tiptext: The SoundChannel class controls a sound in an application.

string.name: stop
string.tiptext: Stops the sound playing in the channel.

string.name: position
string.tiptext: The current position of the playhead within the sound.

string.name: soundTransform
string.tiptext: The SoundTransform object assigned to the sound channel.

string.name: leftPeak
string.tiptext: The current amplitude (volume) of the left channel, from 0 (silent) to 1 (full amplitude).

string.name: rightPeak
string.tiptext: The current amplitude (volume) of the right channel, from 0 (silent) to 1 (full amplitude).

string.name: soundComplete
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a sound has finished playing.

folder.name: SoundLoaderContext
folder.tiptext: The SoundLoaderContext class provides security checks for SWF files that load sound.

string.name: SoundLoaderContext
string.tiptext: Creates a new sound loader context object.

string.name: bufferTime
string.tiptext: The number of seconds to preload a streaming sound into a buffer before the sound starts to stream.

string.name: checkPolicyFile
string.tiptext: Specifies whether Flash Player should try to download a cross-domain policy file from the loaded sound's server before beginning to load the sound.

folder.name: SoundMixer
folder.tiptext: The SoundMixer class contains static properties and methods for global sound controlin the SWF file.

string.name: stopAll
string.tiptext: Stops all sounds currently playing.

string.name: computeSpectrum
string.tiptext: Takes a snapshot of the current sound wave and places it into the specified ByteArray object.

string.name: areSoundsInaccessible
string.tiptext: Determines whether any sounds are not accessible due to security restrictions.

string.name: bufferTime
string.tiptext: The number of seconds to preload an embedded streaming sound into a buffer before it starts to stream.

string.name: soundTransform
string.tiptext: The SoundTransform object that controls global sound properties.

folder.name: SoundTransform
folder.tiptext: The SoundTransform class contains properties for volume and panning.

string.name: SoundTransform
string.tiptext: Creates a SoundTransform object.

string.name: volume
string.tiptext: The volume, ranging from 0 (silent) to 1 (full volume).

string.name: leftToLeft
string.tiptext: A value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the left input is played in the left speaker.

string.name: leftToRight
string.tiptext: A value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the left input is played in the right speaker.

string.name: rightToRight
string.tiptext: A value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the right input is played in the right speaker.

string.name: rightToLeft
string.tiptext: A value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the right input is played in the left speaker.

string.name: pan
string.tiptext: The left-to-right panning of the sound, ranging from -1 (full pan left) to 1 (full pan right).

folder.name: Video
folder.tiptext: The Video class enables you to display live streaming video in an application without embedding it in your SWF file.

string.name: Video
string.tiptext: Creates a new Video instance.

string.name: clear
string.tiptext: Clears the image currently displayed in the Video object.

string.name: attachNetStream
string.tiptext: Specifies a video stream to be displayed within the boundaries of the Video object in the application window.

string.name: attachCamera
string.tiptext: Specifies a video stream from a camera to be displayed within the boundaries of the Video object in the application window.

string.name: deblocking
string.tiptext: Indicates the type of filter applied to decoded video as part of post-processing.

string.name: smoothing
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the video should be smoothed (interpolated) when it is scaled.

string.name: videoWidth
string.tiptext: An integer specifying the width of the video stream, in pixels.

string.name: videoHeight
string.tiptext: An integer specifying the height of the video stream, in pixels.

folder.name: FileFilter
folder.tiptext: The FileFilter class is used to indicate what files on the user's system are shown in the file-browsing dialog box that is displayed when FileReference.browse() or FileReferenceList.browse() is called.

string.name: FileFilter
string.tiptext: Creates a new FileFilter instance.

string.name: description
string.tiptext: The description string for the filter.

string.name: extension
string.tiptext: A list of file extensions.

string.name: macType
string.tiptext: A list of Macintosh file types.

folder.name: FileReference
folder.tiptext: The FileReference class provides a means to upload and download files between a user's computer and a server.

string.name: FileReference
string.tiptext: Creates a new FileReference object.

string.name: browse
string.tiptext: Opens a file chooser to let the user to browse for and select a file for upload.

string.name: cancel
string.tiptext: Cancels any ongoing upload or download.

string.name: download
string.tiptext: Opens a dialog box that lets the user download a file from a remote server.

string.name: upload
string.tiptext: Starts the upload of a file to a remote server.

string.name: creationDate
string.tiptext: The creation date of the file on the local disk.

string.name: creator
string.tiptext: The Macintosh creator type of the file.

string.name: modificationDate
string.tiptext: The date that the file on the local disk was last modified.

string.name: name
string.tiptext: The name of the file on the local disk.

string.name: size
string.tiptext: The size of the file on the local disk in bytes.

string.name: type
string.tiptext: The file type.

string.name: cancel
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a file upload or download is canceled through the file-browsing dialog box by the user.

string.name: complete
string.tiptext: Dispatched when download is complete or when upload generates an HTTP status code of 200.

string.name: ioError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the upload or download fails.

string.name: open
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an upload or download operation starts.

string.name: progress
string.tiptext: Dispatched periodically during the file upload or download operation.

string.name: securityError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a call to the FileReference.upload() or FileReference.download() method tries to upload a file to a server or get a file from a server that is outside the caller's security sandbox.

string.name: select
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user selects a file for upload or download from the file-browsing dialog box.

string.name: httpStatus
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an upload fails and an HTTP status code is available to describe the failure.

string.name: uploadCompleteData
string.tiptext: Dispatched after data is received from the server after a successful upload.

folder.name: FileReferenceList
folder.tiptext: The FileReferenceList class provides a means to let users select one or more files for uploading.

string.name: FileReferenceList
string.tiptext: Creates a new FileReferenceList object.

string.name: browse
string.tiptext: Displays a file-browsing dialog box that lets the user select local files to upload.

string.name: fileList
string.tiptext: An array of FileReference objects.

string.name: cancel
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user dismisses the file-browsing dialog box.

string.name: select
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the user selects one or more files to upload from the file-browsing dialog box.

folder.name: IDynamicPropertyOutput
folder.tiptext: This interface controls the serialization of dynamic properties of dynamic objects.

string.name: writeDynamicProperty
string.tiptext: Adds a dynamic property to the binary output of a serialized object.

folder.name: IDynamicPropertyWriter
folder.tiptext: This interface is used with the IDynamicPropertyOutput interface to control the serialization of dynamic properties of dynamic objects.

string.name: writeDynamicProperties
string.tiptext: Writes the name and value of an IDynamicPropertyOutput object to an object with dynamic properties.

folder.name: LocalConnection
folder.tiptext: The LocalConnection class lets you create a LocalConnection object that can invoke a method in another LocalConnection object, either within a single SWF file or between multiple SWF files.

string.name: LocalConnection
string.tiptext: Creates a LocalConnection object.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Closes (disconnects) a LocalConnection object.

string.name: connect
string.tiptext: Prepares a LocalConnection object to receive commands from a send() command (called the sending LocalConnection object).

string.name: send
string.tiptext: Invokes the method named methodName on a connection opened with the connect(<code>connectionName<code>) method (the receiving LocalConnection object).

string.name: allowDomain
string.tiptext: Specifies one or more domains that can send LocalConnection calls to this LocalConnection instance.

string.name: allowInsecureDomain
string.tiptext: Specifies one or more domains that can send LocalConnection calls to this LocalConnection object.

string.name: domain
string.tiptext: A string representing the domain of the location of the current SWF file.

string.name: client
string.tiptext: Indicates the object on which callback methods are invoked.

string.name: asyncError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an exception is thrown asynchronously -- that is, from native asynchronous code.

string.name: securityError
string.tiptext: Dispatched if a call to LocalConnection.send() attempts to send data to a different security sandbox.

string.name: status
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a LocalConnection object reports its status.

folder.name: NetConnection
folder.tiptext: The NetConnection class lets you invoke commands on a remote application server, such as Adobe's Flash Media Server 2 or Adobe Flex, and to play streaming Flash Video (FLV) files from either an HTTP address or a local drive.

string.name: NetConnection
string.tiptext: Creates a NetConnection object that you can use with a NetStream object to invoke commands on a remote application server or to play back streaming video (FLV) files locally or from a server.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Closes the connection that was opened locally or with the server and dispatches the netStatus event with a code property of NetConnection.Connect.Closed.

string.name: addHeader
string.tiptext: Adds a context header to the AMF packet structure.

string.name: call
string.tiptext: Invokes a command or method on the server running Flash Media Server, or on an application server, to which the application instance is connected.

string.name: connect
string.tiptext: Opens a connection to a server.

string.name: connected
string.tiptext: Indicates whether Flash Player has connected to a server through a persistent RTMP connection (true) or not (false).

string.name: uri
string.tiptext: The URI of the application server that was passed to NetConnection.connect(), if connect was used to connect to a server.

string.name: client
string.tiptext: Indicates the object on which callback methods should be invoked.

string.name: defaultObjectEncoding
string.tiptext: The default object encoding (AMF version) for NetConnection objects created in the SWF file.

string.name: objectEncoding
string.tiptext: The object encoding (AMF version) for this NetConnection instance.

string.name: proxyType
string.tiptext: Determines whether native SSL is used for RTMPS instead of HTTPS, and whether the CONNECT method of tunneling is used to connect through a proxy server.

string.name: connectedProxyType
string.tiptext: If a successful connection is made, indicates the method that was used to make it: a direct connection, the CONNECT method, or HTTP tunneling.

string.name: usingTLS
string.tiptext: Indicates whether a secure connection was made using native Transport Layer Security (TLS) rather than HTTPS.

string.name: asyncError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an exception is thrown asynchronously -- that is, from native asynchronous code.

string.name: ioError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an input or output error occurs that causes a network operation to fail.

string.name: securityError
string.tiptext: Dispatched if a call to NetConnection.call() attempts to connect to a server outside the caller's security sandbox.

string.name: netStatus
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a NetConnection object is reporting its status or error condition.

folder.name: NetStream
folder.tiptext: The NetStream class opens a one-way streaming connection between Flash Player and a server, such as Adobe's Macromedia Flash Media Server 2 or Adobe Flex, or between Flash Player and the local file system through a connection made available by a NetConnection object.

string.name: NetStream
string.tiptext: Creates a stream that can be used for playing FLV files through the specified NetConnection object.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Stops playing all data on the stream, sets the time property to 0, and makes the stream available for another use.

string.name: attachAudio
string.tiptext: Specifies an audio stream sent over the NetStream object, from a Microphone object passed as the source.

string.name: attachCamera
string.tiptext: Starts capturing video from the specified source, or stops capturing if theCamera is set to null.

string.name: send
string.tiptext: Sends a message on the specified stream to all subscribing clients.

string.name: receiveAudio
string.tiptext: Specifies whether incoming audio plays on the stream.

string.name: receiveVideo
string.tiptext: Specifies whether incoming video will play on the stream.

string.name: pause
string.tiptext: Pauses playback of a video stream.

string.name: resume
string.tiptext: Resumes playback of a video stream that is paused.

string.name: togglePause
string.tiptext: Pauses or resumes playback of a stream.

string.name: seek
string.tiptext: Seeks the keyframe closest to the specified location (an offset, in seconds, from the beginning of the stream).

string.name: play
string.tiptext: Begins playback of external audio or a video (FLV) file.

string.name: publish
string.tiptext: Sends streaming audio, video, and text messages from a client to a server, such as Flash Media Server 2, optionally recording the stream during transmission.

string.name: bufferTime
string.tiptext: Specifies how long to buffer messages before starting to display the stream.

string.name: time
string.tiptext: The position of the playhead, in seconds.

string.name: currentFPS
string.tiptext: The number of frames per second being displayed.

string.name: bufferLength
string.tiptext: The number of seconds of data currently in the buffer.

string.name: liveDelay
string.tiptext: The number of seconds of data in the subscribing stream's buffer in live (unbuffered) mode.

string.name: bytesLoaded
string.tiptext: The number of bytes of data that have been loaded into the player.

string.name: bytesTotal
string.tiptext: The total size in bytes of the file being loaded into the player.

string.name: soundTransform
string.tiptext: Controls sound in this NetStream object.

string.name: checkPolicyFile
string.tiptext: Specifies whether Flash Player should try to download a cross-domain policy file from the loaded FLV file's server before beginning to load the FLV file.

string.name: client
string.tiptext: Specifies the object on which callback methods are invoked.

string.name: objectEncoding
string.tiptext: The object encoding (AMF version) for this NetStream object.

string.name: asyncError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an exception is thrown asynchronously -- that is, from native asynchronous code.

string.name: ioError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an input or output error occurs that causes a network operation to fail.

string.name: netStatus
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a NetStream object is reporting its status or error condition.

string.name: onMetaData
string.tiptext: Dispatched when Flash Player receives descriptive information embedded in the FLV file being played.

string.name: onCuePoint
string.tiptext: Invoked when an embedded cue point is reached while playing an FLV file.

string.name: onPlayStatus
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a NetStream object has completely played a stream.

string.name: registerClassAlias
string.tiptext: Preserves the class (type) of an object when the object is encoded in Action Message Format (AMF).

string.name: getClassByAlias
string.tiptext: Looks up a class that previously had an alias registered through a call to the registerClassAlias() method.

string.name: navigateToURL
string.tiptext: Opens or replaces a window in the application that contains the Flash Player container (usually a browser).

string.name: sendToURL
string.tiptext: Sends a URL request to a server, but ignores any response.

folder.name: ObjectEncoding
folder.tiptext: The ObjectEncoding class allows classes that serialize objects (such as NetStream, NetConnection, SharedObject, and ByteArray) to work with prior versions of ActionScript.

string.name: AMF0
string.tiptext: Specifies that objects are serialized using the Action Message Format for ActionScript 1.0 and 2.0.

string.name: AMF3
string.tiptext: Specifies that objects are serialized using the Action Message Format for ActionScript 3.0.

string.name: DEFAULT
string.tiptext: Specifies the default (latest) format for the current player.

string.name: dynamicPropertyWriter
string.tiptext: Allows greater control over the serialization of dynamic properties of dynamic objects.

folder.name: Responder
folder.tiptext: The Responder class provides an object that is used in NetConnection.call() to handle return values from the server related to the success or failure of specific operations.

string.name: Responder
string.tiptext: Creates a new Responder object.

folder.name: SharedObject
folder.tiptext: The SharedObject class is used to read and store limited amounts of data on a user's computer or on a server.

string.name: getLocal
string.tiptext: Returns a reference to a locally persistent shared object that is available only to the current client.

string.name: getRemote
string.tiptext: Returns a reference to an object that can be shared across multiple clients by means of a server, such as Flash Media Server.

string.name: connect
string.tiptext: Connects to a remote shared object on the server through the specified connection.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Closes the connection between a remote shared object and the server.

string.name: flush
string.tiptext: Immediately writes a locally persistent shared object to a local file.

string.name: send
string.tiptext: Broadcasts a message to all clients connected to the specified remote shared object, including the client that sent the message.

string.name: clear
string.tiptext: For local shared objects, purges all of the data and deletes the shared object from the disk.

string.name: setDirty
string.tiptext: Indicates to the server that the value of a property (defined with the data property) in the shared object has changed.

string.name: setProperty
string.tiptext: Updates the value of a property (defined with the data property) in a shared object and indicates to the server that the value of the property has changed.

string.name: data
string.tiptext: The collection of attributes assigned to the data property of the object; these attributes can be shared and stored.

string.name: size
string.tiptext: The current size of the shared object, in bytes.

string.name: fps
string.tiptext: Specifies the number of times per second that a client's changes to a shared object are sent to the server.

string.name: defaultObjectEncoding
string.tiptext: The default object encoding (AMF version) for all local shared objects created in the SWF file.

string.name: objectEncoding
string.tiptext: The object encoding (AMF version) for this shared object.

string.name: client
string.tiptext: Indicates the object on which callback methods are invoked.

string.name: asyncError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an exception is thrown asynchronously -- that is, from native asynchronous code.

string.name: netStatus
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a SharedObject instance is reporting its status or error condition.

string.name: sync
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a remote shared object (SharedObject) has been updated by the server.

folder.name: SharedObjectFlushStatus
folder.tiptext: The SharedObjectFlushStatus class provides values for the code returned from a call to the SharedObject.flush() method.

string.name: FLUSHED
string.tiptext: Indicates that the flush completed successfully.

string.name: PENDING
string.tiptext: Indicates that the user is being prompted to increase disk space for the shared object before the flush can occur.

folder.name: Socket
folder.tiptext: The Socket class enables ActionScript code to make socket connections and to read and write raw binary data.

string.name: Socket
string.tiptext: Creates a Socket object.

string.name: connect
string.tiptext: Connects the socket to the specified host and port.

string.name: readBytes
string.tiptext: Reads the number of data bytes specified by the length parameter from the socket.

string.name: writeBytes
string.tiptext: Writes a sequence of bytes from the specified byte array.

string.name: writeBoolean
string.tiptext: Writes a Boolean value to the socket.

string.name: writeByte
string.tiptext: Writes a byte to the socket.

string.name: writeShort
string.tiptext: Writes a 16-bit integer to the socket.

string.name: writeInt
string.tiptext: Writes a 32-bit signed integer to the socket.

string.name: writeUnsignedInt
string.tiptext: Writes a 32-bit unsigned integer to the socket.

string.name: writeFloat
string.tiptext: Writes an IEEE 754 single-precision floating-point number to the socket.

string.name: writeDouble
string.tiptext: Writes an IEEE 754 double-precision floating-point number to the socket.

string.name: writeMultiByte
string.tiptext: Writes a multibyte string from the byte stream, using the specified character set.

string.name: writeUTF
string.tiptext: Writes the following data to the socket: a 16-bit unsigned integer, which indicates the length of the specified UTF-8 string in bytes, followed by the string itself.

string.name: writeUTFBytes
string.tiptext: Writes a UTF-8 string to the socket.

string.name: readBoolean
string.tiptext: Reads a Boolean value from the socket.

string.name: readByte
string.tiptext: Reads a signed byte from the socket.

string.name: readUnsignedByte
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned byte from the socket.

string.name: readShort
string.tiptext: Reads a signed 16-bit integer from the socket.

string.name: readUnsignedShort
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned 16-bit integer from the socket.

string.name: readInt
string.tiptext: Reads a signed 32-bit integer from the socket.

string.name: readUnsignedInt
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned 32-bit integer from the socket.

string.name: readFloat
string.tiptext: Reads an IEEE 754 single-precision floating-point number from the socket.

string.name: readDouble
string.tiptext: Reads an IEEE 754 double-precision floating-point number from the socket.

string.name: readMultiByte
string.tiptext: Reads a multibyte string from the byte stream, using the specified character set.

string.name: readUTF
string.tiptext: Reads a UTF-8 string from the socket.

string.name: readUTFBytes
string.tiptext: Reads the number of UTF-8 data bytes specified by the length parameter from the socket, and returns a string.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Closes the socket.

string.name: flush
string.tiptext: Flushes any accumulated data in the socket's output buffer.

string.name: writeObject
string.tiptext: Write an object to the socket in AMF serialized format.

string.name: readObject
string.tiptext: Reads an object from the socket, encoded in AMF serialized format.

string.name: bytesAvailable
string.tiptext: The number of bytes of data available for reading in the input buffer.

string.name: connected
string.tiptext: Indicates whether this Socket object is currently connected.

string.name: objectEncoding
string.tiptext: Controls the version of AMF used when writing or reading an object.

string.name: endian
string.tiptext: Indicates the byte order for the data; possible values are constants from the flash.utils.Endian class, Endian.BIG_ENDIAN or Endian.LITTLE_ENDIAN.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the server closes the socket connection.

string.name: connect
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a network connection has been established.

string.name: ioError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an input/output error occurs that causes a send or load operation to fail.

string.name: socketData
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a socket has received data.

string.name: securityError
string.tiptext: Dispatched if a call to Socket.connect() attempts to connect either to a server outside the caller's security sandbox or to a port lower than 1024.

folder.name: URLLoader
folder.tiptext: The URLLoader class downloads data from a URL as text, binary data, or URL-encoded variables.

string.name: URLLoader
string.tiptext: Creates a URLLoader object.

string.name: load
string.tiptext: Sends and loads data from the specified URL.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Closes the load operation in progress.

string.name: data
string.tiptext: The data received from the load operation.

string.name: dataFormat
string.tiptext: Controls whether the downloaded data is received as text (URLLoaderDataFormat.TEXT), raw binary data (URLLoaderDataFormat.BINARY), or URL-encoded variables (URLLoaderDataFormat.VARIABLES).

string.name: bytesLoaded
string.tiptext: Indicates the number of bytes that have been loaded thus far during the load operation.

string.name: bytesTotal
string.tiptext: Indicates the total number of bytes in the downloaded data.

string.name: open
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the download operation commences following a call to the URLLoader.load() method.

string.name: complete
string.tiptext: Dispatched after all the received data is decoded and placed in the data property of the URLLoader object.

string.name: progress
string.tiptext: Dispatched when data is received as the download operation progresses.

string.name: ioError
string.tiptext: Dispatched if a call to URLLoader.load() results in a fatal error that terminates the download.

string.name: securityError
string.tiptext: Dispatched if a call to URLLoader.load() attempts to load data from a server outside the security sandbox.

string.name: httpStatus
string.tiptext: Dispatched if a call to URLLoader.load() attempts to access data over HTTP and the current Flash Player environment is able to detect and return the status code for the request.

folder.name: URLLoaderDataFormat
folder.tiptext: The URLLoaderDataFormat class provides values that specify how downloaded data is received.

string.name: TEXT
string.tiptext: Specifies that downloaded data is received as text.

string.name: BINARY
string.tiptext: Specifies that downloaded data is received as raw binary data.

string.name: VARIABLES
string.tiptext: Specifies that downloaded data is received as URL-encoded variables.

folder.name: URLRequest
folder.tiptext: The URLRequest class captures all of the information in a single HTTP request.

string.name: URLRequest
string.tiptext: Creates a URLRequest object.

string.name: url
string.tiptext: The URL to be requested.

string.name: data
string.tiptext: An object containing data to be transmitted with the URL request.

string.name: method
string.tiptext: Controls whether the HTTP form submission method is a GET or POST operation.

string.name: contentType
string.tiptext: The MIME content type of any POST data.

string.name: requestHeaders
string.tiptext: The array of HTTP request headers to be appended to the HTTP request.

folder.name: URLRequestHeader
folder.tiptext: A URLRequestHeader object encapsulates a single HTTP request header and consists of a name/value pair.

string.name: URLRequestHeader
string.tiptext: Creates a new URLRequestHeader object that encapsulates a single HTTP request header.

string.name: name
string.tiptext: An HTTP request header name (such as Content-Type or SOAPAction).

string.name: value
string.tiptext: The value associated with the name property (such as text/plain).

folder.name: URLRequestMethod
folder.tiptext: The URLRequestMethod class provides values that specify whether the URLRequest object should use the POST method or the GET method when sending data to a server.

string.name: POST
string.tiptext: Specifies that the URLRequest object is a POST.

string.name: GET
string.tiptext: Specifies that the URLRequest object is a GET.

folder.name: URLStream
folder.tiptext: The URLStream class provides low-level access to downloading URLs.

string.name: load
string.tiptext: Begins downloading the URL specified in the request parameter.

string.name: readBytes
string.tiptext: Reads length bytes of data from the stream.

string.name: readBoolean
string.tiptext: Reads a Boolean value from the stream.

string.name: readByte
string.tiptext: Reads a signed byte from the stream.

string.name: readUnsignedByte
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned byte from the stream.

string.name: readShort
string.tiptext: Reads a signed 16-bit integer from the stream.

string.name: readUnsignedShort
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned 16-bit integer from the stream.

string.name: readUnsignedInt
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned 32-bit integer from the stream.

string.name: readInt
string.tiptext: Reads a signed 32-bit integer from the stream.

string.name: readFloat
string.tiptext: Reads an IEEE 754 single-precision floating-point number from the stream.

string.name: readDouble
string.tiptext: Reads an IEEE 754 double-precision floating-point number from the stream.

string.name: readMultiByte
string.tiptext: Reads a multibyte string of specified length from the byte stream using the specified character set.

string.name: readUTF
string.tiptext: Reads a UTF-8 string from the stream.

string.name: readUTFBytes
string.tiptext: Reads a sequence of length UTF-8 bytes from the stream, and returns a string.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Immediately closes the stream and cancels the download operation.

string.name: readObject
string.tiptext: Reads an object from the socket, encoded in Action Message Format (AMF).

string.name: connected
string.tiptext: Indicates whether this URLStream object is currently connected.

string.name: bytesAvailable
string.tiptext: Returns the number of bytes of data available for reading in the input buffer.

string.name: objectEncoding
string.tiptext: Controls the version of Action Message Format (AMF) used when writing or reading an object.

string.name: endian
string.tiptext: Indicates the byte order for the data; possible values are BIG_ENDIAN or LITTLE_ENDIAN.

string.name: complete
string.tiptext: Dispatched when data has loaded successfully.

string.name: securityError
string.tiptext: Dispatched if a call to URLStream.load() attempts to load data from a server outside the security sandbox.

string.name: httpStatus
string.tiptext: Dispatched if a call to URLStream.load() attempts to access data over HTTP, and the current Flash Player is able to detect and return the status code for the request.

string.name: ioError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an input/output error occurs that causes a load operation to fail.

string.name: open
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a load operation starts.

string.name: progress
string.tiptext: Dispatched when data is received as the download operation progresses.

folder.name: URLVariables
folder.tiptext: The URLVariables class allows you to transfer variables between a Flash® application and a server.

string.name: URLVariables
string.tiptext: Creates a new URLVariables object.

string.name: decode
string.tiptext: Converts the variable string to properties of the specified URLVariables object.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string containing all enumerable variables, in the MIME content encoding application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

folder.name: XMLSocket
folder.tiptext: The XMLSocket class implements client sockets that let the computer that is running Flash Player communicate with a server computer identified by an IP address or domain name.

string.name: XMLSocket
string.tiptext: Creates a new XMLSocket object.

string.name: connect
string.tiptext: Establishes a connection to the specified Internet host using the specified TCP port.

string.name: send
string.tiptext: Converts the XML object or data specified in the object parameter to a string and transmits it to the server, followed by a zero (0) byte.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Closes the connection specified by the XMLSocket object.

string.name: connected
string.tiptext: Indicates whether this XMLSocket object is currently connected.

string.name: close
string.tiptext: Dispatched when the server closes the socket connection.

string.name: connect
string.tiptext: Dispatched after a successful call to the XMLSocket.connect() method.

string.name: data
string.tiptext: Dispatched after raw data is sent or received.

string.name: ioError
string.tiptext: Dispatched when an input/output error occurs that causes a send or receive operation to fail.

string.name: securityError
string.tiptext: Dispatched if a call to the XMLSocket.connect() method attempts to connect either to a server outside the caller's security sandbox or to a port lower than 1024.

folder.name: PrintJob
folder.tiptext: The PrintJob class lets you create content and print it to one or more pages.

string.name: PrintJob
string.tiptext: Creates a PrintJob object that you can use to print one or more pages.

string.name: start
string.tiptext: Displays the operating system's Print dialog box, starts spooling, and sets the PrintJob read-only property values.

string.name: send
string.tiptext: Sends spooled pages to the printer after PrintJob.start() and PrintJob.addPage() have been successful.

string.name: addPage
string.tiptext: Sends the specified Sprite object as a single page to the print spooler.

string.name: paperHeight
string.tiptext: The overall paper height, in points.

string.name: paperWidth
string.tiptext: The overall paper width, in points.

string.name: pageHeight
string.tiptext: The height of the actual printable area on the page, in points.

string.name: pageWidth
string.tiptext: The width of the actual printable area on the page, in points.

string.name: orientation
string.tiptext: The image orientation for printing.

folder.name: PrintJobOptions
folder.tiptext: The PrintJobOptions class contains properties to use with the options parameter of the PrintJob.addPage() method.

string.name: PrintJobOptions
string.tiptext: Creates a new PrintJobOptions object.

string.name: printAsBitmap
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the content in the print job is printed as a bitmap or as a vector.

folder.name: PrintJobOrientation
folder.tiptext: This class provides values that are used by the PrintJob.orientation property for the image position of a printed page.

string.name: LANDSCAPE
string.tiptext: The landscape (horizontal) image orientation for printing.

string.name: PORTRAIT
string.tiptext: The portrait (vertical) image orientation for printing.

string.name: showRedrawRegions
string.tiptext: Shows or hides redraw regions.

folder.name: ApplicationDomain
folder.tiptext: The ApplicationDomain class is a container for discrete groups of class definitions.

string.name: ApplicationDomain
string.tiptext: Creates a new application domain.

string.name: getDefinition
string.tiptext: Gets a public definition from the specified application domain.

string.name: hasDefinition
string.tiptext: Checks to see if a public definition exists within the specified application domain.

string.name: currentDomain
string.tiptext: Gets the current application domain in which your code is executing.

string.name: parentDomain
string.tiptext: Gets the parent domain of this application domain.

folder.name: Capabilities
folder.tiptext: The Capabilities class provides properties that describe the system and player that are hosting a SWF file.

string.name: hasEmbeddedVideo
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player is running on a system that supports (true) or does not support (false) embedded video.

string.name: hasAudio
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player is running on a system that has audio capabilities.

string.name: avHardwareDisable
string.tiptext: Specifies whether access to the user's camera and microphone has been administratively prohibited (true) or allowed (false).

string.name: hasAccessibility
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player is running in an environment that supports (true) or does not support (false) communication with accessibility aids.

string.name: hasAudioEncoder
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player can (true) or cannot (false) encode an audio stream, such as that coming from a microphone.

string.name: hasMP3
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player is running on a system that does (true) or does not (false) have an MP3 decoder.

string.name: hasPrinting
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player is running on a system that does (true) or does not (false) support printing.

string.name: hasScreenBroadcast
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player does (true) or does not (false) support the development of screen broadcast applications to be run through Flash Media Server.

string.name: hasScreenPlayback
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player does (true) or does not (false) support the playback of screen broadcast applications that are being run through Flash Media Server.

string.name: hasStreamingAudio
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player can (true) or cannot (false) play streaming audio.

string.name: hasStreamingVideo
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player can (true) or cannot (false) play streaming video.

string.name: hasVideoEncoder
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player can (true) or cannot (false) encode a video stream, such as that coming from a web camera.

string.name: isDebugger
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player is a special debugging version (true), or an officially released version (false).

string.name: localFileReadDisable
string.tiptext: Specifies whether read access to the user's hard disk has been administratively prohibited (true) or allowed (false).

string.name: language
string.tiptext: Specifies the language code of the system on which the player is running.

string.name: manufacturer
string.tiptext: Specifies the manufacturer of Flash Player, in the format "Adobe OSName".

string.name: os
string.tiptext: Specifies the current operating system.

string.name: playerType
string.tiptext: Specifies the type of player.

string.name: serverString
string.tiptext: A URL-encoded string that specifies values for each Capabilities property.

string.name: version
string.tiptext: Specifies the Flash Player platform and version information.

string.name: screenColor
string.tiptext: Specifies the screen color.

string.name: pixelAspectRatio
string.tiptext: Specifies the pixel aspect ratio of the screen.

string.name: screenDPI
string.tiptext: Specifies the dots-per-inch (dpi) resolution of the screen, in pixels.

string.name: screenResolutionX
string.tiptext: Specifies the maximum horizontal resolution of the screen.

string.name: screenResolutionY
string.tiptext: Specifies the maximum vertical resolution of the screen.

string.name: hasIME
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player is running on a system that does (true) or does not (false) have an input method editor (IME) installed.

string.name: hasTLS
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the player is on a system that supports native SSL sockets through NetConnection (true) or does not (false).

folder.name: IME
folder.tiptext: The IME class lets you directly manipulate the operating system's input method editor (IME) in the Flash Player application that is running on a client computer.

string.name: setCompositionString
string.tiptext: Sets the IME composition string.

string.name: doConversion
string.tiptext: Instructs the IME to select the first candidate for the current composition string.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the system IME is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

string.name: conversionMode
string.tiptext: The conversion mode of the current IME.

string.name: imeComposition
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a user has completed an input method editor (IME) composition and the reading string is available.

folder.name: IMEConversionMode
folder.tiptext: This class contains constants for use with the IME.conversionMode property.

string.name: ALPHANUMERIC_FULL
string.tiptext: The string "ALPHANUMERIC_FULL", for use with the IME.conversionMode property.

string.name: ALPHANUMERIC_HALF
string.tiptext: The string "ALPHANUMERIC_HALF", for use with the IME.conversionMode property.

string.name: CHINESE
string.tiptext: The string "CHINESE", for use with the IME.conversionMode property.

string.name: JAPANESE_HIRAGANA
string.tiptext: The string "JAPANESE_HIRAGANA", for use with the IME.conversionMode property.

string.name: JAPANESE_KATAKANA_FULL
string.tiptext: The string "JAPANESE_KATAKANA_FULL", for use with the IME.conversionMode property.

string.name: JAPANESE_KATAKANA_HALF
string.tiptext: The string "JAPANESE_KATAKANA_HALF", for use with the IME.conversionMode property.

string.name: KOREAN
string.tiptext: The string "KOREAN", for use with the IME.conversionMode property.

string.name: UNKNOWN
string.tiptext: The string "UNKNOWN", which can be returned by a call to the IME.conversionMode property.

folder.name: LoaderContext
folder.tiptext: The LoaderContext class provides options for loading SWF files and other media by using the Loader class.

string.name: LoaderContext
string.tiptext: Creates a new LoaderContext object, with the specified settings.

string.name: checkPolicyFile
string.tiptext: Specifies whether Flash Player should attempt to download a cross-domain policy file from the loaded object's server before beginning to load the object itself.

string.name: applicationDomain
string.tiptext: Specifies the application domain to use for the Loader.load() or Loader.loadBytes() method.

string.name: securityDomain
string.tiptext: Specifies the security domain to use for a Loader.load() operation.

string.name: fscommand
string.tiptext: Lets the SWF file communicate with either Flash Player or the program hosting Flash Player, such as a web browser.

folder.name: Security
folder.tiptext: The Security class lets you specify how SWF files in different domains can communicate with each other.

string.name: allowDomain
string.tiptext: Lets SWF files and HTML files access objects and variables in the calling SWF file.

string.name: allowInsecureDomain
string.tiptext: Lets SWF and HTML files hosted using the HTTPS protocol, access objects and variables in the calling SWF file.

string.name: loadPolicyFile
string.tiptext: Loads a cross-domain policy file from a location specified by the url parameter.

string.name: showSettings
string.tiptext: Displays the Security Settings panel in Flash Player.

string.name: REMOTE
string.tiptext: The SWF file is from an Internet URL and operates under domain-based sandbox rules.

string.name: LOCAL_WITH_FILE
string.tiptext: The SWF file is a local file, has not been trusted by the user, and was not published with a networking designation.

string.name: LOCAL_WITH_NETWORK
string.tiptext: The SWF file is a local file, has not been trusted by the user, and was published with a networking designation.

string.name: LOCAL_TRUSTED
string.tiptext: The SWF file is a local file and has been trusted by the user, using either the Settings Manager or a FlashPlayerTrust configuration file.

string.name: exactSettings
string.tiptext: Determines how Flash Player chooses the domain to use for certain Flash Player settings, including settings for camera and microphone permissions, storage quotas, and storage of persistent shared objects.

string.name: sandboxType
string.tiptext: Indicates the type of security sandbox in which the calling SWF file is operating.

folder.name: SecurityDomain
folder.tiptext: The SecurityDomain class represents the current security "sandbox," also known as a security domain.

string.name: currentDomain
string.tiptext: Gets the current security domain.

folder.name: SecurityPanel
folder.tiptext: The SecurityPanel class provides values for specifying which Security Settings panel you want to display.

string.name: DEFAULT
string.tiptext: When passed to Security.showSettings(), displays the panel that was open the last time the user closed the Flash Player Settings.

string.name: PRIVACY
string.tiptext: When passed to Security.showSettings(), displays the Privacy Settings panel in Flash Player Settings.

string.name: LOCAL_STORAGE
string.tiptext: When passed to Security.showSettings(), displays the Local Storage Settings panel in Flash Player Settings.

string.name: MICROPHONE
string.tiptext: When passed to Security.showSettings(), displays the Microphone panel in Flash Player Settings.

string.name: CAMERA
string.tiptext: When passed to Security.showSettings(), displays the Camera panel in Flash Player Settings.

string.name: SETTINGS_MANAGER
string.tiptext: When passed to Security.showSettings(), displays the Settings Manager (in a separate browser window).

folder.name: System
folder.tiptext: The System class contains properties related to certain operations that take place on the user's computer, such as operations with shared objects, local settings for cameras and microphones, and use of the Clipboard.

string.name: setClipboard
string.tiptext: Replaces the contents of the Clipboard with a specified text string.

string.name: ime
string.tiptext: The currently installed system IME.

string.name: totalMemory
string.tiptext: The amount of memory (in bytes) currently in use by Adobe® Flash® Player.

string.name: useCodePage
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that tells Flash Player which code page to use to interpret external text files.

folder.name: AntiAliasType
folder.tiptext: The AntiAliasType class provides values for anti-aliasing in the flash.text.TextField class.

string.name: NORMAL
string.tiptext: Sets anti-aliasing to the anti-aliasing that is used in Flash Player 7 and earlier.

string.name: ADVANCED
string.tiptext: Sets anti-aliasing to advanced anti-aliasing.

folder.name: CSMSettings
folder.tiptext: The CSMSettings class contains properties for use with the TextRenderer.setAdvancedAntiAliasingTable() method to provide continuous stroke modulation (CSM).

string.name: CSMSettings
string.tiptext: Creates a new CSMSettings object which stores stroke values for custom anti-aliasing settings.

string.name: fontSize
string.tiptext: The size, in pixels, for which the settings apply.

string.name: insideCutoff
string.tiptext: The inside cutoff value, above which densities are set to a maximum density value (such as 255).

string.name: outsideCutoff
string.tiptext: The outside cutoff value, below which densities are set to zero.

folder.name: Font
folder.tiptext: The Font class is used to manage embedded fonts in SWF files.

string.name: hasGlyphs
string.tiptext: Specifies whether a provided string can be displayed using the currently assigned font.

string.name: enumerateFonts
string.tiptext: Specifies whether to provide a list of the currently available embedded fonts.

string.name: registerFont
string.tiptext: Registers a font class in the global font list.

string.name: fontName
string.tiptext: The name of an embedded font.

string.name: fontStyle
string.tiptext: The style of the font.

string.name: fontType
string.tiptext: The type of the font.

folder.name: FontStyle
folder.tiptext: The FontStyle class provides values for the TextRenderer class.

string.name: REGULAR
string.tiptext: Defines the plain style of a font for the fontStyle parameter in the setAdvancedAntiAliasingTable() method.

string.name: BOLD
string.tiptext: Defines the bold style of a font for the fontStyle parameter in the setAdvancedAntiAliasingTable() method.

string.name: ITALIC
string.tiptext: Defines the italic style of a font for the fontStyle parameter in the setAdvancedAntiAliasingTable() method.

string.name: BOLD_ITALIC
string.tiptext: Defines the combined bold and italic style of a font for the fontStyle parameter in the setAdvancedAntiAliasingTable() method.

folder.name: FontType
folder.tiptext: The FontType class contains the enumerated constants "embedded" and "device" for the fontType property of the Font class.

string.name: EMBEDDED
string.tiptext: Indicates that this is an embedded font.

string.name: DEVICE
string.tiptext: Indicates that this is a device font.

folder.name: GridFitType
folder.tiptext: The GridFitType class defines values for grid fitting in the TextField class.

string.name: NONE
string.tiptext: Doesn't set grid fitting.

string.name: PIXEL
string.tiptext: Fits strong horizontal and vertical lines to the pixel grid.

string.name: SUBPIXEL
string.tiptext: Fits strong horizontal and vertical lines to the sub-pixel grid on LCD monitors.

folder.name: StaticText
folder.tiptext: This class represents StaticText objects on the display list.

string.name: text
string.tiptext: Returns the current text of the static text field.

folder.name: StyleSheet
folder.tiptext: The StyleSheet class lets you create a StyleSheet object that contains text formatting rules for font size, color, and other styles.

string.name: StyleSheet
string.tiptext: Creates a new StyleSheet object.

string.name: getStyle
string.tiptext: Returns a copy of the style object associated with the style named styleName.

string.name: setStyle
string.tiptext: Adds a new style with the specified name to the style sheet object.

string.name: clear
string.tiptext: Removes all styles from the style sheet object.

string.name: transform
string.tiptext: Extends the CSS parsing capability.

string.name: parseCSS
string.tiptext: Parses the CSS in cssText and loads the StyleSheet with it.

string.name: styleNames
string.tiptext: An array that contains the names (as strings) of all of the styles registered in this style sheet.

folder.name: TextColorType
folder.tiptext: The TextColorType class provides color values for the flash.text.TextRenderer class.

string.name: DARK_COLOR
string.tiptext: Used in the colorType parameter in the setAdvancedAntiAliasingTable() method.

string.name: LIGHT_COLOR
string.tiptext: Used in the colorType parameter in the setAdvancedAntiAliasingTable() method.

folder.name: TextDisplayMode
folder.tiptext: The TextDisplayMode class contains values that control the subpixel anti-aliasing of the advanced anti-aliasing system.

string.name: LCD
string.tiptext: Forces Flash Player to use LCD subpixel anti-aliasing.

string.name: CRT
string.tiptext: Forces Flash Player to display grayscale anti-aliasing.

string.name: DEFAULT
string.tiptext: Allows Flash Player to choose LCD or CRT mode.

folder.name: TextField
folder.tiptext: The TextField class is used to create display objects for text display and input.

string.name: TextField
string.tiptext: Creates a new TextField instance.

string.name: appendText
string.tiptext: Appends text to the end of the existing text of the TextField.

string.name: getCharBoundaries
string.tiptext: Returns a rectangle that is the bounding box of the character.

string.name: getCharIndexAtPoint
string.tiptext: Returns the zero-based index value of the character.

string.name: getFirstCharInParagraph
string.tiptext: The zero-based index value of the character.

string.name: getLineIndexAtPoint
string.tiptext: The zero-based index value of the line at a specified point.

string.name: getLineIndexOfChar
string.tiptext: The zero-based index value of the line containing the character that the the charIndex parameter spcifies.

string.name: getLineLength
string.tiptext: Returns the number of characters in a specific text line.

string.name: getLineMetrics
string.tiptext: Returns metrics information about a given text line.

string.name: getLineOffset
string.tiptext: The zero-based index value of the first character in the line.

string.name: getLineText
string.tiptext: The text string contained in the specified line.

string.name: getParagraphLength
string.tiptext: The zero-based index value of the character.

string.name: getTextFormat
string.tiptext: Returns a TextFormat object.

string.name: replaceSelectedText
string.tiptext: Replaces the current selection with the contents of the value parameter.

string.name: replaceText
string.tiptext: Replaces a range of characters.

string.name: setSelection
string.tiptext: Sets a new text selection.

string.name: setTextFormat
string.tiptext: Applies text formatting.

string.name: getImageReference
string.tiptext: Returns a DisplayObject reference for the given id, for an image or SWF file that has been added to an HTML-formatted text field by using an <img> tag.

string.name: alwaysShowSelection
string.tiptext: When set to true and the text field is not in focus, Flash Player highlights the selection in the text field in gray.

string.name: antiAliasType
string.tiptext: The type of anti-aliasing used for this text field.

string.name: autoSize
string.tiptext: Controls automatic sizing and alignment of text fields.

string.name: background
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the text field has a background fill.

string.name: backgroundColor
string.tiptext: The color of the text field background.

string.name: border
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the text field has a border.

string.name: borderColor
string.tiptext: The color of the text field border.

string.name: bottomScrollV
string.tiptext: An integer (1-based index) that indicates the bottommost line that is currently visible in the specified text field.

string.name: caretIndex
string.tiptext: The index of the insertion point (caret) position.

string.name: condenseWhite
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that specifies whether extra white space (spaces, line breaks, and so on) in a text field with HTML text should be removed.

string.name: defaultTextFormat
string.tiptext: Specifies the format applied to newly inserted text, such as text inserted with the replaceSelectedText() method or text entered by a user.

string.name: embedFonts
string.tiptext: Specifies whether to render by using embedded font outlines.

string.name: gridFitType
string.tiptext: The type of grid fitting used for this text field.

string.name: htmlText
string.tiptext: Contains the HTML representation of the text field's contents.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: The number of characters in a text field.

string.name: maxChars
string.tiptext: The maximum number of characters that the text field can contain, as entered by a user.

string.name: maxScrollH
string.tiptext: The maximum value of scrollH.

string.name: maxScrollV
string.tiptext: The maximum value of scrollV.

string.name: mouseWheelEnabled
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that indicates whether Flash Player should automatically scroll multiline text fields when the user clicks a text field and rolls the mouse wheel.

string.name: multiline
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the text field is a multiline text field.

string.name: numLines
string.tiptext: Defines the number of text lines in a multiline text field.

string.name: displayAsPassword
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the text field is a password text field.

string.name: restrict
