string.tiptext: Indicates the set of characters that a user can enter into the text field.

string.name: scrollH
string.tiptext: The current horizontal scrolling position.

string.name: scrollV
string.tiptext: The vertical position of text in a text field.

string.name: selectable
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that indicates whether the text field is selectable.

string.name: selectionBeginIndex
string.tiptext: The zero-based character index value of the first character in the current selection.

string.name: selectionEndIndex
string.tiptext: The zero-based character index value of the last character in the current selection.

string.name: sharpness
string.tiptext: The sharpness of the glyph edges in this text field.

string.name: styleSheet
string.tiptext: Attaches a style sheet to the text field.

string.name: text
string.tiptext: A string that is the current text in the text field.

string.name: textColor
string.tiptext: The color of the text in a text field, in hexadecimal format.

string.name: textHeight
string.tiptext: The height of the text in pixels.

string.name: textWidth
string.tiptext: The width of the text in pixels.

string.name: thickness
string.tiptext: The thickness of the glyph edges in this text field.

string.name: type
string.tiptext: The type of the text field.

string.name: wordWrap
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that indicates whether the text field has word wrap.

string.name: useRichTextClipboard
string.tiptext: Specifies whether to copy and paste the text formatting along with the text.

string.name: change
string.tiptext: Dispatched after a control's value is modified.

string.name: link
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a user clicks a hyperlink in an HTML-enabled text field, where the URL begins with "event:".

string.name: scroll
string.tiptext: Dispatched by a TextField object after the user scrolls.

string.name: textInput
string.tiptext: Flash Player dispatches the textInput event when a user enters one or more characters of text.

folder.name: TextFieldAutoSize
folder.tiptext: The TextFieldAutoSize class is an enumeration of constant values used in setting the autoSize property of the TextField class.

string.name: NONE
string.tiptext: Specifies that no resizing is to occur.

string.name: LEFT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the text is to be treated as left-justified text, meaning that the left side of the text field remains fixed and any resizing of a single line is on the right side.

string.name: CENTER
string.tiptext: Specifies that the text is to be treated as center-justified text.

string.name: RIGHT
string.tiptext: Specifies that the text is to be treated as right-justified text, meaning that the right side of the text field remains fixed and any resizing of a single line is on the left side.

folder.name: TextFieldType
folder.tiptext: The TextFieldType class is an enumeration of constant values used in setting the type property of the TextField class.

string.name: INPUT
string.tiptext: Used to specify an input TextField.

string.name: DYNAMIC
string.tiptext: Used to specify a dynamic TextField.

folder.name: TextFormat
folder.tiptext: The TextFormat class represents character formatting information.

string.name: TextFormat
string.tiptext: Creates a TextFormat object with the specified properties.

string.name: align
string.tiptext: Indicates the alignment of the paragraph.

string.name: blockIndent
string.tiptext: Indicates the block indentation in pixels.

string.name: bold
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the text is boldface.

string.name: bullet
string.tiptext: Indicates that the text is part of a bulleted list.

string.name: color
string.tiptext: Indicates the color of the text.

string.name: font
string.tiptext: The name of the font for text in this text format, as a string.

string.name: indent
string.tiptext: Indicates the indentation from the left margin to the first character in the paragraph.

string.name: italic
string.tiptext: Indicates whether text in this text format is italicized.

string.name: kerning
string.tiptext: A Boolean value that indicates whether kerning is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

string.name: leading
string.tiptext: An integer representing the amount of vertical space (called leading) between lines.

string.name: leftMargin
string.tiptext: The left margin of the paragraph, in pixels.

string.name: letterSpacing
string.tiptext: An integer representing the amount of space that is uniformly distributed between all characters.

string.name: rightMargin
string.tiptext: The right margin of the paragraph, in pixels.

string.name: size
string.tiptext: The point size of text in this text format.

string.name: tabStops
string.tiptext: Specifies custom tab stops as an array of non-negative integers.

string.name: target
string.tiptext: Indicates the target window where the hyperlink is displayed.

string.name: underline
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the text that uses this text format is underlined (true) or not (false).

string.name: url
string.tiptext: Indicates the target URL for the text in this text format.

folder.name: TextFormatAlign
folder.tiptext: The TextFormatAlign class provides values for text alignment in the TextFormat class.

string.name: LEFT
string.tiptext: Constant; aligns text to the left within the text field.

string.name: CENTER
string.tiptext: Constant; centers the text in the text field.

string.name: RIGHT
string.tiptext: Constant; aligns text to the right within the text field.

string.name: JUSTIFY
string.tiptext: Constant; justifies text within the text field.

folder.name: TextLineMetrics
folder.tiptext: The TextLineMetrics class contains information about the text position and measurements of a line of text within a text field.

string.name: TextLineMetrics
string.tiptext: Contains information about the text position and measurements of a line of text in a text field.

string.name: x
string.tiptext: The x value is the left position of the first character in pixels.

string.name: width
string.tiptext: The width value is the width of the text of the selected lines (not necessarily the complete text) in pixels.

string.name: height
string.tiptext: The height value of the text of the selected lines (not necessarily the complete text) in pixels.

string.name: ascent
string.tiptext: The ascent value of the text is the length from the baseline to the top of the line height in pixels.

string.name: descent
string.tiptext: The descent value of the text is the length from the baseline to the bottom depth of the line in pixels.

string.name: leading
string.tiptext: The leading value is the measurement of the vertical distance between the lines of text.

folder.name: TextRenderer
folder.tiptext: The TextRenderer class provides functionality for the advanced anti-aliasing capability of embedded fonts.

string.name: setAdvancedAntiAliasingTable
string.tiptext: Sets a custom continuous stroke modulation (CSM) lookup table for a font.

string.name: maxLevel
string.tiptext: The adaptively sampled distance fields (ADFs) quality level for advanced anti-aliasing.

string.name: displayMode
string.tiptext: Controls the rendering of advanced anti-aliased text.

folder.name: TextSnapshot
folder.tiptext: TextSnapshot objects let you work with static text in a movie clip.

string.name: findText
string.tiptext: Searches the specified TextSnapshot object and returns the position of the first occurrence of textToFind found at or after beginIndex.

string.name: getSelected
string.tiptext: Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether a TextSnapshot object contains selected text in the specified range.

string.name: getSelectedText
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the characters specified by the corresponding setSelected() method.

string.name: getText
string.tiptext: Returns a string that contains all the characters specified by the beginIndex and endIndex parameters.

string.name: getTextRunInfo
string.tiptext: Returns an array of objects that contains information about a run of text.

string.name: hitTestTextNearPos
string.tiptext: Lets you determine which character within a TextSnapshot object is on or near the specified x, y coordinates of the movie clip containing the text in the TextSnapshot object.

string.name: setSelectColor
string.tiptext: Specifies the color to use when highlighting characters that have been selected with the setSelected() method.

string.name: setSelected
string.tiptext: Specifies a range of characters in a TextSnapshot object to be selected or deselected.

string.name: charCount
string.tiptext: The number of characters in a TextSnapshot object.

folder.name: ContextMenu
folder.tiptext: The ContextMenu class provides control over the items in the Flash Player context menu.

string.name: ContextMenu
string.tiptext: Creates a ContextMenu object.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates a copy of the specified ContextMenu object.

string.name: hideBuiltInItems
string.tiptext: Hides all built-in menu items (except Settings) in the specified ContextMenu object.

string.name: builtInItems
string.tiptext: An object that has the following properties of the ContextMenuBuiltInItems class: forwardAndBack, loop, play, print, quality, rewind, save, and zoom.

string.name: customItems
string.tiptext: An array of ContextMenuItem objects.

string.name: menuSelect
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a user first generates a context menu but before the contents of the context menu are displayed.

folder.name: ContextMenuBuiltInItems
folder.tiptext: The ContextMenuBuiltInItems class describes the items that are built in to a context menu.

string.name: ContextMenuBuiltInItems
string.tiptext: Creates a new ContextMenuBuiltInItems object so that you can set the properties for Flash Player to display or hide each menu item.

string.name: save
string.tiptext: Lets the user with Shockmachine installed save a SWF file.

string.name: zoom
string.tiptext: Lets the user zoom in and out on a SWF file at run time.

string.name: quality
string.tiptext: Lets the user set the resolution of the SWF file at run time.

string.name: play
string.tiptext: Lets the user start a paused SWF file (does not appear for a single-frame SWF file).

string.name: loop
string.tiptext: Lets the user set a SWF file to start over automatically when it reaches the final frame (does not appear for a single-frame SWF file).

string.name: rewind
string.tiptext: Lets the user set a SWF file to play from the first frame when selected, at any time (does not appear for a single-frame SWF file).

string.name: forwardAndBack
string.tiptext: Lets the user move forward or backward one frame in a SWF file at run time (does not appear for a single-frame SWF file).

string.name: print
string.tiptext: Lets the user send the displayed frame image to a printer.

folder.name: ContextMenuItem
folder.tiptext: Use the ContextMenuItem class to create custom menu items to display in the Flash Player context menu.

string.name: ContextMenuItem
string.tiptext: Creates a new ContextMenuItem object that can be added to the ContextMenu.customItems array.

string.name: clone
string.tiptext: Creates and returns a copy of the specified ContextMenuItem object.

string.name: caption
string.tiptext: Specifies the menu item caption (text) displayed in the context menu.

string.name: enabled
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the specified menu item is enabled or disabled.

string.name: separatorBefore
string.tiptext: Indicates whether a separator bar should appear above the specified menu item.

string.name: visible
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the specified menu item is visible when the Flash Player context menu is displayed.

string.name: menuItemSelect
string.tiptext: Dispatched when a user selects an item from a context menu.

folder.name: Keyboard
folder.tiptext: The Keyboard class is used to build an interface that can be controlled by a user with a standard keyboard.

string.name: isAccessible
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the last key pressed is accessible by other SWF files.

string.name: BACKSPACE
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Backspace key (8).

string.name: CAPS_LOCK
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Caps Lock key (20).

string.name: CONTROL
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Control key (17).

string.name: DELETE
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Delete key (46).

string.name: DOWN
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Down Arrow key (40).

string.name: END
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the End key (35).

string.name: ENTER
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Enter key (13).

string.name: ESCAPE
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Escape key (27).

string.name: F1
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F1 key (112).

string.name: F2
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F2 key (113).

string.name: F3
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F3 key (114).

string.name: F4
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F4 key (115).

string.name: F5
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F5 key (116).

string.name: F6
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F6 key (117).

string.name: F7
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F7 key (118).

string.name: F8
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F8 key (119).

string.name: F9
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F9 key (120).

string.name: F10
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F10 key (121).

string.name: F11
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F11 key (122).

string.name: F12
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F12 key (123).

string.name: F13
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F13 key (124).

string.name: F14
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F14 key (125).

string.name: F15
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the F15 key (126).

string.name: HOME
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Home key (36).

string.name: INSERT
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Insert key (45).

string.name: LEFT
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Left Arrow key (37).

string.name: NUMPAD_0
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the number 0 key on the number pad (96).

string.name: NUMPAD_1
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the number 1 key on the number pad (97).

string.name: NUMPAD_2
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the number 2 key on the number pad (98).

string.name: NUMPAD_3
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the number 3 key on the number pad (99).

string.name: NUMPAD_4
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the number 4 key on the number pad (100).

string.name: NUMPAD_5
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the number 5 key on the number pad (101).

string.name: NUMPAD_6
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the number 6 key on the number pad (102).

string.name: NUMPAD_7
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the number 7 key on the number pad (103).

string.name: NUMPAD_8
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the number 8 key on the number pad (104).

string.name: NUMPAD_9
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the number 9 key on the number pad (105).

string.name: NUMPAD_ADD
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the addition key on the number pad (107).

string.name: NUMPAD_DECIMAL
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the decimal key on the number pad (110).

string.name: NUMPAD_DIVIDE
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the division key on the number pad (111).

string.name: NUMPAD_ENTER
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Enter key on the number pad (108).

string.name: NUMPAD_MULTIPLY
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the multiplication key on the number pad (106).

string.name: NUMPAD_SUBTRACT
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the subtraction key on the number pad (109).

string.name: PAGE_DOWN
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Page Down key (34).

string.name: PAGE_UP
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Page Up key (33).

string.name: RIGHT
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Right Arrow key (39).

string.name: SHIFT
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Shift key (16).

string.name: SPACE
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Spacebar (32).

string.name: TAB
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Tab key (9).

string.name: UP
string.tiptext: Constant associated with the key code value for the Up Arrow key (38).

string.name: capsLock
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the Caps Lock key is activated (true) or not (false).

string.name: numLock
string.tiptext: Specifies whether the Num Lock key is activated (true) or not (false).

folder.name: KeyLocation
folder.tiptext: The KeyLocation class contains constants that indicate the location of a key pressed on the keyboard.

string.name: STANDARD
string.tiptext: Indicates the key activation is not distinguished as the left or right version of the key, and did not originate on the numeric keypad (or did not originate with a virtual key corresponding to the numeric keypad).

string.name: LEFT
string.tiptext: Indicates the key activated is in the left key location (there is more than one possible location for this key).

string.name: RIGHT
string.tiptext: Indicates the key activated is in the right key location (there is more than one possible location for this key).

string.name: NUM_PAD
string.tiptext: Indicates the key activation originated on the numeric keypad or with a virtual key corresponding to the numeric keypad.

folder.name: Mouse
folder.tiptext: The methods of the Mouse class are used to hide and show the mouse pointer.

string.name: hide
string.tiptext: Hides the pointer.

string.name: show
string.tiptext: Displays the pointer.

folder.name: ByteArray
folder.tiptext: The ByteArray class provides methods and properties to optimize reading, writing, and working with binary data.

string.name: ByteArray
string.tiptext: Creates a ByteArray instance representing a packed array of bytes, so that you can use the methods and properties in this class to optimize your data storage and stream.

string.name: readBytes
string.tiptext: Reads the number of data bytes, specified by the length parameter, from the byte stream.

string.name: writeBytes
string.tiptext: Writes a sequence of length bytes from the specified byte array, bytes, starting offset (zero-based index) bytes into the byte stream.

string.name: writeBoolean
string.tiptext: Writes a Boolean value.

string.name: writeByte
string.tiptext: Writes a byte to the byte stream.

string.name: writeShort
string.tiptext: Writes a 16-bit integer to the byte stream.

string.name: writeInt
string.tiptext: Writes a 32-bit signed integer to the byte stream.

string.name: writeUnsignedInt
string.tiptext: Writes a 32-bit unsigned integer to the byte stream.

string.name: writeFloat
string.tiptext: Writes an IEEE 754 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number to the byte stream.

string.name: writeDouble
string.tiptext: Writes an IEEE 754 double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number to the byte stream.

string.name: writeMultiByte
string.tiptext: Writes a multibyte string to the byte stream using the specified character set.

string.name: writeUTF
string.tiptext: Writes a UTF-8 string to the byte stream.

string.name: writeUTFBytes
string.tiptext: Writes a UTF-8 string to the byte stream.

string.name: readBoolean
string.tiptext: Reads a Boolean value from the byte stream.

string.name: readByte
string.tiptext: Reads a signed byte from the byte stream.

string.name: readUnsignedByte
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned byte from the byte stream.

string.name: readShort
string.tiptext: Reads a signed 16-bit integer from the byte stream.

string.name: readUnsignedShort
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned 16-bit integer from the byte stream.

string.name: readInt
string.tiptext: Reads a signed 32-bit integer from the byte stream.

string.name: readUnsignedInt
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned 32-bit integer from the byte stream.

string.name: readFloat
string.tiptext: Reads an IEEE 754 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number from the byte stream.

string.name: readDouble
string.tiptext: Reads an IEEE 754 double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number from the byte stream.

string.name: readMultiByte
string.tiptext: Reads a multibyte string of specified length from the byte stream using the specified character set.

string.name: readUTF
string.tiptext: Reads a UTF-8 string from the byte stream.

string.name: readUTFBytes
string.tiptext: Reads a sequence of UTF-8 bytes specified by the length parameter from the byte stream and returns a string.

string.name: writeObject
string.tiptext: Writes an object into the byte array in AMF serialized format.

string.name: readObject
string.tiptext: Reads an object from the byte array, encoded in AMF serialized format.

string.name: compress
string.tiptext: Compresses the byte array using zlib compression.

string.name: uncompress
string.tiptext: Decompresses the byte array.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Converts the byte array to a string.

string.name: length
string.tiptext: The length of the ByteArray object, in bytes.

string.name: bytesAvailable
string.tiptext: The number of bytes of data available for reading from the current position in the byte array to the end of the array.

string.name: position
string.tiptext: Moves, or returns the current position, in bytes, of the file pointer into the ByteArray object.

string.name: defaultObjectEncoding
string.tiptext: Denotes the default object encoding for the ByteArray class to use for a new ByteArray instance.

string.name: objectEncoding
string.tiptext: Used to determine whether the ActionScript 3.0, ActionScript 2.0, or ActionScript 1.0 format should be used when writing to, or reading from, a ByteArray instance.

string.name: endian
string.tiptext: Changes or reads the byte order for the data; either "bigEndian" or "littleEndian".

folder.name: Dictionary
folder.tiptext: The Dictionary class lets you create a dynamic collection of properties, which uses strict equality (===) for key comparison on non-primitive object keys.

string.name: Dictionary
string.tiptext: Creates a new Dictionary object.

folder.name: Endian
folder.tiptext: The Endian class contains values that denote the byte order used to represent multibyte numbers.

string.name: BIG_ENDIAN
string.tiptext: Indicates the most significant byte of the multibyte number appears first in the sequence of bytes.

string.name: LITTLE_ENDIAN
string.tiptext: Indicates the least significant byte of the multibyte number appears first in the sequence of bytes.

folder.name: IDataInput
folder.tiptext: The IDataInput interface provides a set of methods for reading binary data.

string.name: readBytes
string.tiptext: Reads the number of data bytes, specified by the length parameter, from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readBoolean
string.tiptext: Reads a Boolean value from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readByte
string.tiptext: Reads a signed byte from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readUnsignedByte
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned byte from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readShort
string.tiptext: Reads a signed 16-bit integer from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readUnsignedShort
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned 16-bit integer from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readInt
string.tiptext: Reads a signed 32-bit integer from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readUnsignedInt
string.tiptext: Reads an unsigned 32-bit integer from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readFloat
string.tiptext: Reads an IEEE 754 single-precision floating point number from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readDouble
string.tiptext: Reads an IEEE 754 double-precision floating point number from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readMultiByte
string.tiptext: Reads a multibyte string of specified length from the byte stream using the specified character set.

string.name: readUTF
string.tiptext: Reads a UTF-8 string from the byte stream or byte array.

string.name: readUTFBytes
string.tiptext: Reads a sequence of length UTF-8 bytes from the byte stream or byte array and returns a string.

string.name: readObject
string.tiptext: Reads an object from the byte stream or byte array, encoded in AMF serialized format.

string.name: bytesAvailable
string.tiptext: Returns the number of bytes of data available for reading in the input buffer.

string.name: objectEncoding
string.tiptext: Used to determine whether the ActionScript 3.0, ActionScript 2.0, or ActionScript 1.0 format should be used when writing to, or reading binary data.

string.name: endian
string.tiptext: The byte order for the data, either the "bigEndian" or "littleEndian" constant from the Endian class.

folder.name: IDataOutput
folder.tiptext: The IDataOutput interface provides a set of methods for writing binary data.

string.name: writeBytes
string.tiptext: Writes a sequence of length bytes from the specified byte array, bytes, starting offset(zero-based index) bytes into the byte stream.

string.name: writeBoolean
string.tiptext: Writes a Boolean value.

string.name: writeByte
string.tiptext: Writes a byte.

string.name: writeShort
string.tiptext: Writes a 16-bit integer.

string.name: writeInt
string.tiptext: Writes a 32-bit signed integer.

string.name: writeUnsignedInt
string.tiptext: Writes a 32-bit unsigned integer.

string.name: writeFloat
string.tiptext: Writes an IEEE 754 single-precision (32-bit) floating point number.

string.name: writeDouble
string.tiptext: Writes an IEEE 754 double-precision (64-bit) floating point number.

string.name: writeMultiByte
string.tiptext: Writes a multibyte string to the byte stream using the specified character set.

string.name: writeUTF
string.tiptext: Writes a UTF-8 string to the byte stream.

string.name: writeUTFBytes
string.tiptext: Writes a UTF-8 string.

string.name: writeObject
string.tiptext: Writes an object to the byte stream or byte array in AMF serialized format.

string.name: objectEncoding
string.tiptext: Used to determine whether the ActionScript 3.0, ActionScript 2.0, or ActionScript 1.0 format should be used when writing to, or reading binary data.

string.name: endian
string.tiptext: The byte order for the data, either the "bigEndian" or "littleEndian" constant from the Endian class.

folder.name: IExternalizable
folder.tiptext: The IExternalizable interface provides control over serialization of a class as it is encoded into a data stream.

string.name: writeExternal
string.tiptext: A class implements this method to encode itself for a data stream by calling the methods of the IDataOutput interface.

string.name: readExternal
string.tiptext: A class implements this method to decode itself from a data stream by calling the methods of the IDataInput interface.

string.name: describeType
string.tiptext: Produces an XML object that describes the ActionScript object named as the parameter of the method.

string.name: getQualifiedClassName
string.tiptext: Returns the fully qualified class name of an object.

string.name: getDefinitionByName
string.tiptext: Returns a reference to the class object of the class specified by the name parameter.

string.name: getQualifiedSuperclassName
string.tiptext: Returns the fully qualified class name of the base class of the object specified by the value parameter.

string.name: getTimer
string.tiptext: Returns the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since Flash Player was initialized, and is used to compute relative time.

string.name: escapeMultiByte
string.tiptext: Returns an escaped copy of the input string encoded as either UTF-8 or system code page, depending on the value of System.useCodePage.

string.name: unescapeMultiByte
string.tiptext: Returns an unescaped copy of the input string, which is decoded from either system code page page or UTF-8 depending on the value of System.useCodePage.

string.name: setInterval
string.tiptext: Runs a function at a specified interval (in milliseconds).

string.name: setTimeout
string.tiptext: Runs a specified function after a specified delay (in milliseconds).

string.name: clearInterval
string.tiptext: Cancels a specified setInterval() call.

string.name: clearTimeout
string.tiptext: Cancels a specified setTimeout() call.

folder.name: Proxy
folder.tiptext: The Proxy class lets you override the default behavior of ActionScript operations (such as retrieving and modifying properties) on an object.

string.name: getProperty
string.tiptext: Overrides any request for a property's value.

string.name: setProperty
string.tiptext: Overrides a call to change a property's value.

string.name: callProperty
string.tiptext: Overrides the behavior of an object property that can be called as a function.

string.name: hasProperty
string.tiptext: Overrides a request to check whether an object has a particular property by name.

string.name: deleteProperty
string.tiptext: Overrides the request to delete a property.

string.name: getDescendants
string.tiptext: Overrides the use of the descendant operator.

string.name: nextNameIndex
string.tiptext: Allows enumeration of the proxied object's properties by index number.

string.name: nextName
string.tiptext: Allows enumeration of the proxied object's properties by index number to retrieve property names.

string.name: nextValue
string.tiptext: Allows enumeration of the proxied object's properties by index number to retrieve property values.

string.name: isAttribute
string.tiptext: Checks whether a supplied QName is also marked as an attribute.

folder.name: Timer
folder.tiptext: The Timer class is the interface to Flash Player timers.

string.name: Timer
string.tiptext: Constructs a new Timer object with the specified delay and repeatCount states.

string.name: start
string.tiptext: Starts the timer, if it is not already running.

string.name: reset
string.tiptext: Stops the timer, if it is running, and sets the currentCount property back to 0, like the reset button of a stopwatch.

string.name: stop
string.tiptext: Stops the timer.

string.name: delay
string.tiptext: The delay, in milliseconds, between timer events.

string.name: repeatCount
string.tiptext: The total number of times the timer is set to run.

string.name: currentCount
string.tiptext: The total number of times the timer has fired since it started at zero.

string.name: running
string.tiptext: The timer's current state; true if the timer is running, otherwise false.

string.name: timer
string.tiptext: Dispatched whenever a Timer object reaches an interval specified according to the Timer.delay property.

string.name: timerComplete
string.tiptext: Dispatched whenever it has completed the number of requests set by Timer.repeatCount.

folder.name: XMLDocument
folder.tiptext: The XMLDocument class represents the legacy XML object that was present in ActionScript 2.0.

string.name: XMLDocument
string.tiptext: Creates a new XMLDocument object.

string.name: createElement
string.tiptext: Creates a new XMLNode object with the name specified in the parameter.

string.name: createTextNode
string.tiptext: Creates a new XML text node with the specified text.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Returns a string representation of the XML object.

string.name: parseXML
string.tiptext: Parses the XML text specified in the value parameter and populates the specified XMLDocument object with the resulting XML tree.

string.name: xmlDecl
string.tiptext: A string that specifies information about a document's XML declaration.

string.name: docTypeDecl
string.tiptext: Specifies information about the XML document's DOCTYPE declaration.

string.name: idMap
string.tiptext: An Object containing the nodes of the XML that have an id attribute assigned.

string.name: ignoreWhite
string.tiptext: When set to true, text nodes that contain only white space are discarded during the parsing process.

folder.name: XMLNode
folder.tiptext: The XMLNode class represents the legacy XML object that was present in ActionScript 2.0 and that was renamed in ActionScript 3.0.

string.name: XMLNode
string.tiptext: Creates a new XMLNode object.

string.name: hasChildNodes
string.tiptext: Indicates whether the specified XMLNode object has child nodes.

string.name: cloneNode
string.tiptext: Constructs and returns a new XML node of the same type, name, value, and attributes as the specified XML object.

string.name: removeNode
string.tiptext: Removes the specified XML object from its parent.

string.name: insertBefore
string.tiptext: Inserts a new child node into the XML object's child list, before the beforeNode node.

string.name: appendChild
string.tiptext: Appends the specified node to the XML object's child list.

string.name: toString
string.tiptext: Evaluates the specified XMLNode object, constructs a textual representation of the XML structure, including the node, children, and attributes, and returns the result as a string.

string.name: getNamespaceForPrefix
string.tiptext: Returns the namespace URI that is associated with the specified prefix for the node.

string.name: getPrefixForNamespace
string.tiptext: Returns the prefix that is associated with the specified namespace URI for the node.

string.name: nodeType
string.tiptext: A nodeType constant value, either XMLNodeType.ELEMENT_NODE for an XML element or XMLNodeType.TEXT_NODE for a text node.

string.name: previousSibling
string.tiptext: An XMLNode value that references the previous sibling in the parent node's child list.

string.name: nextSibling
string.tiptext: An XMLNode value that references the next sibling in the parent node's child list.

string.name: parentNode
string.tiptext: An XMLNode value that references the parent node of the specified XML object, or returns null if the node has no parent.

string.name: firstChild
string.tiptext: Evaluates the specified XMLDocument object and references the first child in the parent node's child list.

string.name: lastChild
string.tiptext: An XMLNode value that references the last child in the node's child list.

string.name: nodeName
string.tiptext: A string representing the node name of the XMLNode object.

string.name: nodeValue
string.tiptext: The node value of the XMLDocument object.

string.name: childNodes
string.tiptext: An array of the specified XMLNode object's children.

string.name: attributes
string.tiptext: An object containing all of the attributes of the specified XMLNode instance.

string.name: localName
string.tiptext: The local name portion of the XML node's name.

string.name: prefix
string.tiptext: The prefix portion of the XML node name.

string.name: namespaceURI
string.tiptext: If the XML node has a prefix, namespaceURI is the value of the xmlns declaration for that prefix (the URI), which is typically called the namespace URI.

folder.name: XMLNodeType
folder.tiptext: The XMLNodeType class contains constants used with XMLNode.nodeType.

string.name: ELEMENT_NODE
string.tiptext: Specifies that the node is an element.

string.name: TEXT_NODE
string.tiptext: Specifies that the node is a text node.

folder.name: Language Elements
folder.tiptext: Language elements that perform or specify an action at runtime

folder.name: Statements, Keywords & Directives
folder.tiptext: Statements to be used in expressions

folder.name: statement
folder.tiptext: Language elements that perform or specify an action at runtime.

action.name: break
action.tiptext: Appears within a loop (for , for..in, for each..in, do..while or while) or within a block of statements associated with a particular case within a switch statement.

action.name: case
action.tiptext: Defines a condition for the switch statement.

action.name: continue
action.tiptext: Jumps past all remaining statements in the innermost loop and starts the next iteration of the loop as if control had passed through to the end of the loop normally.

action.name: default
action.tiptext: Defines the default case for a switch statement.

action.name: do..while
action.tiptext: Similar to a while loop, except that the statements are executed once before the initial evaluation of the condition.

action.name: else
action.tiptext: Specifies the statements to run if the condition in the if statement returns false.

action.name: for
action.tiptext: Evaluates the init (initialize) expression once and then starts a looping sequence.

action.name: for..in
action.tiptext: Iterates over the properties of an object or elements in an array and executes the statement for each property or element.

action.name: for each..in
action.tiptext: Iterates over the items in a collection.

action.name: if
action.tiptext: Evaluates a condition to determine the next action in a SWF file.

action.name: label
action.tiptext: Associates a statement with an identifier that can be referenced by break or continue.

action.name: return
action.tiptext: Returns from a function, optionally specifying a return value.

string.name: super
string.tiptext: Invokes the superclass version of a method or constructor.

action.name: switch
action.tiptext: Causes control to transfer to one of several statements, depending on the value of an expression.

action.name: throw
action.tiptext: Generates, or throws , an error that can be handled, or caught , by a catch{} code block.

action.name: try
action.tiptext: Try a block of code with exception handling

action.name: catch
action.tiptext: Catches an exception

action.name: finally
action.tiptext: Executes code after exception handling

string.name: try..catch..finally
string.tiptext: Enclose a block of code in which an error can occur, and then respond to the error.

action.name: evaluate
action.tiptext: Evaluates an arbitrary expression

action.name: while
action.tiptext: Evaluates a condition and if the condition evaluates to true , executes a statement or series of statements before looping back to evaluate the condition again.

action.name: with
action.tiptext: Establishes a default object to be used for the execution of a statement or statements.

folder.name: definition keyword
folder.tiptext: Used to define entities such as variables, functions, classes, and interfaces.

action.name: class
action.tiptext: Defines a class, which lets you instantiate objects that share methods and properties that you define.

string.name: extends
string.tiptext: Defines a class that is a subclass of another class.

action.name: function
action.tiptext: Comprises a set of statements that you define to perform a certain task.

string.name: get
string.tiptext: Defines a read accessor, a method which can be read like a property.

string.name: implements
string.tiptext: Specifies that a class must define all the methods declared in the interface (or interfaces) being implemented.

action.name: interface
action.tiptext: Defines an interface.

string.name: package
string.tiptext: Allows you to organize your code into discrete groups that can be imported by other scripts.

string.name: namespace
string.tiptext: Allows you to control the visibility of definitions.

string.name: ... (rest) parameter
string.tiptext: Specifies that a function will accept any number of comma-delimited arguments.

string.name: set
string.tiptext: Defines a setter, which is a method that appears in the public interface as a property.

string.name: const
string.tiptext: Specifies a constant, which is a variable that can only be assigned a value once.

action.name: var
action.tiptext: Specifies a variable.

folder.name: directive
folder.tiptext: Statements and definitions that can have an effect at compile time or runtime.

string.name: default xml namespace
string.tiptext: The default xml namespace statement sets the default namespace to use for XML objects.

action.name: import
action.tiptext: Makes classes and packages available to your code.

action.name: include
action.tiptext: Includes the contents of the specified file, as if the commands in the file are part of the calling script.

string.name: use namespace
string.tiptext: Causes the specified namespaces to be added to the set of open namespaces.

folder.name: attribute keyword
folder.tiptext: Used to alter the meaning of definitions, and can be applied to class, variable, function, and namespace definitions.

string.name: dynamic
string.tiptext: Specifies that instances of a class may possess dynamic properties added at runtime.

string.name: private
string.tiptext: Specifies that a variable, constant, method or namespace is available only to the class that declares or defines it.

string.name: protected
string.tiptext: Specifies that a variable, constant or method is available only to the class that declares or defines it or to subclasses of that class.

string.name: native
string.tiptext: Specifies that a function or method is implemented by Flash Player in native code.

string.name: internal
string.tiptext: Specifies that a class, variable, constant or function is available to any caller within the same package.

string.name: override
string.tiptext: Specifies that a method replaces (shadows) an inherited method.

string.name: final
string.tiptext: Specifies that a method cannot be overridden.

string.name: public
string.tiptext: Specifies that a class, variable, constant or method is available to any caller.

string.name: static
string.tiptext: Specifies that a variable, constant or method belongs to the class, as opposed to instances of the class.

string.name: this
string.tiptext: A reference to a method's containing object.

string.name: false
string.tiptext: A Boolean value representing false.

string.name: null
string.tiptext: A special value that can be assigned to variables or returned by a function if no data was provided.

string.name: true
string.tiptext: A Boolean value representing true.

string.name: AS3
string.tiptext: Defines methods and properties of the core ActionScript classes that are fixed properties instead of prototype properties.

string.name: flash_proxy
string.tiptext: Defines methods of the Proxy class.

string.name: object_proxy
string.tiptext: Defines methods of the ObjectProxy class.

folder.name: Operators
folder.tiptext: Symbolic operators used to combine, compare, or midify values

string.name: [] (array access)
string.tiptext: Initializes a new array or multidimensional array with the specified elements (a0, and so on), or accesses elements in an array.

string.name: as
string.tiptext: Checks whether expression is compatible with data type datatype.

string.name: , (comma)
string.tiptext: Evaluates expression1, then expression2, and so on.

string.name: ?: (conditional)
string.tiptext: Instructs Flash to evaluate expression1, and if the value of expression1 is true, it returns the value of expression2 ; otherwise it returns the value of expression3.

string.name: delete
string.tiptext: Destroys the object reference specified by the reference parameter, and returns true if the reference is successfully deleted; false otherwise.

string.name: . (dot)
string.tiptext: Used to navigate movie clip hierarchies to access nested (child) movie clips, variables, or properties.

string.name: in
string.tiptext: Checks whether expression1 is a property of expression2.

string.name: instanceof
string.tiptext: Evaluates whether an object belongs to a specific class.

string.name: is
string.tiptext: Checks whether expression1 is compatible with data type expression2.

string.name: :: (name qualifier)
string.tiptext: Used to identify the namespace of a property, a method, an XML property, or an XML attribute.

string.name: new
string.tiptext: Creates a new, initially anonymous, object and calls the function identified by the constructor parameter.

string.name: {} (object initializer)
string.tiptext: Creates a new object and initializes it with the specified name and value property pairs.

string.name: () (parentheses)
string.tiptext: Performs a grouping operation on one or more parameters, performs sequential evaluation of expressions, or surrounds one or more parameters and passes them as parameters to a function outside the parentheses.

string.name: / (RegExp delimiter)
string.tiptext: When used before and after characters, the forward slash character (/) define a regular expression literal.

string.name: : (type)
string.tiptext: Used for strict data typing; this operator specifies the variable type, function return type, or function parameter type.

string.name: typeof
string.tiptext: Evaluate the expression and returns a string specifying its type.

string.name: void
string.tiptext: The void operator evaluates an expression and then discards its value, returning an undefined value.

string.name: && (logical AND)
string.tiptext: Performs a Boolean operation on the values of one or both of the expressions.

string.name: ! (logical NOT)
string.tiptext: Inverts the Boolean value of a variable or expression.

string.name: || (logical OR)
string.tiptext: Evaluates expression1 (the expression on the left side of the operator) and returns true if the expression evaluates to true.

string.name: == (equality)
string.tiptext: Tests two expressions for equality.

string.name: > (greater than)
string.tiptext: Compares two expressions and determines whether expression1 is greater than expression2 ; if it is, the operator returns true.

string.name: >= (greater than or equal to)
string.tiptext: Compares two expressions and determines whether expression1 is greater than or equal to expression2 (true) or expression1 is less than expression2 (false).

string.name: != (inequality)
string.tiptext: Tests for the exact opposite of the equality (==) operator.

string.name: < (less than)
string.tiptext: Compares two expressions and determines whether expression1 is less than expression2 ; if so, the operator returns true.

string.name: <= (less than or equal to)
string.tiptext: Compares two expressions and determines whether expression1 is less than or equal to expression2 ; if it is, the operator returns true.

string.name: === (strict equality)
string.tiptext: Tests two expressions for equality; the strict equality (===) operator performs in the same way as the equality (==) operator, except that data types are not converted.

string.name: !== (strict inequality)
string.tiptext: Tests for the exact opposite of the strict equality (===) operator.

action.name: /*..*/ (block comment delimiter)
action.tiptext: Indicates one or more lines of script comments.

action.name: // (line comment delimiter)
action.tiptext: Indicates the beginning of a script comment.

string.name: + (addition)
string.tiptext: Adds numeric expressions.

string.name: -- (decrement)
string.tiptext: A pre-decrement and post-decrement unary operator that subtracts 1 from the expression.

string.name: / (division)
string.tiptext: Divides expression1 by expression2.

string.name: ++ (increment)
string.tiptext: A pre-increment and post-increment unary operator that adds 1 to expression .

string.name: % (modulo)
string.tiptext: Calculates the remainder of expression1 divided by expression2.

string.name: * (multiplication)
string.tiptext: Multiplies two numerical expressions.

string.name: - (subtraction)
string.tiptext: Used for negating or subtracting.

string.name: += (addition assignment)
string.tiptext: Assigns expression1 the value of expression1 + expression2.

string.name: /= (division assignment)
string.tiptext: Assigns expression1 the value of expression1 / expression2.

string.name: %= (modulo assignment)
string.tiptext: Assigns expression1 the value of expression1 % expression2.

string.name: *= (multiplication assignment)
string.tiptext: Operator (arithmetic compound assignment); assigns expression1 the value of expression1 * expression2.

string.name: -= (subtraction assignment)
string.tiptext: Assigns expression1 the value of expression1 - expression2.

string.name: & (bitwise AND)
string.tiptext: Converts expression1 and expression2 to 32-bit unsigned integers, and performs a Boolean AND operation on each bit of the integer parameters.

string.name: << (bitwise left shift)
string.tiptext: Converts expression1 and expression2 to 32-bit integers, and shifts all the bits in expression1 to the left by the number of places specified by the integer resulting from the conversion of expression2.

string.name: ~ (bitwise NOT)
string.tiptext: Also known as the one's complement operator or the bitwise complement operator.

string.name: | (bitwise OR)
string.tiptext: Converts expression1 and expression2 to 32-bit unsigned integers, and places a 1 in each bit position where the corresponding bits of either expression1 or expression2 are 1.

string.name: >> (bitwise right shift)
string.tiptext: Converts expression1 and expression2 to 32-bit integers, and shifts all the bits in expression1 to the right by the number of places specified by the integer that results from the conversion of expression2.

string.name: >>> (bitwise unsigned right shift)
string.tiptext: The same as the bitwise right shift (>>) operator except that it does not preserve the sign of the original expression because the bits on the left are always filled with 0.

string.name: ^ (bitwise XOR)
string.tiptext: Converts expression1 and expression2 to 32-bit unsigned integers, and returns a 1 in each bit position where the corresponding bits in expression1 or expression2, but not both, are 1.

string.name: &= (bitwise AND assignment)
string.tiptext: Assigns expression1 the value of expression1 & expression2.

string.name: <<= (bitwise left shift and assignment)
string.tiptext: This operator performs a bitwise left shift (<<=) operation and stores the contents as a result in expression1.

string.name: |= (bitwise OR assignment)
string.tiptext: Assigns expression1 the value of expression1 | expression2.

string.name: >>= (bitwise right shift and assignment)
string.tiptext: This operator performs a bitwise right-shift operation and stores the contents as a result in expression1.

string.name: >>>= (bitwise unsigned right shift and assignment)
string.tiptext: Performs an unsigned bitwise right-shift operation and stores the contents as a result in expression1.

string.name: ^= (bitwise XOR assignment)
string.tiptext: Assigns expression1 the value of expression1 ^ expression2.

string.name: + (concatenation)
string.tiptext: Concatenates (combines) strings.

string.name: += (concatenation assignment)
string.tiptext: Assigns expression1 the value of expression1 + expression2.

string.name: " (string delimiter)
string.tiptext: When used before and after characters, quotation marks (") indicate that the characters have a literal value.

string.name: = (assignment)
string.tiptext: Assigns the value of expression2 (the parameter on the right) to the variable, array element, or property in expression1.

string.name: @ (attribute identifier)
string.tiptext: Use the XML @ (at sign) operator to identify attributes of an XML or XMLList object.

string.name: { } (braces (XML))
string.tiptext: Use the XML { and } operators to pass data by reference (from other variables) into an XML or XMLList literal.

string.name: [ ] (brackets (XML))
string.tiptext: Accesses a property or attribute of an XML or XMLList object.

string.name: + (concatenation (XMLList))
string.tiptext: Use the XML + (concatenation) operator to concatenate XMLList objects.

string.name: += (concatenation assignment (XMLList))
string.tiptext: Assigns expression1, which is an XMLList object, the value of expression1 + expression2.

string.name: delete (XML)
string.tiptext: Deletes the XML elements or attributes specified.

string.name: .. (descendant accessor)
string.tiptext: Use the XML descendant accessor (..) operator to navigate to descendant elements of an XML or XMLList object, or (combined with the @ operator) to return attributes descendants.

string.name: . (dot (XML))
string.tiptext: Navigates to child elements of an XML or XMLList object, or (combined with the @ operator) returns attributes of an XML or XMLList object.

string.name: ( ) (parentheses (XML))
string.tiptext: Use the ( and ) operators to evaluate an expression in an E4X XML construct.

string.name: < > (XML literal tag delimiter)
string.tiptext: Use the < and > operators to define an XML tag in an XML literal.
Specifies that a property is untyped.

string.name: void
string.tiptext: Specifies that a function cannot return any value.

string.name: Null
string.tiptext: A special data type that represents the lack of a value.
